2628 mddev_suspend(mddev);
2629 err = mddev->pers->hot_add_disk(mddev, rdev);
2630 if (add_journal)
2631 mddev_resume(mddev);
2632 if (err) {
2633 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
2634 return err;
2635 }
2636 }
2637 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
2638
2639 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
2640 if (mddev->degraded)
2641 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
2642 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
2643 md_new_event(mddev);
2644 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
2645 return 0;
2646}
2647
2648/* words written to sysfs files may, or may not, be \n terminated.
2649 * We want to accept with case. For this we use cmd_match.
2650 */
2651static int cmd_match(const char *cmd, const char *str)
2652{
2653 /* See if cmd, written into a sysfs file, matches
2654 * str. They must either be the same, or cmd can
2655 * have a trailing newline
2656 */
2657 while (*cmd && *str && *cmd == *str) {
2658 cmd++;
2659 str++;
2660 }
2661 if (*cmd == '\n')
2662 cmd++;
2663 if (*str || *cmd)
2664 return 0;
2665 return 1;
2666}
2667
2668struct rdev_sysfs_entry {
2669 struct attribute attr;
2670 ssize_t (*show)(struct md_rdev *, char *);
2671 ssize_t (*store)(struct md_rdev *, const char *, size_t);
2672};
2673
2674static ssize_t
2675state_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
2676{
2677 char *sep = ",";
2678 size_t len = 0;
2679 unsigned long flags = ACCESS_ONCE(rdev->flags);
2680
2681 if (test_bit(Faulty, &flags) ||
2682 (!test_bit(ExternalBbl, &flags) &&
2683 rdev->badblocks.unacked_exist))
2684 len += sprintf(page+len, "faulty%s", sep);
2685 if (test_bit(In_sync, &flags))
2686 len += sprintf(page+len, "in_sync%s", sep);
2687 if (test_bit(Journal, &flags))
2688 len += sprintf(page+len, "journal%s", sep);
2689 if (test_bit(WriteMostly, &flags))
2690 len += sprintf(page+len, "write_mostly%s", sep);
2691 if (test_bit(Blocked, &flags) ||
2692 (rdev->badblocks.unacked_exist
2693 && !test_bit(Faulty, &flags)))
2694 len += sprintf(page+len, "blocked%s", sep);
2695 if (!test_bit(Faulty, &flags) &&
2696 !test_bit(Journal, &flags) &&
2697 !test_bit(In_sync, &flags))
2698 len += sprintf(page+len, "spare%s", sep);
2699 if (test_bit(WriteErrorSeen, &flags))
2700 len += sprintf(page+len, "write_error%s", sep);
2701 if (test_bit(WantReplacement, &flags))
2702 len += sprintf(page+len, "want_replacement%s", sep);
2703 if (test_bit(Replacement, &flags))
2704 len += sprintf(page+len, "replacement%s", sep);
2705 if (test_bit(ExternalBbl, &flags))
2706 len += sprintf(page+len, "external_bbl%s", sep);
2707 if (test_bit(FailFast, &flags))
2708 len += sprintf(page+len, "failfast%s", sep);
2709
2710 if (len)
2711 len -= strlen(sep);
2712
2713 return len+sprintf(page+len, "\n");
2714}
2715
2716static ssize_t
2717state_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
2718{
2719 /* can write
2720 * faulty - simulates an error
2721 * remove - disconnects the device
2722 * writemostly - sets write_mostly
2723 * -writemostly - clears write_mostly
2724 * blocked - sets the Blocked flags
2725 * -blocked - clears the Blocked and possibly simulates an error
2726 * insync - sets Insync providing device isn't active
2727 * -insync - clear Insync for a device with a slot assigned,
2728 * so that it gets rebuilt based on bitmap
2729 * write_error - sets WriteErrorSeen
2730 * -write_error - clears WriteErrorSeen
2731 * {,-}failfast - set/clear FailFast
2732 */
2733 int err = -EINVAL;
2734 if (cmd_match(buf, "faulty") && rdev->mddev->pers) {
2735 md_error(rdev->mddev, rdev);
2736 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
2737 err = 0;
2738 else
2739 err = -EBUSY;
2740 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "remove")) {
2741 if (rdev->mddev->pers) {
2742 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
2743 remove_and_add_spares(rdev->mddev, rdev);
2744 }
2745 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
2746 err = -EBUSY;
2747 else {
2748 struct mddev *mddev = rdev->mddev;
2749 err = 0;
2750 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
2751 err = md_cluster_ops->remove_disk(mddev, rdev);
2752
2753 if (err == 0) {
2754 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
2755 if (mddev->pers) {
2756 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
2757 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
2758 }
2759 md_new_event(mddev);
2760 }
2761 }
2762 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "writemostly")) {
2763 set_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
2764 err = 0;
2765 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-writemostly")) {
2766 clear_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
2767 err = 0;
2768 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "blocked")) {
2769 set_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
2770 err = 0;
2771 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-blocked")) {
2772 if (!test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
2773 !test_bit(ExternalBbl, &rdev->flags) &&
2774 rdev->badblocks.unacked_exist) {
2775 /* metadata handler doesn't understand badblocks,
2776 * so we need to fail the device
2777 */
2778 md_error(rdev->mddev, rdev);
2779 }
2780 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
2781 clear_bit(BlockedBadBlocks, &rdev->flags);
2782 wake_up(&rdev->blocked_wait);
2783 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &rdev->mddev->recovery);
2784 md_wakeup_thread(rdev->mddev->thread);
2785
2786 err = 0;
2787 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "insync") && rdev->raid_disk == -1) {
2788 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
2789 err = 0;
2790 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "failfast")) {
2791 set_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags);
2792 err = 0;
2793 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-failfast")) {
2794 clear_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags);
2795 err = 0;
2796 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-insync") && rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
2797 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
2798 if (rdev->mddev->pers == NULL) {
2799 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
2800 rdev->saved_raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
2801 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
2802 err = 0;
2803 }
2804 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "write_error")) {
2805 set_bit(WriteErrorSeen, &rdev->flags);
2806 err = 0;
2807 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-write_error")) {
2808 clear_bit(WriteErrorSeen, &rdev->flags);
2809 err = 0;
2810 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "want_replacement")) {
2811 /* Any non-spare device that is not a replacement can
2812 * become want_replacement at any time, but we then need to
2813 * check if recovery is needed.
2814 */
2815 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
2816 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) &&
2817 !test_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags))
2818 set_bit(WantReplacement, &rdev->flags);
2819 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &rdev->mddev->recovery);
2820 md_wakeup_thread(rdev->mddev->thread);
2821 err = 0;
2822 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-want_replacement")) {
2823 /* Clearing 'want_replacement' is always allowed.
2824 * Once replacements starts it is too late though.
2825 */
2826 err = 0;
2827 clear_bit(WantReplacement, &rdev->flags);
2828 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "replacement")) {
2829 /* Can only set a device as a replacement when array has not
2830 * yet been started. Once running, replacement is automatic
2831 * from spares, or by assigning 'slot'.
2832 */
2833 if (rdev->mddev->pers)
2834 err = -EBUSY;
2835 else {
2836 set_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags);
2837 err = 0;
2838 }
2839 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-replacement")) {
2840 /* Similarly, can only clear Replacement before start */
2841 if (rdev->mddev->pers)
2842 err = -EBUSY;
2843 else {
2844 clear_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags);
2845 err = 0;
2846 }
2847 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "re-add")) {
2848 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) && (rdev->raid_disk == -1) &&
2849 rdev->saved_raid_disk >= 0) {
2850 /* clear_bit is performed _after_ all the devices
2851 * have their local Faulty bit cleared. If any writes
2852 * happen in the meantime in the local node, they
2853 * will land in the local bitmap, which will be synced
2854 * by this node eventually
2855 */
2856 if (!mddev_is_clustered(rdev->mddev) ||
2857 (err = md_cluster_ops->gather_bitmaps(rdev)) == 0) {
2858 clear_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags);
2859 err = add_bound_rdev(rdev);
2860 }
2861 } else
2862 err = -EBUSY;
2863 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "external_bbl") && (rdev->mddev->external)) {
2864 set_bit(ExternalBbl, &rdev->flags);
2865 rdev->badblocks.shift = 0;
2866 err = 0;
2867 } else if (cmd_match(buf, "-external_bbl") && (rdev->mddev->external)) {
2868 clear_bit(ExternalBbl, &rdev->flags);
2869 err = 0;
2870 }
2871 if (!err)
2872 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
2873 return err ? err : len;
2874}
2875static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_state =
2876__ATTR_PREALLOC(state, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, state_show, state_store);
2877
2878static ssize_t
2879errors_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
2880{
2881 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", atomic_read(&rdev->corrected_errors));
2882}
2883
2884static ssize_t
2885errors_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
2886{
2887 unsigned int n;
2888 int rv;
2889
2890 rv = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &n);
2891 if (rv < 0)
2892 return rv;
2893 atomic_set(&rdev->corrected_errors, n);
2894 return len;
2895}
2896static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_errors =
2897__ATTR(errors, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, errors_show, errors_store);
2898
2899static ssize_t
2900slot_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
2901{
2902 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
2903 return sprintf(page, "journal\n");
2904 else if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
2905 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
2906 else
2907 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", rdev->raid_disk);
2908}
2909
2910static ssize_t
2911slot_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
2912{
2913 int slot;
2914 int err;
2915
2916 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
2917 return -EBUSY;
2918 if (strncmp(buf, "none", 4)==0)
2919 slot = -1;
2920 else {
2921 err = kstrtouint(buf, 10, (unsigned int *)&slot);
2922 if (err < 0)
2923 return err;
2924 }
2925 if (rdev->mddev->pers && slot == -1) {
2926 /* Setting 'slot' on an active array requires also
2927 * updating the 'rd%d' link, and communicating
2928 * with the personality with ->hot_*_disk.
2929 * For now we only support removing
2930 * failed/spare devices. This normally happens automatically,
2931 * but not when the metadata is externally managed.
2932 */
2933 if (rdev->raid_disk == -1)
2934 return -EEXIST;
2935 /* personality does all needed checks */
2936 if (rdev->mddev->pers->hot_remove_disk == NULL)
2937 return -EINVAL;
2938 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
2939 remove_and_add_spares(rdev->mddev, rdev);
2940 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
2941 return -EBUSY;
2942 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &rdev->mddev->recovery);
2943 md_wakeup_thread(rdev->mddev->thread);
2944 } else if (rdev->mddev->pers) {
2945 /* Activating a spare .. or possibly reactivating
2946 * if we ever get bitmaps working here.
2947 */
2948 int err;
2949
2950 if (rdev->raid_disk != -1)
2951 return -EBUSY;
2952
2953 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &rdev->mddev->recovery))
2954 return -EBUSY;
2955
2956 if (rdev->mddev->pers->hot_add_disk == NULL)
2957 return -EINVAL;
2958
2959 if (slot >= rdev->mddev->raid_disks &&
2960 slot >= rdev->mddev->raid_disks + rdev->mddev->delta_disks)
2961 return -ENOSPC;
2962
2963 rdev->raid_disk = slot;
2964 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
2965 rdev->saved_raid_disk = slot;
2966 else
2967 rdev->saved_raid_disk = -1;
2968 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
2969 clear_bit(Bitmap_sync, &rdev->flags);
2970 err = rdev->mddev->pers->
2971 hot_add_disk(rdev->mddev, rdev);
2972 if (err) {
2973 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
2974 return err;
2975 } else
2976 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
2977 if (sysfs_link_rdev(rdev->mddev, rdev))
2978 /* failure here is OK */;
2979 /* don't wakeup anyone, leave that to userspace. */
2980 } else {
2981 if (slot >= rdev->mddev->raid_disks &&
2982 slot >= rdev->mddev->raid_disks + rdev->mddev->delta_disks)
2983 return -ENOSPC;
2984 rdev->raid_disk = slot;
2985 /* assume it is working */
2986 clear_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags);
2987 clear_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
2988 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
2989 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
2990 }
2991 return len;
2992}
2993
2994static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_slot =
2995__ATTR(slot, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, slot_show, slot_store);
2996
2997static ssize_t
2998offset_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
2999{
3000 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)rdev->data_offset);
3001}
3002
3003static ssize_t
3004offset_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3005{
3006 unsigned long long offset;
3007 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &offset) < 0)
3008 return -EINVAL;
3009 if (rdev->mddev->pers && rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
3010 return -EBUSY;
3011 if (rdev->sectors && rdev->mddev->external)
3012 /* Must set offset before size, so overlap checks
3013 * can be sane */
3014 return -EBUSY;
3015 rdev->data_offset = offset;
3016 rdev->new_data_offset = offset;
3017 return len;
3018}
3019
3020static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_offset =
3021__ATTR(offset, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, offset_show, offset_store);
3022
3023static ssize_t new_offset_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3024{
3025 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
3026 (unsigned long long)rdev->new_data_offset);
3027}
3028
3029static ssize_t new_offset_store(struct md_rdev *rdev,
3030 const char *buf, size_t len)
3031{
3032 unsigned long long new_offset;
3033 struct mddev *mddev = rdev->mddev;
3034
3035 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &new_offset) < 0)
3036 return -EINVAL;
3037
3038 if (mddev->sync_thread ||
3039 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING,&mddev->recovery))
3040 return -EBUSY;
3041 if (new_offset == rdev->data_offset)
3042 /* reset is always permitted */
3043 ;
3044 else if (new_offset > rdev->data_offset) {
3045 /* must not push array size beyond rdev_sectors */
3046 if (new_offset - rdev->data_offset
3047 + mddev->dev_sectors > rdev->sectors)
3048 return -E2BIG;
3049 }
3050 /* Metadata worries about other space details. */
3051
3052 /* decreasing the offset is inconsistent with a backwards
3053 * reshape.
3054 */
3055 if (new_offset < rdev->data_offset &&
3056 mddev->reshape_backwards)
3057 return -EINVAL;
3058 /* Increasing offset is inconsistent with forwards
3059 * reshape. reshape_direction should be set to
3060 * 'backwards' first.
3061 */
3062 if (new_offset > rdev->data_offset &&
3063 !mddev->reshape_backwards)
3064 return -EINVAL;
3065
3066 if (mddev->pers && mddev->persistent &&
3067 !super_types[mddev->major_version]
3068 .allow_new_offset(rdev, new_offset))
3069 return -E2BIG;
3070 rdev->new_data_offset = new_offset;
3071 if (new_offset > rdev->data_offset)
3072 mddev->reshape_backwards = 1;
3073 else if (new_offset < rdev->data_offset)
3074 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
3075
3076 return len;
3077}
3078static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_new_offset =
3079__ATTR(new_offset, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, new_offset_show, new_offset_store);
3080
3081static ssize_t
3082rdev_size_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3083{
3084 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)rdev->sectors / 2);
3085}
3086
3087static int overlaps(sector_t s1, sector_t l1, sector_t s2, sector_t l2)
3088{
3089 /* check if two start/length pairs overlap */
3090 if (s1+l1 <= s2)
3091 return 0;
3092 if (s2+l2 <= s1)
3093 return 0;
3094 return 1;
3095}
3096
3097static int strict_blocks_to_sectors(const char *buf, sector_t *sectors)
3098{
3099 unsigned long long blocks;
3100 sector_t new;
3101
3102 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &blocks) < 0)
3103 return -EINVAL;
3104
3105 if (blocks & 1ULL << (8 * sizeof(blocks) - 1))
3106 return -EINVAL; /* sector conversion overflow */
3107
3108 new = blocks * 2;
3109 if (new != blocks * 2)
3110 return -EINVAL; /* unsigned long long to sector_t overflow */
3111
3112 *sectors = new;
3113 return 0;
3114}
3115
3116static ssize_t
3117rdev_size_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3118{
3119 struct mddev *my_mddev = rdev->mddev;
3120 sector_t oldsectors = rdev->sectors;
3121 sector_t sectors;
3122
3123 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
3124 return -EBUSY;
3125 if (strict_blocks_to_sectors(buf, &sectors) < 0)
3126 return -EINVAL;
3127 if (rdev->data_offset != rdev->new_data_offset)
3128 return -EINVAL; /* too confusing */
3129 if (my_mddev->pers && rdev->raid_disk >= 0) {
3130 if (my_mddev->persistent) {
3131 sectors = super_types[my_mddev->major_version].
3132 rdev_size_change(rdev, sectors);
3133 if (!sectors)
3134 return -EBUSY;
3135 } else if (!sectors)
3136 sectors = (i_size_read(rdev->bdev->bd_inode) >> 9) -
3137 rdev->data_offset;
3138 if (!my_mddev->pers->resize)
3139 /* Cannot change size for RAID0 or Linear etc */
3140 return -EINVAL;
3141 }
3142 if (sectors < my_mddev->dev_sectors)
3143 return -EINVAL; /* component must fit device */
3144
3145 rdev->sectors = sectors;
3146 if (sectors > oldsectors && my_mddev->external) {
3147 /* Need to check that all other rdevs with the same
3148 * ->bdev do not overlap. 'rcu' is sufficient to walk
3149 * the rdev lists safely.
3150 * This check does not provide a hard guarantee, it
3151 * just helps avoid dangerous mistakes.
3152 */
3153 struct mddev *mddev;
3154 int overlap = 0;
3155 struct list_head *tmp;
3156
3157 rcu_read_lock();
3158 for_each_mddev(mddev, tmp) {
3159 struct md_rdev *rdev2;
3160
3161 rdev_for_each(rdev2, mddev)
3162 if (rdev->bdev == rdev2->bdev &&
3163 rdev != rdev2 &&
3164 overlaps(rdev->data_offset, rdev->sectors,
3165 rdev2->data_offset,
3166 rdev2->sectors)) {
3167 overlap = 1;
3168 break;
3169 }
3170 if (overlap) {
3171 mddev_put(mddev);
3172 break;
3173 }
3174 }
3175 rcu_read_unlock();
3176 if (overlap) {
3177 /* Someone else could have slipped in a size
3178 * change here, but doing so is just silly.
3179 * We put oldsectors back because we *know* it is
3180 * safe, and trust userspace not to race with
3181 * itself
3182 */
3183 rdev->sectors = oldsectors;
3184 return -EBUSY;
3185 }
3186 }
3187 return len;
3188}
3189
3190static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_size =
3191__ATTR(size, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, rdev_size_show, rdev_size_store);
3192
3193static ssize_t recovery_start_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3194{
3195 unsigned long long recovery_start = rdev->recovery_offset;
3196
3197 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) ||
3198 recovery_start == MaxSector)
3199 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
3200
3201 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", recovery_start);
3202}
3203
3204static ssize_t recovery_start_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3205{
3206 unsigned long long recovery_start;
3207
3208 if (cmd_match(buf, "none"))
3209 recovery_start = MaxSector;
3210 else if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &recovery_start))
3211 return -EINVAL;
3212
3213 if (rdev->mddev->pers &&
3214 rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
3215 return -EBUSY;
3216
3217 rdev->recovery_offset = recovery_start;
3218 if (recovery_start == MaxSector)
3219 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
3220 else
3221 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
3222 return len;
3223}
3224
3225static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_recovery_start =
3226__ATTR(recovery_start, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, recovery_start_show, recovery_start_store);
3227
3228/* sysfs access to bad-blocks list.
3229 * We present two files.
3230 * 'bad-blocks' lists sector numbers and lengths of ranges that
3231 * are recorded as bad. The list is truncated to fit within
3232 * the one-page limit of sysfs.
3233 * Writing "sector length" to this file adds an acknowledged
3234 * bad block list.
3235 * 'unacknowledged-bad-blocks' lists bad blocks that have not yet
3236 * been acknowledged. Writing to this file adds bad blocks
3237 * without acknowledging them. This is largely for testing.
3238 */
3239static ssize_t bb_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3240{
3241 return badblocks_show(&rdev->badblocks, page, 0);
3242}
3243static ssize_t bb_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *page, size_t len)
3244{
3245 int rv = badblocks_store(&rdev->badblocks, page, len, 0);
3246 /* Maybe that ack was all we needed */
3247 if (test_and_clear_bit(BlockedBadBlocks, &rdev->flags))
3248 wake_up(&rdev->blocked_wait);
3249 return rv;
3250}
3251static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_bad_blocks =
3252__ATTR(bad_blocks, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, bb_show, bb_store);
3253
3254static ssize_t ubb_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3255{
3256 return badblocks_show(&rdev->badblocks, page, 1);
3257}
3258static ssize_t ubb_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *page, size_t len)
3259{
3260 return badblocks_store(&rdev->badblocks, page, len, 1);
3261}
3262static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_unack_bad_blocks =
3263__ATTR(unacknowledged_bad_blocks, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, ubb_show, ubb_store);
3264
3265static ssize_t
3266ppl_sector_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3267{
3268 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)rdev->ppl.sector);
3269}
3270
3271static ssize_t
3272ppl_sector_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3273{
3274 unsigned long long sector;
3275
3276 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &sector) < 0)
3277 return -EINVAL;
3278 if (sector != (sector_t)sector)
3279 return -EINVAL;
3280
3281 if (rdev->mddev->pers && test_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &rdev->mddev->flags) &&
3282 rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
3283 return -EBUSY;
3284
3285 if (rdev->mddev->persistent) {
3286 if (rdev->mddev->major_version == 0)
3287 return -EINVAL;
3288 if ((sector > rdev->sb_start &&
3289 sector - rdev->sb_start > S16_MAX) ||
3290 (sector < rdev->sb_start &&
3291 rdev->sb_start - sector > -S16_MIN))
3292 return -EINVAL;
3293 rdev->ppl.offset = sector - rdev->sb_start;
3294 } else if (!rdev->mddev->external) {
3295 return -EBUSY;
3296 }
3297 rdev->ppl.sector = sector;
3298 return len;
3299}
3300
3301static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_ppl_sector =
3302__ATTR(ppl_sector, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, ppl_sector_show, ppl_sector_store);
3303
3304static ssize_t
3305ppl_size_show(struct md_rdev *rdev, char *page)
3306{
3307 return sprintf(page, "%u\n", rdev->ppl.size);
3308}
3309
3310static ssize_t
3311ppl_size_store(struct md_rdev *rdev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3312{
3313 unsigned int size;
3314
3315 if (kstrtouint(buf, 10, &size) < 0)
3316 return -EINVAL;
3317
3318 if (rdev->mddev->pers && test_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &rdev->mddev->flags) &&
3319 rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
3320 return -EBUSY;
3321
3322 if (rdev->mddev->persistent) {
3323 if (rdev->mddev->major_version == 0)
3324 return -EINVAL;
3325 if (size > U16_MAX)
3326 return -EINVAL;
3327 } else if (!rdev->mddev->external) {
3328 return -EBUSY;
3329 }
3330 rdev->ppl.size = size;
3331 return len;
3332}
3333
3334static struct rdev_sysfs_entry rdev_ppl_size =
3335__ATTR(ppl_size, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, ppl_size_show, ppl_size_store);
3336
3337static struct attribute *rdev_default_attrs[] = {
3338 &rdev_state.attr,
3339 &rdev_errors.attr,
3340 &rdev_slot.attr,
3341 &rdev_offset.attr,
3342 &rdev_new_offset.attr,
3343 &rdev_size.attr,
3344 &rdev_recovery_start.attr,
3345 &rdev_bad_blocks.attr,
3346 &rdev_unack_bad_blocks.attr,
3347 &rdev_ppl_sector.attr,
3348 &rdev_ppl_size.attr,
3349 NULL,
3350};
3351static ssize_t
3352rdev_attr_show(struct kobject *kobj, struct attribute *attr, char *page)
3353{
3354 struct rdev_sysfs_entry *entry = container_of(attr, struct rdev_sysfs_entry, attr);
3355 struct md_rdev *rdev = container_of(kobj, struct md_rdev, kobj);
3356
3357 if (!entry->show)
3358 return -EIO;
3359 if (!rdev->mddev)
3360 return -EBUSY;
3361 return entry->show(rdev, page);
3362}
3363
3364static ssize_t
3365rdev_attr_store(struct kobject *kobj, struct attribute *attr,
3366 const char *page, size_t length)
3367{
3368 struct rdev_sysfs_entry *entry = container_of(attr, struct rdev_sysfs_entry, attr);
3369 struct md_rdev *rdev = container_of(kobj, struct md_rdev, kobj);
3370 ssize_t rv;
3371 struct mddev *mddev = rdev->mddev;
3372
3373 if (!entry->store)
3374 return -EIO;
3375 if (!capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
3376 return -EACCES;
3377 rv = mddev ? mddev_lock(mddev): -EBUSY;
3378 if (!rv) {
3379 if (rdev->mddev == NULL)
3380 rv = -EBUSY;
3381 else
3382 rv = entry->store(rdev, page, length);
3383 mddev_unlock(mddev);
3384 }
3385 return rv;
3386}
3387
3388static void rdev_free(struct kobject *ko)
3389{
3390 struct md_rdev *rdev = container_of(ko, struct md_rdev, kobj);
3391 kfree(rdev);
3392}
3393static const struct sysfs_ops rdev_sysfs_ops = {
3394 .show = rdev_attr_show,
3395 .store = rdev_attr_store,
3396};
3397static struct kobj_type rdev_ktype = {
3398 .release = rdev_free,
3399 .sysfs_ops = &rdev_sysfs_ops,
3400 .default_attrs = rdev_default_attrs,
3401};
3402
3403int md_rdev_init(struct md_rdev *rdev)
3404{
3405 rdev->desc_nr = -1;
3406 rdev->saved_raid_disk = -1;
3407 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
3408 rdev->flags = 0;
3409 rdev->data_offset = 0;
3410 rdev->new_data_offset = 0;
3411 rdev->sb_events = 0;
3412 rdev->last_read_error = 0;
3413 rdev->sb_loaded = 0;
3414 rdev->bb_page = NULL;
3415 atomic_set(&rdev->nr_pending, 0);
3416 atomic_set(&rdev->read_errors, 0);
3417 atomic_set(&rdev->corrected_errors, 0);
3418
3419 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rdev->same_set);
3420 init_waitqueue_head(&rdev->blocked_wait);
3421
3422 /* Add space to store bad block list.
3423 * This reserves the space even on arrays where it cannot
3424 * be used - I wonder if that matters
3425 */
3426 return badblocks_init(&rdev->badblocks, 0);
3427}
3428EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_rdev_init);
3429/*
3430 * Import a device. If 'super_format' >= 0, then sanity check the superblock
3431 *
3432 * mark the device faulty if:
3433 *
3434 * - the device is nonexistent (zero size)
3435 * - the device has no valid superblock
3436 *
3437 * a faulty rdev _never_ has rdev->sb set.
3438 */
3439static struct md_rdev *md_import_device(dev_t newdev, int super_format, int super_minor)
3440{
3441 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
3442 int err;
3443 struct md_rdev *rdev;
3444 sector_t size;
3445
3446 rdev = kzalloc(sizeof(*rdev), GFP_KERNEL);
3447 if (!rdev)
3448 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
3449
3450 err = md_rdev_init(rdev);
3451 if (err)
3452 goto abort_free;
3453 err = alloc_disk_sb(rdev);
3454 if (err)
3455 goto abort_free;
3456
3457 err = lock_rdev(rdev, newdev, super_format == -2);
3458 if (err)
3459 goto abort_free;
3460
3461 kobject_init(&rdev->kobj, &rdev_ktype);
3462
3463 size = i_size_read(rdev->bdev->bd_inode) >> BLOCK_SIZE_BITS;
3464 if (!size) {
3465 pr_warn("md: %s has zero or unknown size, marking faulty!\n",
3466 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
3467 err = -EINVAL;
3468 goto abort_free;
3469 }
3470
3471 if (super_format >= 0) {
3472 err = super_types[super_format].
3473 load_super(rdev, NULL, super_minor);
3474 if (err == -EINVAL) {
3475 pr_warn("md: %s does not have a valid v%d.%d superblock, not importing!\n",
3476 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b),
3477 super_format, super_minor);
3478 goto abort_free;
3479 }
3480 if (err < 0) {
3481 pr_warn("md: could not read %s's sb, not importing!\n",
3482 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
3483 goto abort_free;
3484 }
3485 }
3486
3487 return rdev;
3488
3489abort_free:
3490 if (rdev->bdev)
3491 unlock_rdev(rdev);
3492 md_rdev_clear(rdev);
3493 kfree(rdev);
3494 return ERR_PTR(err);
3495}
3496
3497/*
3498 * Check a full RAID array for plausibility
3499 */
3500
3501static void analyze_sbs(struct mddev *mddev)
3502{
3503 int i;
3504 struct md_rdev *rdev, *freshest, *tmp;
3505 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
3506
3507 freshest = NULL;
3508 rdev_for_each_safe(rdev, tmp, mddev)
3509 switch (super_types[mddev->major_version].
3510 load_super(rdev, freshest, mddev->minor_version)) {
3511 case 1:
3512 freshest = rdev;
3513 break;
3514 case 0:
3515 break;
3516 default:
3517 pr_warn("md: fatal superblock inconsistency in %s -- removing from array\n",
3518 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
3519 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
3520 }
3521
3522 super_types[mddev->major_version].
3523 validate_super(mddev, freshest);
3524
3525 i = 0;
3526 rdev_for_each_safe(rdev, tmp, mddev) {
3527 if (mddev->max_disks &&
3528 (rdev->desc_nr >= mddev->max_disks ||
3529 i > mddev->max_disks)) {
3530 pr_warn("md: %s: %s: only %d devices permitted\n",
3531 mdname(mddev), bdevname(rdev->bdev, b),
3532 mddev->max_disks);
3533 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
3534 continue;
3535 }
3536 if (rdev != freshest) {
3537 if (super_types[mddev->major_version].
3538 validate_super(mddev, rdev)) {
3539 pr_warn("md: kicking non-fresh %s from array!\n",
3540 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
3541 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
3542 continue;
3543 }
3544 }
3545 if (mddev->level == LEVEL_MULTIPATH) {
3546 rdev->desc_nr = i++;
3547 rdev->raid_disk = rdev->desc_nr;
3548 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
3549 } else if (rdev->raid_disk >=
3550 (mddev->raid_disks - min(0, mddev->delta_disks)) &&
3551 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
3552 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
3553 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
3554 }
3555 }
3556}
3557
3558/* Read a fixed-point number.
3559 * Numbers in sysfs attributes should be in "standard" units where
3560 * possible, so time should be in seconds.
3561 * However we internally use a a much smaller unit such as
3562 * milliseconds or jiffies.
3563 * This function takes a decimal number with a possible fractional
3564 * component, and produces an integer which is the result of
3565 * multiplying that number by 10^'scale'.
3566 * all without any floating-point arithmetic.
3567 */
3568int strict_strtoul_scaled(const char *cp, unsigned long *res, int scale)
3569{
3570 unsigned long result = 0;
3571 long decimals = -1;
3572 while (isdigit(*cp) || (*cp == '.' && decimals < 0)) {
3573 if (*cp == '.')
3574 decimals = 0;
3575 else if (decimals < scale) {
3576 unsigned int value;
3577 value = *cp - '0';
3578 result = result * 10 + value;
3579 if (decimals >= 0)
3580 decimals++;
3581 }
3582 cp++;
3583 }
3584 if (*cp == '\n')
3585 cp++;
3586 if (*cp)
3587 return -EINVAL;
3588 if (decimals < 0)
3589 decimals = 0;
3590 while (decimals < scale) {
3591 result *= 10;
3592 decimals ++;
3593 }
3594 *res = result;
3595 return 0;
3596}
3597
3598static ssize_t
3599safe_delay_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
3600{
3601 int msec = (mddev->safemode_delay*1000)/HZ;
3602 return sprintf(page, "%d.%03d\n", msec/1000, msec%1000);
3603}
3604static ssize_t
3605safe_delay_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *cbuf, size_t len)
3606{
3607 unsigned long msec;
3608
3609 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
3610 pr_warn("md: Safemode is disabled for clustered mode\n");
3611 return -EINVAL;
3612 }
3613
3614 if (strict_strtoul_scaled(cbuf, &msec, 3) < 0)
3615 return -EINVAL;
3616 if (msec == 0)
3617 mddev->safemode_delay = 0;
3618 else {
3619 unsigned long old_delay = mddev->safemode_delay;
3620 unsigned long new_delay = (msec*HZ)/1000;
3621
3622 if (new_delay == 0)
3623 new_delay = 1;
3624 mddev->safemode_delay = new_delay;
3625 if (new_delay < old_delay || old_delay == 0)
3626 mod_timer(&mddev->safemode_timer, jiffies+1);
3627 }
3628 return len;
3629}
3630static struct md_sysfs_entry md_safe_delay =
3631__ATTR(safe_mode_delay, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR,safe_delay_show, safe_delay_store);
3632
3633static ssize_t
3634level_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
3635{
3636 struct md_personality *p;
3637 int ret;
3638 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
3639 p = mddev->pers;
3640 if (p)
3641 ret = sprintf(page, "%s\n", p->name);
3642 else if (mddev->clevel[0])
3643 ret = sprintf(page, "%s\n", mddev->clevel);
3644 else if (mddev->level != LEVEL_NONE)
3645 ret = sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->level);
3646 else
3647 ret = 0;
3648 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
3649 return ret;
3650}
3651
3652static ssize_t
3653level_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3654{
3655 char clevel[16];
3656 ssize_t rv;
3657 size_t slen = len;
3658 struct md_personality *pers, *oldpers;
3659 long level;
3660 void *priv, *oldpriv;
3661 struct md_rdev *rdev;
3662
3663 if (slen == 0 || slen >= sizeof(clevel))
3664 return -EINVAL;
3665
3666 rv = mddev_lock(mddev);
3667 if (rv)
3668 return rv;
3669
3670 if (mddev->pers == NULL) {
3671 strncpy(mddev->clevel, buf, slen);
3672 if (mddev->clevel[slen-1] == '\n')
3673 slen--;
3674 mddev->clevel[slen] = 0;
3675 mddev->level = LEVEL_NONE;
3676 rv = len;
3677 goto out_unlock;
3678 }
3679 rv = -EROFS;
3680 if (mddev->ro)
3681 goto out_unlock;
3682
3683 /* request to change the personality. Need to ensure:
3684 * - array is not engaged in resync/recovery/reshape
3685 * - old personality can be suspended
3686 * - new personality will access other array.
3687 */
3688
3689 rv = -EBUSY;
3690 if (mddev->sync_thread ||
3691 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery) ||
3692 mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector ||
3693 mddev->sysfs_active)
3694 goto out_unlock;
3695
3696 rv = -EINVAL;
3697 if (!mddev->pers->quiesce) {
3698 pr_warn("md: %s: %s does not support online personality change\n",
3699 mdname(mddev), mddev->pers->name);
3700 goto out_unlock;
3701 }
3702
3703 /* Now find the new personality */
3704 strncpy(clevel, buf, slen);
3705 if (clevel[slen-1] == '\n')
3706 slen--;
3707 clevel[slen] = 0;
3708 if (kstrtol(clevel, 10, &level))
3709 level = LEVEL_NONE;
3710
3711 if (request_module("md-%s", clevel) != 0)
3712 request_module("md-level-%s", clevel);
3713 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
3714 pers = find_pers(level, clevel);
3715 if (!pers || !try_module_get(pers->owner)) {
3716 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
3717 pr_warn("md: personality %s not loaded\n", clevel);
3718 rv = -EINVAL;
3719 goto out_unlock;
3720 }
3721 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
3722
3723 if (pers == mddev->pers) {
3724 /* Nothing to do! */
3725 module_put(pers->owner);
3726 rv = len;
3727 goto out_unlock;
3728 }
3729 if (!pers->takeover) {
3730 module_put(pers->owner);
3731 pr_warn("md: %s: %s does not support personality takeover\n",
3732 mdname(mddev), clevel);
3733 rv = -EINVAL;
3734 goto out_unlock;
3735 }
3736
3737 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
3738 rdev->new_raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
3739
3740 /* ->takeover must set new_* and/or delta_disks
3741 * if it succeeds, and may set them when it fails.
3742 */
3743 priv = pers->takeover(mddev);
3744 if (IS_ERR(priv)) {
3745 mddev->new_level = mddev->level;
3746 mddev->new_layout = mddev->layout;
3747 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
3748 mddev->raid_disks -= mddev->delta_disks;
3749 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
3750 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
3751 module_put(pers->owner);
3752 pr_warn("md: %s: %s would not accept array\n",
3753 mdname(mddev), clevel);
3754 rv = PTR_ERR(priv);
3755 goto out_unlock;
3756 }
3757
3758 /* Looks like we have a winner */
3759 mddev_suspend(mddev);
3760 mddev_detach(mddev);
3761
3762 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
3763 oldpers = mddev->pers;
3764 oldpriv = mddev->private;
3765 mddev->pers = pers;
3766 mddev->private = priv;
3767 strlcpy(mddev->clevel, pers->name, sizeof(mddev->clevel));
3768 mddev->level = mddev->new_level;
3769 mddev->layout = mddev->new_layout;
3770 mddev->chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
3771 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
3772 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
3773 mddev->degraded = 0;
3774 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
3775
3776 if (oldpers->sync_request == NULL &&
3777 mddev->external) {
3778 /* We are converting from a no-redundancy array
3779 * to a redundancy array and metadata is managed
3780 * externally so we need to be sure that writes
3781 * won't block due to a need to transition
3782 * clean->dirty
3783 * until external management is started.
3784 */
3785 mddev->in_sync = 0;
3786 mddev->safemode_delay = 0;
3787 mddev->safemode = 0;
3788 }
3789
3790 oldpers->free(mddev, oldpriv);
3791
3792 if (oldpers->sync_request == NULL &&
3793 pers->sync_request != NULL) {
3794 /* need to add the md_redundancy_group */
3795 if (sysfs_create_group(&mddev->kobj, &md_redundancy_group))
3796 pr_warn("md: cannot register extra attributes for %s\n",
3797 mdname(mddev));
3798 mddev->sysfs_action = sysfs_get_dirent(mddev->kobj.sd, "sync_action");
3799 }
3800 if (oldpers->sync_request != NULL &&
3801 pers->sync_request == NULL) {
3802 /* need to remove the md_redundancy_group */
3803 if (mddev->to_remove == NULL)
3804 mddev->to_remove = &md_redundancy_group;
3805 }
3806
3807 module_put(oldpers->owner);
3808
3809 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
3810 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
3811 continue;
3812 if (rdev->new_raid_disk >= mddev->raid_disks)
3813 rdev->new_raid_disk = -1;
3814 if (rdev->new_raid_disk == rdev->raid_disk)
3815 continue;
3816 sysfs_unlink_rdev(mddev, rdev);
3817 }
3818 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
3819 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
3820 continue;
3821 if (rdev->new_raid_disk == rdev->raid_disk)
3822 continue;
3823 rdev->raid_disk = rdev->new_raid_disk;
3824 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
3825 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
3826 else {
3827 if (sysfs_link_rdev(mddev, rdev))
3828 pr_warn("md: cannot register rd%d for %s after level change\n",
3829 rdev->raid_disk, mdname(mddev));
3830 }
3831 }
3832
3833 if (pers->sync_request == NULL) {
3834 /* this is now an array without redundancy, so
3835 * it must always be in_sync
3836 */
3837 mddev->in_sync = 1;
3838 del_timer_sync(&mddev->safemode_timer);
3839 }
3840 blk_set_stacking_limits(&mddev->queue->limits);
3841 pers->run(mddev);
3842 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
3843 mddev_resume(mddev);
3844 if (!mddev->thread)
3845 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
3846 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "level");
3847 md_new_event(mddev);
3848 rv = len;
3849out_unlock:
3850 mddev_unlock(mddev);
3851 return rv;
3852}
3853
3854static struct md_sysfs_entry md_level =
3855__ATTR(level, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, level_show, level_store);
3856
3857static ssize_t
3858layout_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
3859{
3860 /* just a number, not meaningful for all levels */
3861 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector &&
3862 mddev->layout != mddev->new_layout)
3863 return sprintf(page, "%d (%d)\n",
3864 mddev->new_layout, mddev->layout);
3865 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->layout);
3866}
3867
3868static ssize_t
3869layout_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3870{
3871 unsigned int n;
3872 int err;
3873
3874 err = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &n);
3875 if (err < 0)
3876 return err;
3877 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
3878 if (err)
3879 return err;
3880
3881 if (mddev->pers) {
3882 if (mddev->pers->check_reshape == NULL)
3883 err = -EBUSY;
3884 else if (mddev->ro)
3885 err = -EROFS;
3886 else {
3887 mddev->new_layout = n;
3888 err = mddev->pers->check_reshape(mddev);
3889 if (err)
3890 mddev->new_layout = mddev->layout;
3891 }
3892 } else {
3893 mddev->new_layout = n;
3894 if (mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector)
3895 mddev->layout = n;
3896 }
3897 mddev_unlock(mddev);
3898 return err ?: len;
3899}
3900static struct md_sysfs_entry md_layout =
3901__ATTR(layout, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, layout_show, layout_store);
3902
3903static ssize_t
3904raid_disks_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
3905{
3906 if (mddev->raid_disks == 0)
3907 return 0;
3908 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector &&
3909 mddev->delta_disks != 0)
3910 return sprintf(page, "%d (%d)\n", mddev->raid_disks,
3911 mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks);
3912 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->raid_disks);
3913}
3914
3915static int update_raid_disks(struct mddev *mddev, int raid_disks);
3916
3917static ssize_t
3918raid_disks_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3919{
3920 unsigned int n;
3921 int err;
3922
3923 err = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &n);
3924 if (err < 0)
3925 return err;
3926
3927 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
3928 if (err)
3929 return err;
3930 if (mddev->pers)
3931 err = update_raid_disks(mddev, n);
3932 else if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector) {
3933 struct md_rdev *rdev;
3934 int olddisks = mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
3935
3936 err = -EINVAL;
3937 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
3938 if (olddisks < n &&
3939 rdev->data_offset < rdev->new_data_offset)
3940 goto out_unlock;
3941 if (olddisks > n &&
3942 rdev->data_offset > rdev->new_data_offset)
3943 goto out_unlock;
3944 }
3945 err = 0;
3946 mddev->delta_disks = n - olddisks;
3947 mddev->raid_disks = n;
3948 mddev->reshape_backwards = (mddev->delta_disks < 0);
3949 } else
3950 mddev->raid_disks = n;
3951out_unlock:
3952 mddev_unlock(mddev);
3953 return err ? err : len;
3954}
3955static struct md_sysfs_entry md_raid_disks =
3956__ATTR(raid_disks, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, raid_disks_show, raid_disks_store);
3957
3958static ssize_t
3959chunk_size_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
3960{
3961 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector &&
3962 mddev->chunk_sectors != mddev->new_chunk_sectors)
3963 return sprintf(page, "%d (%d)\n",
3964 mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9,
3965 mddev->chunk_sectors << 9);
3966 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->chunk_sectors << 9);
3967}
3968
3969static ssize_t
3970chunk_size_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
3971{
3972 unsigned long n;
3973 int err;
3974
3975 err = kstrtoul(buf, 10, &n);
3976 if (err < 0)
3977 return err;
3978
3979 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
3980 if (err)
3981 return err;
3982 if (mddev->pers) {
3983 if (mddev->pers->check_reshape == NULL)
3984 err = -EBUSY;
3985 else if (mddev->ro)
3986 err = -EROFS;
3987 else {
3988 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = n >> 9;
3989 err = mddev->pers->check_reshape(mddev);
3990 if (err)
3991 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
3992 }
3993 } else {
3994 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = n >> 9;
3995 if (mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector)
3996 mddev->chunk_sectors = n >> 9;
3997 }
3998 mddev_unlock(mddev);
3999 return err ?: len;
4000}
4001static struct md_sysfs_entry md_chunk_size =
4002__ATTR(chunk_size, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, chunk_size_show, chunk_size_store);
4003
4004static ssize_t
4005resync_start_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4006{
4007 if (mddev->recovery_cp == MaxSector)
4008 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
4009 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)mddev->recovery_cp);
4010}
4011
4012static ssize_t
4013resync_start_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4014{
4015 unsigned long long n;
4016 int err;
4017
4018 if (cmd_match(buf, "none"))
4019 n = MaxSector;
4020 else {
4021 err = kstrtoull(buf, 10, &n);
4022 if (err < 0)
4023 return err;
4024 if (n != (sector_t)n)
4025 return -EINVAL;
4026 }
4027
4028 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4029 if (err)
4030 return err;
4031 if (mddev->pers && !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery))
4032 err = -EBUSY;
4033
4034 if (!err) {
4035 mddev->recovery_cp = n;
4036 if (mddev->pers)
4037 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_CLEAN, &mddev->sb_flags);
4038 }
4039 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4040 return err ?: len;
4041}
4042static struct md_sysfs_entry md_resync_start =
4043__ATTR_PREALLOC(resync_start, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR,
4044 resync_start_show, resync_start_store);
4045
4046/*
4047 * The array state can be:
4048 *
4049 * clear
4050 * No devices, no size, no level
4051 * Equivalent to STOP_ARRAY ioctl
4052 * inactive
4053 * May have some settings, but array is not active
4054 * all IO results in error
4055 * When written, doesn't tear down array, but just stops it
4056 * suspended (not supported yet)
4057 * All IO requests will block. The array can be reconfigured.
4058 * Writing this, if accepted, will block until array is quiescent
4059 * readonly
4060 * no resync can happen. no superblocks get written.
4061 * write requests fail
4062 * read-auto
4063 * like readonly, but behaves like 'clean' on a write request.
4064 *
4065 * clean - no pending writes, but otherwise active.
4066 * When written to inactive array, starts without resync
4067 * If a write request arrives then
4068 * if metadata is known, mark 'dirty' and switch to 'active'.
4069 * if not known, block and switch to write-pending
4070 * If written to an active array that has pending writes, then fails.
4071 * active
4072 * fully active: IO and resync can be happening.
4073 * When written to inactive array, starts with resync
4074 *
4075 * write-pending
4076 * clean, but writes are blocked waiting for 'active' to be written.
4077 *
4078 * active-idle
4079 * like active, but no writes have been seen for a while (100msec).
4080 *
4081 */
4082enum array_state { clear, inactive, suspended, readonly, read_auto, clean, active,
4083 write_pending, active_idle, bad_word};
4084static char *array_states[] = {
4085 "clear", "inactive", "suspended", "readonly", "read-auto", "clean", "active",
4086 "write-pending", "active-idle", NULL };
4087
4088static int match_word(const char *word, char **list)
4089{
4090 int n;
4091 for (n=0; list[n]; n++)
4092 if (cmd_match(word, list[n]))
4093 break;
4094 return n;
4095}
4096
4097static ssize_t
4098array_state_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4099{
4100 enum array_state st = inactive;
4101
4102 if (mddev->pers)
4103 switch(mddev->ro) {
4104 case 1:
4105 st = readonly;
4106 break;
4107 case 2:
4108 st = read_auto;
4109 break;
4110 case 0:
4111 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
4112 if (test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags))
4113 st = write_pending;
4114 else if (mddev->in_sync)
4115 st = clean;
4116 else if (mddev->safemode)
4117 st = active_idle;
4118 else
4119 st = active;
4120 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
4121 }
4122 else {
4123 if (list_empty(&mddev->disks) &&
4124 mddev->raid_disks == 0 &&
4125 mddev->dev_sectors == 0)
4126 st = clear;
4127 else
4128 st = inactive;
4129 }
4130 return sprintf(page, "%s\n", array_states[st]);
4131}
4132
4133static int do_md_stop(struct mddev *mddev, int ro, struct block_device *bdev);
4134static int md_set_readonly(struct mddev *mddev, struct block_device *bdev);
4135static int do_md_run(struct mddev *mddev);
4136static int restart_array(struct mddev *mddev);
4137
4138static ssize_t
4139array_state_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4140{
4141 int err = 0;
4142 enum array_state st = match_word(buf, array_states);
4143
4144 if (mddev->pers && (st == active || st == clean) && mddev->ro != 1) {
4145 /* don't take reconfig_mutex when toggling between
4146 * clean and active
4147 */
4148 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
4149 if (st == active) {
4150 restart_array(mddev);
4151 clear_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags);
4152 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
4153 wake_up(&mddev->sb_wait);
4154 } else /* st == clean */ {
4155 restart_array(mddev);
4156 if (!set_in_sync(mddev))
4157 err = -EBUSY;
4158 }
4159 if (!err)
4160 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
4161 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
4162 return err ?: len;
4163 }
4164 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4165 if (err)
4166 return err;
4167 err = -EINVAL;
4168 switch(st) {
4169 case bad_word:
4170 break;
4171 case clear:
4172 /* stopping an active array */
4173 err = do_md_stop(mddev, 0, NULL);
4174 break;
4175 case inactive:
4176 /* stopping an active array */
4177 if (mddev->pers)
4178 err = do_md_stop(mddev, 2, NULL);
4179 else
4180 err = 0; /* already inactive */
4181 break;
4182 case suspended:
4183 break; /* not supported yet */
4184 case readonly:
4185 if (mddev->pers)
4186 err = md_set_readonly(mddev, NULL);
4187 else {
4188 mddev->ro = 1;
4189 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 1);
4190 err = do_md_run(mddev);
4191 }
4192 break;
4193 case read_auto:
4194 if (mddev->pers) {
4195 if (mddev->ro == 0)
4196 err = md_set_readonly(mddev, NULL);
4197 else if (mddev->ro == 1)
4198 err = restart_array(mddev);
4199 if (err == 0) {
4200 mddev->ro = 2;
4201 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 0);
4202 }
4203 } else {
4204 mddev->ro = 2;
4205 err = do_md_run(mddev);
4206 }
4207 break;
4208 case clean:
4209 if (mddev->pers) {
4210 err = restart_array(mddev);
4211 if (err)
4212 break;
4213 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
4214 if (!set_in_sync(mddev))
4215 err = -EBUSY;
4216 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
4217 } else
4218 err = -EINVAL;
4219 break;
4220 case active:
4221 if (mddev->pers) {
4222 err = restart_array(mddev);
4223 if (err)
4224 break;
4225 clear_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags);
4226 wake_up(&mddev->sb_wait);
4227 err = 0;
4228 } else {
4229 mddev->ro = 0;
4230 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 0);
4231 err = do_md_run(mddev);
4232 }
4233 break;
4234 case write_pending:
4235 case active_idle:
4236 /* these cannot be set */
4237 break;
4238 }
4239
4240 if (!err) {
4241 if (mddev->hold_active == UNTIL_IOCTL)
4242 mddev->hold_active = 0;
4243 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
4244 }
4245 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4246 return err ?: len;
4247}
4248static struct md_sysfs_entry md_array_state =
4249__ATTR_PREALLOC(array_state, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, array_state_show, array_state_store);
4250
4251static ssize_t
4252max_corrected_read_errors_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page) {
4253 return sprintf(page, "%d\n",
4254 atomic_read(&mddev->max_corr_read_errors));
4255}
4256
4257static ssize_t
4258max_corrected_read_errors_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4259{
4260 unsigned int n;
4261 int rv;
4262
4263 rv = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &n);
4264 if (rv < 0)
4265 return rv;
4266 atomic_set(&mddev->max_corr_read_errors, n);
4267 return len;
4268}
4269
4270static struct md_sysfs_entry max_corr_read_errors =
4271__ATTR(max_read_errors, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, max_corrected_read_errors_show,
4272 max_corrected_read_errors_store);
4273
4274static ssize_t
4275null_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4276{
4277 return -EINVAL;
4278}
4279
4280static ssize_t
4281new_dev_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4282{
4283 /* buf must be %d:%d\n? giving major and minor numbers */
4284 /* The new device is added to the array.
4285 * If the array has a persistent superblock, we read the
4286 * superblock to initialise info and check validity.
4287 * Otherwise, only checking done is that in bind_rdev_to_array,
4288 * which mainly checks size.
4289 */
4290 char *e;
4291 int major = simple_strtoul(buf, &e, 10);
4292 int minor;
4293 dev_t dev;
4294 struct md_rdev *rdev;
4295 int err;
4296
4297 if (!*buf || *e != ':' || !e[1] || e[1] == '\n')
4298 return -EINVAL;
4299 minor = simple_strtoul(e+1, &e, 10);
4300 if (*e && *e != '\n')
4301 return -EINVAL;
4302 dev = MKDEV(major, minor);
4303 if (major != MAJOR(dev) ||
4304 minor != MINOR(dev))
4305 return -EOVERFLOW;
4306
4307 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
4308
4309 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4310 if (err)
4311 return err;
4312 if (mddev->persistent) {
4313 rdev = md_import_device(dev, mddev->major_version,
4314 mddev->minor_version);
4315 if (!IS_ERR(rdev) && !list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
4316 struct md_rdev *rdev0
4317 = list_entry(mddev->disks.next,
4318 struct md_rdev, same_set);
4319 err = super_types[mddev->major_version]
4320 .load_super(rdev, rdev0, mddev->minor_version);
4321 if (err < 0)
4322 goto out;
4323 }
4324 } else if (mddev->external)
4325 rdev = md_import_device(dev, -2, -1);
4326 else
4327 rdev = md_import_device(dev, -1, -1);
4328
4329 if (IS_ERR(rdev)) {
4330 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4331 return PTR_ERR(rdev);
4332 }
4333 err = bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev);
4334 out:
4335 if (err)
4336 export_rdev(rdev);
4337 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4338 if (!err)
4339 md_new_event(mddev);
4340 return err ? err : len;
4341}
4342
4343static struct md_sysfs_entry md_new_device =
4344__ATTR(new_dev, S_IWUSR, null_show, new_dev_store);
4345
4346static ssize_t
4347bitmap_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4348{
4349 char *end;
4350 unsigned long chunk, end_chunk;
4351 int err;
4352
4353 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4354 if (err)
4355 return err;
4356 if (!mddev->bitmap)
4357 goto out;
4358 /* buf should be <chunk> <chunk> ... or <chunk>-<chunk> ... (range) */
4359 while (*buf) {
4360 chunk = end_chunk = simple_strtoul(buf, &end, 0);
4361 if (buf == end) break;
4362 if (*end == '-') { /* range */
4363 buf = end + 1;
4364 end_chunk = simple_strtoul(buf, &end, 0);
4365 if (buf == end) break;
4366 }
4367 if (*end && !isspace(*end)) break;
4368 bitmap_dirty_bits(mddev->bitmap, chunk, end_chunk);
4369 buf = skip_spaces(end);
4370 }
4371 bitmap_unplug(mddev->bitmap); /* flush the bits to disk */
4372out:
4373 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4374 return len;
4375}
4376
4377static struct md_sysfs_entry md_bitmap =
4378__ATTR(bitmap_set_bits, S_IWUSR, null_show, bitmap_store);
4379
4380static ssize_t
4381size_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4382{
4383 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
4384 (unsigned long long)mddev->dev_sectors / 2);
4385}
4386
4387static int update_size(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t num_sectors);
4388
4389static ssize_t
4390size_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4391{
4392 /* If array is inactive, we can reduce the component size, but
4393 * not increase it (except from 0).
4394 * If array is active, we can try an on-line resize
4395 */
4396 sector_t sectors;
4397 int err = strict_blocks_to_sectors(buf, &sectors);
4398
4399 if (err < 0)
4400 return err;
4401 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4402 if (err)
4403 return err;
4404 if (mddev->pers) {
4405 err = update_size(mddev, sectors);
4406 if (err == 0)
4407 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
4408 } else {
4409 if (mddev->dev_sectors == 0 ||
4410 mddev->dev_sectors > sectors)
4411 mddev->dev_sectors = sectors;
4412 else
4413 err = -ENOSPC;
4414 }
4415 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4416 return err ? err : len;
4417}
4418
4419static struct md_sysfs_entry md_size =
4420__ATTR(component_size, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, size_show, size_store);
4421
4422/* Metadata version.
4423 * This is one of
4424 * 'none' for arrays with no metadata (good luck...)
4425 * 'external' for arrays with externally managed metadata,
4426 * or N.M for internally known formats
4427 */
4428static ssize_t
4429metadata_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4430{
4431 if (mddev->persistent)
4432 return sprintf(page, "%d.%d\n",
4433 mddev->major_version, mddev->minor_version);
4434 else if (mddev->external)
4435 return sprintf(page, "external:%s\n", mddev->metadata_type);
4436 else
4437 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
4438}
4439
4440static ssize_t
4441metadata_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4442{
4443 int major, minor;
4444 char *e;
4445 int err;
4446 /* Changing the details of 'external' metadata is
4447 * always permitted. Otherwise there must be
4448 * no devices attached to the array.
4449 */
4450
4451 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4452 if (err)
4453 return err;
4454 err = -EBUSY;
4455 if (mddev->external && strncmp(buf, "external:", 9) == 0)
4456 ;
4457 else if (!list_empty(&mddev->disks))
4458 goto out_unlock;
4459
4460 err = 0;
4461 if (cmd_match(buf, "none")) {
4462 mddev->persistent = 0;
4463 mddev->external = 0;
4464 mddev->major_version = 0;
4465 mddev->minor_version = 90;
4466 goto out_unlock;
4467 }
4468 if (strncmp(buf, "external:", 9) == 0) {
4469 size_t namelen = len-9;
4470 if (namelen >= sizeof(mddev->metadata_type))
4471 namelen = sizeof(mddev->metadata_type)-1;
4472 strncpy(mddev->metadata_type, buf+9, namelen);
4473 mddev->metadata_type[namelen] = 0;
4474 if (namelen && mddev->metadata_type[namelen-1] == '\n')
4475 mddev->metadata_type[--namelen] = 0;
4476 mddev->persistent = 0;
4477 mddev->external = 1;
4478 mddev->major_version = 0;
4479 mddev->minor_version = 90;
4480 goto out_unlock;
4481 }
4482 major = simple_strtoul(buf, &e, 10);
4483 err = -EINVAL;
4484 if (e==buf || *e != '.')
4485 goto out_unlock;
4486 buf = e+1;
4487 minor = simple_strtoul(buf, &e, 10);
4488 if (e==buf || (*e && *e != '\n') )
4489 goto out_unlock;
4490 err = -ENOENT;
4491 if (major >= ARRAY_SIZE(super_types) || super_types[major].name == NULL)
4492 goto out_unlock;
4493 mddev->major_version = major;
4494 mddev->minor_version = minor;
4495 mddev->persistent = 1;
4496 mddev->external = 0;
4497 err = 0;
4498out_unlock:
4499 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4500 return err ?: len;
4501}
4502
4503static struct md_sysfs_entry md_metadata =
4504__ATTR_PREALLOC(metadata_version, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, metadata_show, metadata_store);
4505
4506static ssize_t
4507action_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4508{
4509 char *type = "idle";
4510 unsigned long recovery = mddev->recovery;
4511 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &recovery))
4512 type = "frozen";
4513 else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &recovery) ||
4514 (!mddev->ro && test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &recovery))) {
4515 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &recovery))
4516 type = "reshape";
4517 else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &recovery)) {
4518 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &recovery))
4519 type = "resync";
4520 else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &recovery))
4521 type = "check";
4522 else
4523 type = "repair";
4524 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &recovery))
4525 type = "recover";
4526 else if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector)
4527 type = "reshape";
4528 }
4529 return sprintf(page, "%s\n", type);
4530}
4531
4532static ssize_t
4533action_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
4534{
4535 if (!mddev->pers || !mddev->pers->sync_request)
4536 return -EINVAL;
4537
4538
4539 if (cmd_match(page, "idle") || cmd_match(page, "frozen")) {
4540 if (cmd_match(page, "frozen"))
4541 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4542 else
4543 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4544 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery) &&
4545 mddev_lock(mddev) == 0) {
4546 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
4547 if (mddev->sync_thread) {
4548 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
4549 md_reap_sync_thread(mddev);
4550 }
4551 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4552 }
4553 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
4554 return -EBUSY;
4555 else if (cmd_match(page, "resync"))
4556 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4557 else if (cmd_match(page, "recover")) {
4558 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4559 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
4560 } else if (cmd_match(page, "reshape")) {
4561 int err;
4562 if (mddev->pers->start_reshape == NULL)
4563 return -EINVAL;
4564 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4565 if (!err) {
4566 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
4567 err = -EBUSY;
4568 else {
4569 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4570 err = mddev->pers->start_reshape(mddev);
4571 }
4572 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4573 }
4574 if (err)
4575 return err;
4576 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "degraded");
4577 } else {
4578 if (cmd_match(page, "check"))
4579 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
4580 else if (!cmd_match(page, "repair"))
4581 return -EINVAL;
4582 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
4583 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery);
4584 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
4585 }
4586 if (mddev->ro == 2) {
4587 /* A write to sync_action is enough to justify
4588 * canceling read-auto mode
4589 */
4590 mddev->ro = 0;
4591 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
4592 }
4593 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
4594 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
4595 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
4596 return len;
4597}
4598
4599static struct md_sysfs_entry md_scan_mode =
4600__ATTR_PREALLOC(sync_action, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, action_show, action_store);
4601
4602static ssize_t
4603last_sync_action_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4604{
4605 return sprintf(page, "%s\n", mddev->last_sync_action);
4606}
4607
4608static struct md_sysfs_entry md_last_scan_mode = __ATTR_RO(last_sync_action);
4609
4610static ssize_t
4611mismatch_cnt_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4612{
4613 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
4614 (unsigned long long)
4615 atomic64_read(&mddev->resync_mismatches));
4616}
4617
4618static struct md_sysfs_entry md_mismatches = __ATTR_RO(mismatch_cnt);
4619
4620static ssize_t
4621sync_min_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4622{
4623 return sprintf(page, "%d (%s)\n", speed_min(mddev),
4624 mddev->sync_speed_min ? "local": "system");
4625}
4626
4627static ssize_t
4628sync_min_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4629{
4630 unsigned int min;
4631 int rv;
4632
4633 if (strncmp(buf, "system", 6)==0) {
4634 min = 0;
4635 } else {
4636 rv = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &min);
4637 if (rv < 0)
4638 return rv;
4639 if (min == 0)
4640 return -EINVAL;
4641 }
4642 mddev->sync_speed_min = min;
4643 return len;
4644}
4645
4646static struct md_sysfs_entry md_sync_min =
4647__ATTR(sync_speed_min, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, sync_min_show, sync_min_store);
4648
4649static ssize_t
4650sync_max_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4651{
4652 return sprintf(page, "%d (%s)\n", speed_max(mddev),
4653 mddev->sync_speed_max ? "local": "system");
4654}
4655
4656static ssize_t
4657sync_max_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4658{
4659 unsigned int max;
4660 int rv;
4661
4662 if (strncmp(buf, "system", 6)==0) {
4663 max = 0;
4664 } else {
4665 rv = kstrtouint(buf, 10, &max);
4666 if (rv < 0)
4667 return rv;
4668 if (max == 0)
4669 return -EINVAL;
4670 }
4671 mddev->sync_speed_max = max;
4672 return len;
4673}
4674
4675static struct md_sysfs_entry md_sync_max =
4676__ATTR(sync_speed_max, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, sync_max_show, sync_max_store);
4677
4678static ssize_t
4679degraded_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4680{
4681 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->degraded);
4682}
4683static struct md_sysfs_entry md_degraded = __ATTR_RO(degraded);
4684
4685static ssize_t
4686sync_force_parallel_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4687{
4688 return sprintf(page, "%d\n", mddev->parallel_resync);
4689}
4690
4691static ssize_t
4692sync_force_parallel_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4693{
4694 long n;
4695
4696 if (kstrtol(buf, 10, &n))
4697 return -EINVAL;
4698
4699 if (n != 0 && n != 1)
4700 return -EINVAL;
4701
4702 mddev->parallel_resync = n;
4703
4704 if (mddev->sync_thread)
4705 wake_up(&resync_wait);
4706
4707 return len;
4708}
4709
4710/* force parallel resync, even with shared block devices */
4711static struct md_sysfs_entry md_sync_force_parallel =
4712__ATTR(sync_force_parallel, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR,
4713 sync_force_parallel_show, sync_force_parallel_store);
4714
4715static ssize_t
4716sync_speed_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4717{
4718 unsigned long resync, dt, db;
4719 if (mddev->curr_resync == 0)
4720 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
4721 resync = mddev->curr_mark_cnt - atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active);
4722 dt = (jiffies - mddev->resync_mark) / HZ;
4723 if (!dt) dt++;
4724 db = resync - mddev->resync_mark_cnt;
4725 return sprintf(page, "%lu\n", db/dt/2); /* K/sec */
4726}
4727
4728static struct md_sysfs_entry md_sync_speed = __ATTR_RO(sync_speed);
4729
4730static ssize_t
4731sync_completed_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4732{
4733 unsigned long long max_sectors, resync;
4734
4735 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
4736 return sprintf(page, "none\n");
4737
4738 if (mddev->curr_resync == 1 ||
4739 mddev->curr_resync == 2)
4740 return sprintf(page, "delayed\n");
4741
4742 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery) ||
4743 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
4744 max_sectors = mddev->resync_max_sectors;
4745 else
4746 max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
4747
4748 resync = mddev->curr_resync_completed;
4749 return sprintf(page, "%llu / %llu\n", resync, max_sectors);
4750}
4751
4752static struct md_sysfs_entry md_sync_completed =
4753 __ATTR_PREALLOC(sync_completed, S_IRUGO, sync_completed_show, NULL);
4754
4755static ssize_t
4756min_sync_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4757{
4758 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
4759 (unsigned long long)mddev->resync_min);
4760}
4761static ssize_t
4762min_sync_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4763{
4764 unsigned long long min;
4765 int err;
4766
4767 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &min))
4768 return -EINVAL;
4769
4770 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
4771 err = -EINVAL;
4772 if (min > mddev->resync_max)
4773 goto out_unlock;
4774
4775 err = -EBUSY;
4776 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
4777 goto out_unlock;
4778
4779 /* Round down to multiple of 4K for safety */
4780 mddev->resync_min = round_down(min, 8);
4781 err = 0;
4782
4783out_unlock:
4784 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
4785 return err ?: len;
4786}
4787
4788static struct md_sysfs_entry md_min_sync =
4789__ATTR(sync_min, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, min_sync_show, min_sync_store);
4790
4791static ssize_t
4792max_sync_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4793{
4794 if (mddev->resync_max == MaxSector)
4795 return sprintf(page, "max\n");
4796 else
4797 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
4798 (unsigned long long)mddev->resync_max);
4799}
4800static ssize_t
4801max_sync_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4802{
4803 int err;
4804 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
4805 if (strncmp(buf, "max", 3) == 0)
4806 mddev->resync_max = MaxSector;
4807 else {
4808 unsigned long long max;
4809 int chunk;
4810
4811 err = -EINVAL;
4812 if (kstrtoull(buf, 10, &max))
4813 goto out_unlock;
4814 if (max < mddev->resync_min)
4815 goto out_unlock;
4816
4817 err = -EBUSY;
4818 if (max < mddev->resync_max &&
4819 mddev->ro == 0 &&
4820 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
4821 goto out_unlock;
4822
4823 /* Must be a multiple of chunk_size */
4824 chunk = mddev->chunk_sectors;
4825 if (chunk) {
4826 sector_t temp = max;
4827
4828 err = -EINVAL;
4829 if (sector_div(temp, chunk))
4830 goto out_unlock;
4831 }
4832 mddev->resync_max = max;
4833 }
4834 wake_up(&mddev->recovery_wait);
4835 err = 0;
4836out_unlock:
4837 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
4838 return err ?: len;
4839}
4840
4841static struct md_sysfs_entry md_max_sync =
4842__ATTR(sync_max, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, max_sync_show, max_sync_store);
4843
4844static ssize_t
4845suspend_lo_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4846{
4847 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)mddev->suspend_lo);
4848}
4849
4850static ssize_t
4851suspend_lo_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4852{
4853 unsigned long long new;
4854 int err;
4855
4856 err = kstrtoull(buf, 10, &new);
4857 if (err < 0)
4858 return err;
4859 if (new != (sector_t)new)
4860 return -EINVAL;
4861
4862 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4863 if (err)
4864 return err;
4865 err = -EINVAL;
4866 if (mddev->pers == NULL ||
4867 mddev->pers->quiesce == NULL)
4868 goto unlock;
4869 mddev_suspend(mddev);
4870 mddev->suspend_lo = new;
4871 mddev_resume(mddev);
4872
4873 err = 0;
4874unlock:
4875 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4876 return err ?: len;
4877}
4878static struct md_sysfs_entry md_suspend_lo =
4879__ATTR(suspend_lo, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, suspend_lo_show, suspend_lo_store);
4880
4881static ssize_t
4882suspend_hi_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4883{
4884 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n", (unsigned long long)mddev->suspend_hi);
4885}
4886
4887static ssize_t
4888suspend_hi_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4889{
4890 unsigned long long new;
4891 int err;
4892
4893 err = kstrtoull(buf, 10, &new);
4894 if (err < 0)
4895 return err;
4896 if (new != (sector_t)new)
4897 return -EINVAL;
4898
4899 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4900 if (err)
4901 return err;
4902 err = -EINVAL;
4903 if (mddev->pers == NULL)
4904 goto unlock;
4905
4906 mddev_suspend(mddev);
4907 mddev->suspend_hi = new;
4908 mddev_resume(mddev);
4909
4910 err = 0;
4911unlock:
4912 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4913 return err ?: len;
4914}
4915static struct md_sysfs_entry md_suspend_hi =
4916__ATTR(suspend_hi, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, suspend_hi_show, suspend_hi_store);
4917
4918static ssize_t
4919reshape_position_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4920{
4921 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector)
4922 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
4923 (unsigned long long)mddev->reshape_position);
4924 strcpy(page, "none\n");
4925 return 5;
4926}
4927
4928static ssize_t
4929reshape_position_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4930{
4931 struct md_rdev *rdev;
4932 unsigned long long new;
4933 int err;
4934
4935 err = kstrtoull(buf, 10, &new);
4936 if (err < 0)
4937 return err;
4938 if (new != (sector_t)new)
4939 return -EINVAL;
4940 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4941 if (err)
4942 return err;
4943 err = -EBUSY;
4944 if (mddev->pers)
4945 goto unlock;
4946 mddev->reshape_position = new;
4947 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
4948 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
4949 mddev->new_level = mddev->level;
4950 mddev->new_layout = mddev->layout;
4951 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
4952 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
4953 rdev->new_data_offset = rdev->data_offset;
4954 err = 0;
4955unlock:
4956 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4957 return err ?: len;
4958}
4959
4960static struct md_sysfs_entry md_reshape_position =
4961__ATTR(reshape_position, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, reshape_position_show,
4962 reshape_position_store);
4963
4964static ssize_t
4965reshape_direction_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
4966{
4967 return sprintf(page, "%s\n",
4968 mddev->reshape_backwards ? "backwards" : "forwards");
4969}
4970
4971static ssize_t
4972reshape_direction_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
4973{
4974 int backwards = 0;
4975 int err;
4976
4977 if (cmd_match(buf, "forwards"))
4978 backwards = 0;
4979 else if (cmd_match(buf, "backwards"))
4980 backwards = 1;
4981 else
4982 return -EINVAL;
4983 if (mddev->reshape_backwards == backwards)
4984 return len;
4985
4986 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
4987 if (err)
4988 return err;
4989 /* check if we are allowed to change */
4990 if (mddev->delta_disks)
4991 err = -EBUSY;
4992 else if (mddev->persistent &&
4993 mddev->major_version == 0)
4994 err = -EINVAL;
4995 else
4996 mddev->reshape_backwards = backwards;
4997 mddev_unlock(mddev);
4998 return err ?: len;
4999}
5000
5001static struct md_sysfs_entry md_reshape_direction =
5002__ATTR(reshape_direction, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, reshape_direction_show,
5003 reshape_direction_store);
5004
5005static ssize_t
5006array_size_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
5007{
5008 if (mddev->external_size)
5009 return sprintf(page, "%llu\n",
5010 (unsigned long long)mddev->array_sectors/2);
5011 else
5012 return sprintf(page, "default\n");
5013}
5014
5015static ssize_t
5016array_size_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
5017{
5018 sector_t sectors;
5019 int err;
5020
5021 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
5022 if (err)
5023 return err;
5024
5025 /* cluster raid doesn't support change array_sectors */
5026 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
5027 mddev_unlock(mddev);
5028 return -EINVAL;
5029 }
5030
5031 if (strncmp(buf, "default", 7) == 0) {
5032 if (mddev->pers)
5033 sectors = mddev->pers->size(mddev, 0, 0);
5034 else
5035 sectors = mddev->array_sectors;
5036
5037 mddev->external_size = 0;
5038 } else {
5039 if (strict_blocks_to_sectors(buf, &sectors) < 0)
5040 err = -EINVAL;
5041 else if (mddev->pers && mddev->pers->size(mddev, 0, 0) < sectors)
5042 err = -E2BIG;
5043 else
5044 mddev->external_size = 1;
5045 }
5046
5047 if (!err) {
5048 mddev->array_sectors = sectors;
5049 if (mddev->pers) {
5050 set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
5051 revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
5052 }
5053 }
5054 mddev_unlock(mddev);
5055 return err ?: len;
5056}
5057
5058static struct md_sysfs_entry md_array_size =
5059__ATTR(array_size, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, array_size_show,
5060 array_size_store);
5061
5062static ssize_t
5063consistency_policy_show(struct mddev *mddev, char *page)
5064{
5065 int ret;
5066
5067 if (test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags)) {
5068 ret = sprintf(page, "journal\n");
5069 } else if (test_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &mddev->flags)) {
5070 ret = sprintf(page, "ppl\n");
5071 } else if (mddev->bitmap) {
5072 ret = sprintf(page, "bitmap\n");
5073 } else if (mddev->pers) {
5074 if (mddev->pers->sync_request)
5075 ret = sprintf(page, "resync\n");
5076 else
5077 ret = sprintf(page, "none\n");
5078 } else {
5079 ret = sprintf(page, "unknown\n");
5080 }
5081
5082 return ret;
5083}
5084
5085static ssize_t
5086consistency_policy_store(struct mddev *mddev, const char *buf, size_t len)
5087{
5088 int err = 0;
5089
5090 if (mddev->pers) {
5091 if (mddev->pers->change_consistency_policy)
5092 err = mddev->pers->change_consistency_policy(mddev, buf);
5093 else
5094 err = -EBUSY;
5095 } else if (mddev->external && strncmp(buf, "ppl", 3) == 0) {
5096 set_bit(MD_HAS_PPL, &mddev->flags);
5097 } else {
5098 err = -EINVAL;
5099 }
5100
5101 return err ? err : len;
5102}
5103
5104static struct md_sysfs_entry md_consistency_policy =
5105__ATTR(consistency_policy, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR, consistency_policy_show,
5106 consistency_policy_store);
5107
5108static struct attribute *md_default_attrs[] = {
5109 &md_level.attr,
5110 &md_layout.attr,
5111 &md_raid_disks.attr,
5112 &md_chunk_size.attr,
5113 &md_size.attr,
5114 &md_resync_start.attr,
5115 &md_metadata.attr,
5116 &md_new_device.attr,
5117 &md_safe_delay.attr,
5118 &md_array_state.attr,
5119 &md_reshape_position.attr,
5120 &md_reshape_direction.attr,
5121 &md_array_size.attr,
5122 &max_corr_read_errors.attr,
5123 &md_consistency_policy.attr,
5124 NULL,
5125};
5126
5127static struct attribute *md_redundancy_attrs[] = {
5128 &md_scan_mode.attr,
5129 &md_last_scan_mode.attr,
5130 &md_mismatches.attr,
5131 &md_sync_min.attr,
5132 &md_sync_max.attr,
5133 &md_sync_speed.attr,
5134 &md_sync_force_parallel.attr,
5135 &md_sync_completed.attr,
5136 &md_min_sync.attr,
5137 &md_max_sync.attr,
5138 &md_suspend_lo.attr,
5139 &md_suspend_hi.attr,
5140 &md_bitmap.attr,
5141 &md_degraded.attr,
5142 NULL,
5143};
5144static struct attribute_group md_redundancy_group = {
5145 .name = NULL,
5146 .attrs = md_redundancy_attrs,
5147};
5148
5149static ssize_t
5150md_attr_show(struct kobject *kobj, struct attribute *attr, char *page)
5151{
5152 struct md_sysfs_entry *entry = container_of(attr, struct md_sysfs_entry, attr);
5153 struct mddev *mddev = container_of(kobj, struct mddev, kobj);
5154 ssize_t rv;
5155
5156 if (!entry->show)
5157 return -EIO;
5158 spin_lock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5159 if (list_empty(&mddev->all_mddevs)) {
5160 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5161 return -EBUSY;
5162 }
5163 mddev_get(mddev);
5164 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5165
5166 rv = entry->show(mddev, page);
5167 mddev_put(mddev);
5168 return rv;
5169}
5170
5171static ssize_t
5172md_attr_store(struct kobject *kobj, struct attribute *attr,
5173 const char *page, size_t length)
5174{
5175 struct md_sysfs_entry *entry = container_of(attr, struct md_sysfs_entry, attr);
5176 struct mddev *mddev = container_of(kobj, struct mddev, kobj);
5177 ssize_t rv;
5178
5179 if (!entry->store)
5180 return -EIO;
5181 if (!capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
5182 return -EACCES;
5183 spin_lock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5184 if (list_empty(&mddev->all_mddevs)) {
5185 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5186 return -EBUSY;
5187 }
5188 mddev_get(mddev);
5189 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5190 rv = entry->store(mddev, page, length);
5191 mddev_put(mddev);
5192 return rv;
5193}
5194
5195static void md_free(struct kobject *ko)
5196{
5197 struct mddev *mddev = container_of(ko, struct mddev, kobj);
5198
5199 if (mddev->sysfs_state)
5200 sysfs_put(mddev->sysfs_state);
5201
5202 if (mddev->queue)
5203 blk_cleanup_queue(mddev->queue);
5204 if (mddev->gendisk) {
5205 del_gendisk(mddev->gendisk);
5206 put_disk(mddev->gendisk);
5207 }
5208 percpu_ref_exit(&mddev->writes_pending);
5209
5210 kfree(mddev);
5211}
5212
5213static const struct sysfs_ops md_sysfs_ops = {
5214 .show = md_attr_show,
5215 .store = md_attr_store,
5216};
5217static struct kobj_type md_ktype = {
5218 .release = md_free,
5219 .sysfs_ops = &md_sysfs_ops,
5220 .default_attrs = md_default_attrs,
5221};
5222
5223int mdp_major = 0;
5224
5225static void mddev_delayed_delete(struct work_struct *ws)
5226{
5227 struct mddev *mddev = container_of(ws, struct mddev, del_work);
5228
5229 sysfs_remove_group(&mddev->kobj, &md_bitmap_group);
5230 kobject_del(&mddev->kobj);
5231 kobject_put(&mddev->kobj);
5232}
5233
5234static void no_op(struct percpu_ref *r) {}
5235
5236int mddev_init_writes_pending(struct mddev *mddev)
5237{
5238 if (mddev->writes_pending.percpu_count_ptr)
5239 return 0;
5240 if (percpu_ref_init(&mddev->writes_pending, no_op, 0, GFP_KERNEL) < 0)
5241 return -ENOMEM;
5242 /* We want to start with the refcount at zero */
5243 percpu_ref_put(&mddev->writes_pending);
5244 return 0;
5245}
5246EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(mddev_init_writes_pending);
5247
5248static int md_alloc(dev_t dev, char *name)
5249{
5250 /*
5251 * If dev is zero, name is the name of a device to allocate with
5252 * an arbitrary minor number. It will be "md_???"
5253 * If dev is non-zero it must be a device number with a MAJOR of
5254 * MD_MAJOR or mdp_major. In this case, if "name" is NULL, then
5255 * the device is being created by opening a node in /dev.
5256 * If "name" is not NULL, the device is being created by
5257 * writing to /sys/module/md_mod/parameters/new_array.
5258 */
5259 static DEFINE_MUTEX(disks_mutex);
5260 struct mddev *mddev = mddev_find(dev);
5261 struct gendisk *disk;
5262 int partitioned;
5263 int shift;
5264 int unit;
5265 int error;
5266
5267 if (!mddev)
5268 return -ENODEV;
5269
5270 partitioned = (MAJOR(mddev->unit) != MD_MAJOR);
5271 shift = partitioned ? MdpMinorShift : 0;
5272 unit = MINOR(mddev->unit) >> shift;
5273
5274 /* wait for any previous instance of this device to be
5275 * completely removed (mddev_delayed_delete).
5276 */
5277 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
5278
5279 mutex_lock(&disks_mutex);
5280 error = -EEXIST;
5281 if (mddev->gendisk)
5282 goto abort;
5283
5284 if (name && !dev) {
5285 /* Need to ensure that 'name' is not a duplicate.
5286 */
5287 struct mddev *mddev2;
5288 spin_lock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5289
5290 list_for_each_entry(mddev2, &all_mddevs, all_mddevs)
5291 if (mddev2->gendisk &&
5292 strcmp(mddev2->gendisk->disk_name, name) == 0) {
5293 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5294 goto abort;
5295 }
5296 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
5297 }
5298 if (name && dev)
5299 /*
5300 * Creating /dev/mdNNN via "newarray", so adjust hold_active.
5301 */
5302 mddev->hold_active = UNTIL_STOP;
5303
5304 error = -ENOMEM;
5305 mddev->queue = blk_alloc_queue(GFP_KERNEL);
5306 if (!mddev->queue)
5307 goto abort;
5308 mddev->queue->queuedata = mddev;
5309
5310 blk_queue_make_request(mddev->queue, md_make_request);
5311 blk_set_stacking_limits(&mddev->queue->limits);
5312
5313 disk = alloc_disk(1 << shift);
5314 if (!disk) {
5315 blk_cleanup_queue(mddev->queue);
5316 mddev->queue = NULL;
5317 goto abort;
5318 }
5319 disk->major = MAJOR(mddev->unit);
5320 disk->first_minor = unit << shift;
5321 if (name)
5322 strcpy(disk->disk_name, name);
5323 else if (partitioned)
5324 sprintf(disk->disk_name, "md_d%d", unit);
5325 else
5326 sprintf(disk->disk_name, "md%d", unit);
5327 disk->fops = &md_fops;
5328 disk->private_data = mddev;
5329 disk->queue = mddev->queue;
5330 blk_queue_write_cache(mddev->queue, true, true);
5331 /* Allow extended partitions. This makes the
5332 * 'mdp' device redundant, but we can't really
5333 * remove it now.
5334 */
5335 disk->flags |= GENHD_FL_EXT_DEVT;
5336 mddev->gendisk = disk;
5337 /* As soon as we call add_disk(), another thread could get
5338 * through to md_open, so make sure it doesn't get too far
5339 */
5340 mutex_lock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5341 add_disk(disk);
5342
5343 error = kobject_init_and_add(&mddev->kobj, &md_ktype,
5344 &disk_to_dev(disk)->kobj, "%s", "md");
5345 if (error) {
5346 /* This isn't possible, but as kobject_init_and_add is marked
5347 * __must_check, we must do something with the result
5348 */
5349 pr_debug("md: cannot register %s/md - name in use\n",
5350 disk->disk_name);
5351 error = 0;
5352 }
5353 if (mddev->kobj.sd &&
5354 sysfs_create_group(&mddev->kobj, &md_bitmap_group))
5355 pr_debug("pointless warning\n");
5356 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5357 abort:
5358 mutex_unlock(&disks_mutex);
5359 if (!error && mddev->kobj.sd) {
5360 kobject_uevent(&mddev->kobj, KOBJ_ADD);
5361 mddev->sysfs_state = sysfs_get_dirent_safe(mddev->kobj.sd, "array_state");
5362 }
5363 mddev_put(mddev);
5364 return error;
5365}
5366
5367static struct kobject *md_probe(dev_t dev, int *part, void *data)
5368{
5369 if (create_on_open)
5370 md_alloc(dev, NULL);
5371 return NULL;
5372}
5373
5374static int add_named_array(const char *val, struct kernel_param *kp)
5375{
5376 /*
5377 * val must be "md_*" or "mdNNN".
5378 * For "md_*" we allocate an array with a large free minor number, and
5379 * set the name to val. val must not already be an active name.
5380 * For "mdNNN" we allocate an array with the minor number NNN
5381 * which must not already be in use.
5382 */
5383 int len = strlen(val);
5384 char buf[DISK_NAME_LEN];
5385 unsigned long devnum;
5386
5387 while (len && val[len-1] == '\n')
5388 len--;
5389 if (len >= DISK_NAME_LEN)
5390 return -E2BIG;
5391 strlcpy(buf, val, len+1);
5392 if (strncmp(buf, "md_", 3) == 0)
5393 return md_alloc(0, buf);
5394 if (strncmp(buf, "md", 2) == 0 &&
5395 isdigit(buf[2]) &&
5396 kstrtoul(buf+2, 10, &devnum) == 0 &&
5397 devnum <= MINORMASK)
5398 return md_alloc(MKDEV(MD_MAJOR, devnum), NULL);
5399
5400 return -EINVAL;
5401}
5402
5403static void md_safemode_timeout(unsigned long data)
5404{
