5405 struct mddev *mddev = (struct mddev *) data;
5406
5407 mddev->safemode = 1;
5408 if (mddev->external)
5409 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
5410
5411 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5412}
5413
5414static int start_dirty_degraded;
5415
5416int md_run(struct mddev *mddev)
5417{
5418 int err;
5419 struct md_rdev *rdev;
5420 struct md_personality *pers;
5421
5422 if (list_empty(&mddev->disks))
5423 /* cannot run an array with no devices.. */
5424 return -EINVAL;
5425
5426 if (mddev->pers)
5427 return -EBUSY;
5428 /* Cannot run until previous stop completes properly */
5429 if (mddev->sysfs_active)
5430 return -EBUSY;
5431
5432 /*
5433 * Analyze all RAID superblock(s)
5434 */
5435 if (!mddev->raid_disks) {
5436 if (!mddev->persistent)
5437 return -EINVAL;
5438 analyze_sbs(mddev);
5439 }
5440
5441 if (mddev->level != LEVEL_NONE)
5442 request_module("md-level-%d", mddev->level);
5443 else if (mddev->clevel[0])
5444 request_module("md-%s", mddev->clevel);
5445
5446 /*
5447 * Drop all container device buffers, from now on
5448 * the only valid external interface is through the md
5449 * device.
5450 */
5451 mddev->has_superblocks = false;
5452 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
5453 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
5454 continue;
5455 sync_blockdev(rdev->bdev);
5456 invalidate_bdev(rdev->bdev);
5457 if (mddev->ro != 1 &&
5458 (bdev_read_only(rdev->bdev) ||
5459 bdev_read_only(rdev->meta_bdev))) {
5460 mddev->ro = 1;
5461 if (mddev->gendisk)
5462 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 1);
5463 }
5464
5465 if (rdev->sb_page)
5466 mddev->has_superblocks = true;
5467
5468 /* perform some consistency tests on the device.
5469 * We don't want the data to overlap the metadata,
5470 * Internal Bitmap issues have been handled elsewhere.
5471 */
5472 if (rdev->meta_bdev) {
5473 /* Nothing to check */;
5474 } else if (rdev->data_offset < rdev->sb_start) {
5475 if (mddev->dev_sectors &&
5476 rdev->data_offset + mddev->dev_sectors
5477 > rdev->sb_start) {
5478 pr_warn("md: %s: data overlaps metadata\n",
5479 mdname(mddev));
5480 return -EINVAL;
5481 }
5482 } else {
5483 if (rdev->sb_start + rdev->sb_size/512
5484 > rdev->data_offset) {
5485 pr_warn("md: %s: metadata overlaps data\n",
5486 mdname(mddev));
5487 return -EINVAL;
5488 }
5489 }
5490 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
5491 }
5492
5493 if (mddev->bio_set == NULL) {
5494 mddev->bio_set = bioset_create(BIO_POOL_SIZE, 0, BIOSET_NEED_BVECS);
5495 if (!mddev->bio_set)
5496 return -ENOMEM;
5497 }
5498 if (mddev->sync_set == NULL) {
5499 mddev->sync_set = bioset_create(BIO_POOL_SIZE, 0, BIOSET_NEED_BVECS);
5500 if (!mddev->sync_set) {
5501 err = -ENOMEM;
5502 goto abort;
5503 }
5504 }
5505
5506 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
5507 pers = find_pers(mddev->level, mddev->clevel);
5508 if (!pers || !try_module_get(pers->owner)) {
5509 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
5510 if (mddev->level != LEVEL_NONE)
5511 pr_warn("md: personality for level %d is not loaded!\n",
5512 mddev->level);
5513 else
5514 pr_warn("md: personality for level %s is not loaded!\n",
5515 mddev->clevel);
5516 err = -EINVAL;
5517 goto abort;
5518 }
5519 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
5520 if (mddev->level != pers->level) {
5521 mddev->level = pers->level;
5522 mddev->new_level = pers->level;
5523 }
5524 strlcpy(mddev->clevel, pers->name, sizeof(mddev->clevel));
5525
5526 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector &&
5527 pers->start_reshape == NULL) {
5528 /* This personality cannot handle reshaping... */
5529 module_put(pers->owner);
5530 err = -EINVAL;
5531 goto abort;
5532 }
5533
5534 if (pers->sync_request) {
5535 /* Warn if this is a potentially silly
5536 * configuration.
5537 */
5538 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE], b2[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
5539 struct md_rdev *rdev2;
5540 int warned = 0;
5541
5542 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
5543 rdev_for_each(rdev2, mddev) {
5544 if (rdev < rdev2 &&
5545 rdev->bdev->bd_contains ==
5546 rdev2->bdev->bd_contains) {
5547 pr_warn("%s: WARNING: %s appears to be on the same physical disk as %s.\n",
5548 mdname(mddev),
5549 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b),
5550 bdevname(rdev2->bdev,b2));
5551 warned = 1;
5552 }
5553 }
5554
5555 if (warned)
5556 pr_warn("True protection against single-disk failure might be compromised.\n");
5557 }
5558
5559 mddev->recovery = 0;
5560 /* may be over-ridden by personality */
5561 mddev->resync_max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
5562
5563 mddev->ok_start_degraded = start_dirty_degraded;
5564
5565 if (start_readonly && mddev->ro == 0)
5566 mddev->ro = 2; /* read-only, but switch on first write */
5567
5568 /*
5569 * NOTE: some pers->run(), for example r5l_recovery_log(), wakes
5570 * up mddev->thread. It is important to initialize critical
5571 * resources for mddev->thread BEFORE calling pers->run().
5572 */
5573 err = pers->run(mddev);
5574 if (err)
5575 pr_warn("md: pers->run() failed ...\n");
5576 else if (pers->size(mddev, 0, 0) < mddev->array_sectors) {
5577 WARN_ONCE(!mddev->external_size,
5578 "%s: default size too small, but 'external_size' not in effect?\n",
5579 __func__);
5580 pr_warn("md: invalid array_size %llu > default size %llu\n",
5581 (unsigned long long)mddev->array_sectors / 2,
5582 (unsigned long long)pers->size(mddev, 0, 0) / 2);
5583 err = -EINVAL;
5584 }
5585 if (err == 0 && pers->sync_request &&
5586 (mddev->bitmap_info.file || mddev->bitmap_info.offset)) {
5587 struct bitmap *bitmap;
5588
5589 bitmap = bitmap_create(mddev, -1);
5590 if (IS_ERR(bitmap)) {
5591 err = PTR_ERR(bitmap);
5592 pr_warn("%s: failed to create bitmap (%d)\n",
5593 mdname(mddev), err);
5594 } else
5595 mddev->bitmap = bitmap;
5596
5597 }
5598 if (err) {
5599 mddev_detach(mddev);
5600 if (mddev->private)
5601 pers->free(mddev, mddev->private);
5602 mddev->private = NULL;
5603 module_put(pers->owner);
5604 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
5605 goto abort;
5606 }
5607 if (mddev->queue) {
5608 bool nonrot = true;
5609
5610 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
5611 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
5612 !blk_queue_nonrot(bdev_get_queue(rdev->bdev))) {
5613 nonrot = false;
5614 break;
5615 }
5616 }
5617 if (mddev->degraded)
5618 nonrot = false;
5619 if (nonrot)
5620 queue_flag_set_unlocked(QUEUE_FLAG_NONROT, mddev->queue);
5621 else
5622 queue_flag_clear_unlocked(QUEUE_FLAG_NONROT, mddev->queue);
5623 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->congested_data = mddev;
5624 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->congested_fn = md_congested;
5625 }
5626 if (pers->sync_request) {
5627 if (mddev->kobj.sd &&
5628 sysfs_create_group(&mddev->kobj, &md_redundancy_group))
5629 pr_warn("md: cannot register extra attributes for %s\n",
5630 mdname(mddev));
5631 mddev->sysfs_action = sysfs_get_dirent_safe(mddev->kobj.sd, "sync_action");
5632 } else if (mddev->ro == 2) /* auto-readonly not meaningful */
5633 mddev->ro = 0;
5634
5635 atomic_set(&mddev->max_corr_read_errors,
5636 MD_DEFAULT_MAX_CORRECTED_READ_ERRORS);
5637 mddev->safemode = 0;
5638 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
5639 mddev->safemode_delay = 0;
5640 else
5641 mddev->safemode_delay = (200 * HZ)/1000 +1; /* 200 msec delay */
5642 mddev->in_sync = 1;
5643 smp_wmb();
5644 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
5645 mddev->pers = pers;
5646 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
5647 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
5648 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
5649 if (sysfs_link_rdev(mddev, rdev))
5650 /* failure here is OK */;
5651
5652 if (mddev->degraded && !mddev->ro)
5653 /* This ensures that recovering status is reported immediately
5654 * via sysfs - until a lack of spares is confirmed.
5655 */
5656 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
5657 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5658
5659 if (mddev->sb_flags)
5660 md_update_sb(mddev, 0);
5661
5662 md_new_event(mddev);
5663 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
5664 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
5665 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "degraded");
5666 return 0;
5667
5668abort:
5669 if (mddev->bio_set) {
5670 bioset_free(mddev->bio_set);
5671 mddev->bio_set = NULL;
5672 }
5673 if (mddev->sync_set) {
5674 bioset_free(mddev->sync_set);
5675 mddev->sync_set = NULL;
5676 }
5677
5678 return err;
5679}
5680EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_run);
5681
5682static int do_md_run(struct mddev *mddev)
5683{
5684 int err;
5685
5686 err = md_run(mddev);
5687 if (err)
5688 goto out;
5689 err = bitmap_load(mddev);
5690 if (err) {
5691 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
5692 goto out;
5693 }
5694
5695 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
5696 md_allow_write(mddev);
5697
5698 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5699 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread); /* possibly kick off a reshape */
5700
5701 set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
5702 revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
5703 mddev->changed = 1;
5704 kobject_uevent(&disk_to_dev(mddev->gendisk)->kobj, KOBJ_CHANGE);
5705out:
5706 return err;
5707}
5708
5709static int restart_array(struct mddev *mddev)
5710{
5711 struct gendisk *disk = mddev->gendisk;
5712 struct md_rdev *rdev;
5713 bool has_journal = false;
5714 bool has_readonly = false;
5715
5716 /* Complain if it has no devices */
5717 if (list_empty(&mddev->disks))
5718 return -ENXIO;
5719 if (!mddev->pers)
5720 return -EINVAL;
5721 if (!mddev->ro)
5722 return -EBUSY;
5723
5724 rcu_read_lock();
5725 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev) {
5726 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) &&
5727 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
5728 has_journal = true;
5729 if (bdev_read_only(rdev->bdev))
5730 has_readonly = true;
5731 }
5732 rcu_read_unlock();
5733 if (test_bit(MD_HAS_JOURNAL, &mddev->flags) && !has_journal)
5734 /* Don't restart rw with journal missing/faulty */
5735 return -EINVAL;
5736 if (has_readonly)
5737 return -EROFS;
5738
5739 mddev->safemode = 0;
5740 mddev->ro = 0;
5741 set_disk_ro(disk, 0);
5742 pr_debug("md: %s switched to read-write mode.\n", mdname(mddev));
5743 /* Kick recovery or resync if necessary */
5744 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5745 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5746 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
5747 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
5748 return 0;
5749}
5750
5751static void md_clean(struct mddev *mddev)
5752{
5753 mddev->array_sectors = 0;
5754 mddev->external_size = 0;
5755 mddev->dev_sectors = 0;
5756 mddev->raid_disks = 0;
5757 mddev->recovery_cp = 0;
5758 mddev->resync_min = 0;
5759 mddev->resync_max = MaxSector;
5760 mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
5761 mddev->external = 0;
5762 mddev->persistent = 0;
5763 mddev->level = LEVEL_NONE;
5764 mddev->clevel[0] = 0;
5765 mddev->flags = 0;
5766 mddev->sb_flags = 0;
5767 mddev->ro = 0;
5768 mddev->metadata_type[0] = 0;
5769 mddev->chunk_sectors = 0;
5770 mddev->ctime = mddev->utime = 0;
5771 mddev->layout = 0;
5772 mddev->max_disks = 0;
5773 mddev->events = 0;
5774 mddev->can_decrease_events = 0;
5775 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
5776 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
5777 mddev->new_level = LEVEL_NONE;
5778 mddev->new_layout = 0;
5779 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = 0;
5780 mddev->curr_resync = 0;
5781 atomic64_set(&mddev->resync_mismatches, 0);
5782 mddev->suspend_lo = mddev->suspend_hi = 0;
5783 mddev->sync_speed_min = mddev->sync_speed_max = 0;
5784 mddev->recovery = 0;
5785 mddev->in_sync = 0;
5786 mddev->changed = 0;
5787 mddev->degraded = 0;
5788 mddev->safemode = 0;
5789 mddev->private = NULL;
5790 mddev->cluster_info = NULL;
5791 mddev->bitmap_info.offset = 0;
5792 mddev->bitmap_info.default_offset = 0;
5793 mddev->bitmap_info.default_space = 0;
5794 mddev->bitmap_info.chunksize = 0;
5795 mddev->bitmap_info.daemon_sleep = 0;
5796 mddev->bitmap_info.max_write_behind = 0;
5797 mddev->bitmap_info.nodes = 0;
5798}
5799
5800static void __md_stop_writes(struct mddev *mddev)
5801{
5802 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5803 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
5804 if (mddev->sync_thread) {
5805 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
5806 md_reap_sync_thread(mddev);
5807 }
5808
5809 del_timer_sync(&mddev->safemode_timer);
5810
5811 if (mddev->pers && mddev->pers->quiesce) {
5812 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 1);
5813 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 0);
5814 }
5815 bitmap_flush(mddev);
5816
5817 if (mddev->ro == 0 &&
5818 ((!mddev->in_sync && !mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) ||
5819 mddev->sb_flags)) {
5820 /* mark array as shutdown cleanly */
5821 if (!mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
5822 mddev->in_sync = 1;
5823 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
5824 }
5825}
5826
5827void md_stop_writes(struct mddev *mddev)
5828{
5829 mddev_lock_nointr(mddev);
5830 __md_stop_writes(mddev);
5831 mddev_unlock(mddev);
5832}
5833EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_stop_writes);
5834
5835static void mddev_detach(struct mddev *mddev)
5836{
5837 bitmap_wait_behind_writes(mddev);
5838 if (mddev->pers && mddev->pers->quiesce) {
5839 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 1);
5840 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 0);
5841 }
5842 md_unregister_thread(&mddev->thread);
5843 if (mddev->queue)
5844 blk_sync_queue(mddev->queue); /* the unplug fn references 'conf'*/
5845}
5846
5847static void __md_stop(struct mddev *mddev)
5848{
5849 struct md_personality *pers = mddev->pers;
5850 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
5851 mddev_detach(mddev);
5852 /* Ensure ->event_work is done */
5853 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
5854 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
5855 mddev->pers = NULL;
5856 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
5857 pers->free(mddev, mddev->private);
5858 mddev->private = NULL;
5859 if (pers->sync_request && mddev->to_remove == NULL)
5860 mddev->to_remove = &md_redundancy_group;
5861 module_put(pers->owner);
5862 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5863}
5864
5865void md_stop(struct mddev *mddev)
5866{
5867 /* stop the array and free an attached data structures.
5868 * This is called from dm-raid
5869 */
5870 __md_stop(mddev);
5871 if (mddev->bio_set)
5872 bioset_free(mddev->bio_set);
5873}
5874
5875EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_stop);
5876
5877static int md_set_readonly(struct mddev *mddev, struct block_device *bdev)
5878{
5879 int err = 0;
5880 int did_freeze = 0;
5881
5882 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery)) {
5883 did_freeze = 1;
5884 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5885 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5886 }
5887 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
5888 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
5889 if (mddev->sync_thread)
5890 /* Thread might be blocked waiting for metadata update
5891 * which will now never happen */
5892 wake_up_process(mddev->sync_thread->tsk);
5893
5894 if (mddev->external && test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags))
5895 return -EBUSY;
5896 mddev_unlock(mddev);
5897 wait_event(resync_wait, !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING,
5898 &mddev->recovery));
5899 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
5900 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags));
5901 mddev_lock_nointr(mddev);
5902
5903 mutex_lock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5904 if ((mddev->pers && atomic_read(&mddev->openers) > !!bdev) ||
5905 mddev->sync_thread ||
5906 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery)) {
5907 pr_warn("md: %s still in use.\n",mdname(mddev));
5908 if (did_freeze) {
5909 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5910 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5911 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5912 }
5913 err = -EBUSY;
5914 goto out;
5915 }
5916 if (mddev->pers) {
5917 __md_stop_writes(mddev);
5918
5919 err = -ENXIO;
5920 if (mddev->ro==1)
5921 goto out;
5922 mddev->ro = 1;
5923 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 1);
5924 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5925 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5926 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5927 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
5928 err = 0;
5929 }
5930out:
5931 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5932 return err;
5933}
5934
5935/* mode:
5936 * 0 - completely stop and dis-assemble array
5937 * 2 - stop but do not disassemble array
5938 */
5939static int do_md_stop(struct mddev *mddev, int mode,
5940 struct block_device *bdev)
5941{
5942 struct gendisk *disk = mddev->gendisk;
5943 struct md_rdev *rdev;
5944 int did_freeze = 0;
5945
5946 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery)) {
5947 did_freeze = 1;
5948 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5949 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5950 }
5951 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
5952 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
5953 if (mddev->sync_thread)
5954 /* Thread might be blocked waiting for metadata update
5955 * which will now never happen */
5956 wake_up_process(mddev->sync_thread->tsk);
5957
5958 mddev_unlock(mddev);
5959 wait_event(resync_wait, (mddev->sync_thread == NULL &&
5960 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING,
5961 &mddev->recovery)));
5962 mddev_lock_nointr(mddev);
5963
5964 mutex_lock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5965 if ((mddev->pers && atomic_read(&mddev->openers) > !!bdev) ||
5966 mddev->sysfs_active ||
5967 mddev->sync_thread ||
5968 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery)) {
5969 pr_warn("md: %s still in use.\n",mdname(mddev));
5970 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5971 if (did_freeze) {
5972 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery);
5973 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5974 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5975 }
5976 return -EBUSY;
5977 }
5978 if (mddev->pers) {
5979 if (mddev->ro)
5980 set_disk_ro(disk, 0);
5981
5982 __md_stop_writes(mddev);
5983 __md_stop(mddev);
5984 mddev->queue->backing_dev_info->congested_fn = NULL;
5985
5986 /* tell userspace to handle 'inactive' */
5987 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
5988
5989 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
5990 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
5991 sysfs_unlink_rdev(mddev, rdev);
5992
5993 set_capacity(disk, 0);
5994 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
5995 mddev->changed = 1;
5996 revalidate_disk(disk);
5997
5998 if (mddev->ro)
5999 mddev->ro = 0;
6000 } else
6001 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
6002 /*
6003 * Free resources if final stop
6004 */
6005 if (mode == 0) {
6006 pr_info("md: %s stopped.\n", mdname(mddev));
6007
6008 if (mddev->bitmap_info.file) {
6009 struct file *f = mddev->bitmap_info.file;
6010 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6011 mddev->bitmap_info.file = NULL;
6012 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6013 fput(f);
6014 }
6015 mddev->bitmap_info.offset = 0;
6016
6017 export_array(mddev);
6018
6019 md_clean(mddev);
6020 if (mddev->hold_active == UNTIL_STOP)
6021 mddev->hold_active = 0;
6022 }
6023 md_new_event(mddev);
6024 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
6025 return 0;
6026}
6027
6028#ifndef MODULE
6029static void autorun_array(struct mddev *mddev)
6030{
6031 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6032 int err;
6033
6034 if (list_empty(&mddev->disks))
6035 return;
6036
6037 pr_info("md: running: ");
6038
6039 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
6040 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6041 pr_cont("<%s>", bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
6042 }
6043 pr_cont("\n");
6044
6045 err = do_md_run(mddev);
6046 if (err) {
6047 pr_warn("md: do_md_run() returned %d\n", err);
6048 do_md_stop(mddev, 0, NULL);
6049 }
6050}
6051
6052/*
6053 * lets try to run arrays based on all disks that have arrived
6054 * until now. (those are in pending_raid_disks)
6055 *
6056 * the method: pick the first pending disk, collect all disks with
6057 * the same UUID, remove all from the pending list and put them into
6058 * the 'same_array' list. Then order this list based on superblock
6059 * update time (freshest comes first), kick out 'old' disks and
6060 * compare superblocks. If everything's fine then run it.
6061 *
6062 * If "unit" is allocated, then bump its reference count
6063 */
6064static void autorun_devices(int part)
6065{
6066 struct md_rdev *rdev0, *rdev, *tmp;
6067 struct mddev *mddev;
6068 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6069
6070 pr_info("md: autorun ...\n");
6071 while (!list_empty(&pending_raid_disks)) {
6072 int unit;
6073 dev_t dev;
6074 LIST_HEAD(candidates);
6075 rdev0 = list_entry(pending_raid_disks.next,
6076 struct md_rdev, same_set);
6077
6078 pr_debug("md: considering %s ...\n", bdevname(rdev0->bdev,b));
6079 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&candidates);
6080 rdev_for_each_list(rdev, tmp, &pending_raid_disks)
6081 if (super_90_load(rdev, rdev0, 0) >= 0) {
6082 pr_debug("md: adding %s ...\n",
6083 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
6084 list_move(&rdev->same_set, &candidates);
6085 }
6086 /*
6087 * now we have a set of devices, with all of them having
6088 * mostly sane superblocks. It's time to allocate the
6089 * mddev.
6090 */
6091 if (part) {
6092 dev = MKDEV(mdp_major,
6093 rdev0->preferred_minor << MdpMinorShift);
6094 unit = MINOR(dev) >> MdpMinorShift;
6095 } else {
6096 dev = MKDEV(MD_MAJOR, rdev0->preferred_minor);
6097 unit = MINOR(dev);
6098 }
6099 if (rdev0->preferred_minor != unit) {
6100 pr_warn("md: unit number in %s is bad: %d\n",
6101 bdevname(rdev0->bdev, b), rdev0->preferred_minor);
6102 break;
6103 }
6104
6105 md_probe(dev, NULL, NULL);
6106 mddev = mddev_find(dev);
6107 if (!mddev || !mddev->gendisk) {
6108 if (mddev)
6109 mddev_put(mddev);
6110 break;
6111 }
6112 if (mddev_lock(mddev))
6113 pr_warn("md: %s locked, cannot run\n", mdname(mddev));
6114 else if (mddev->raid_disks || mddev->major_version
6115 || !list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
6116 pr_warn("md: %s already running, cannot run %s\n",
6117 mdname(mddev), bdevname(rdev0->bdev,b));
6118 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6119 } else {
6120 pr_debug("md: created %s\n", mdname(mddev));
6121 mddev->persistent = 1;
6122 rdev_for_each_list(rdev, tmp, &candidates) {
6123 list_del_init(&rdev->same_set);
6124 if (bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev))
6125 export_rdev(rdev);
6126 }
6127 autorun_array(mddev);
6128 mddev_unlock(mddev);
6129 }
6130 /* on success, candidates will be empty, on error
6131 * it won't...
6132 */
6133 rdev_for_each_list(rdev, tmp, &candidates) {
6134 list_del_init(&rdev->same_set);
6135 export_rdev(rdev);
6136 }
6137 mddev_put(mddev);
6138 }
6139 pr_info("md: ... autorun DONE.\n");
6140}
6141#endif /* !MODULE */
6142
6143static int get_version(void __user *arg)
6144{
6145 mdu_version_t ver;
6146
6147 ver.major = MD_MAJOR_VERSION;
6148 ver.minor = MD_MINOR_VERSION;
6149 ver.patchlevel = MD_PATCHLEVEL_VERSION;
6150
6151 if (copy_to_user(arg, &ver, sizeof(ver)))
6152 return -EFAULT;
6153
6154 return 0;
6155}
6156
6157static int get_array_info(struct mddev *mddev, void __user *arg)
6158{
6159 mdu_array_info_t info;
6160 int nr,working,insync,failed,spare;
6161 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6162
6163 nr = working = insync = failed = spare = 0;
6164 rcu_read_lock();
6165 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev) {
6166 nr++;
6167 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
6168 failed++;
6169 else {
6170 working++;
6171 if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
6172 insync++;
6173 else if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
6174 /* TODO: add journal count to md_u.h */
6175 ;
6176 else
6177 spare++;
6178 }
6179 }
6180 rcu_read_unlock();
6181
6182 info.major_version = mddev->major_version;
6183 info.minor_version = mddev->minor_version;
6184 info.patch_version = MD_PATCHLEVEL_VERSION;
6185 info.ctime = clamp_t(time64_t, mddev->ctime, 0, U32_MAX);
6186 info.level = mddev->level;
6187 info.size = mddev->dev_sectors / 2;
6188 if (info.size != mddev->dev_sectors / 2) /* overflow */
6189 info.size = -1;
6190 info.nr_disks = nr;
6191 info.raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks;
6192 info.md_minor = mddev->md_minor;
6193 info.not_persistent= !mddev->persistent;
6194
6195 info.utime = clamp_t(time64_t, mddev->utime, 0, U32_MAX);
6196 info.state = 0;
6197 if (mddev->in_sync)
6198 info.state = (1<<MD_SB_CLEAN);
6199 if (mddev->bitmap && mddev->bitmap_info.offset)
6200 info.state |= (1<<MD_SB_BITMAP_PRESENT);
6201 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
6202 info.state |= (1<<MD_SB_CLUSTERED);
6203 info.active_disks = insync;
6204 info.working_disks = working;
6205 info.failed_disks = failed;
6206 info.spare_disks = spare;
6207
6208 info.layout = mddev->layout;
6209 info.chunk_size = mddev->chunk_sectors << 9;
6210
6211 if (copy_to_user(arg, &info, sizeof(info)))
6212 return -EFAULT;
6213
6214 return 0;
6215}
6216
6217static int get_bitmap_file(struct mddev *mddev, void __user * arg)
6218{
6219 mdu_bitmap_file_t *file = NULL; /* too big for stack allocation */
6220 char *ptr;
6221 int err;
6222
6223 file = kzalloc(sizeof(*file), GFP_NOIO);
6224 if (!file)
6225 return -ENOMEM;
6226
6227 err = 0;
6228 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6229 /* bitmap enabled */
6230 if (mddev->bitmap_info.file) {
6231 ptr = file_path(mddev->bitmap_info.file, file->pathname,
6232 sizeof(file->pathname));
6233 if (IS_ERR(ptr))
6234 err = PTR_ERR(ptr);
6235 else
6236 memmove(file->pathname, ptr,
6237 sizeof(file->pathname)-(ptr-file->pathname));
6238 }
6239 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6240
6241 if (err == 0 &&
6242 copy_to_user(arg, file, sizeof(*file)))
6243 err = -EFAULT;
6244
6245 kfree(file);
6246 return err;
6247}
6248
6249static int get_disk_info(struct mddev *mddev, void __user * arg)
6250{
6251 mdu_disk_info_t info;
6252 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6253
6254 if (copy_from_user(&info, arg, sizeof(info)))
6255 return -EFAULT;
6256
6257 rcu_read_lock();
6258 rdev = md_find_rdev_nr_rcu(mddev, info.number);
6259 if (rdev) {
6260 info.major = MAJOR(rdev->bdev->bd_dev);
6261 info.minor = MINOR(rdev->bdev->bd_dev);
6262 info.raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
6263 info.state = 0;
6264 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
6265 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_FAULTY);
6266 else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
6267 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_ACTIVE);
6268 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_SYNC);
6269 }
6270 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
6271 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_JOURNAL);
6272 if (test_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags))
6273 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_WRITEMOSTLY);
6274 if (test_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags))
6275 info.state |= (1<<MD_DISK_FAILFAST);
6276 } else {
6277 info.major = info.minor = 0;
6278 info.raid_disk = -1;
6279 info.state = (1<<MD_DISK_REMOVED);
6280 }
6281 rcu_read_unlock();
6282
6283 if (copy_to_user(arg, &info, sizeof(info)))
6284 return -EFAULT;
6285
6286 return 0;
6287}
6288
6289static int add_new_disk(struct mddev *mddev, mdu_disk_info_t *info)
6290{
6291 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE], b2[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6292 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6293 dev_t dev = MKDEV(info->major,info->minor);
6294
6295 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev) &&
6296 !(info->state & ((1 << MD_DISK_CLUSTER_ADD) | (1 << MD_DISK_CANDIDATE)))) {
6297 pr_warn("%s: Cannot add to clustered mddev.\n",
6298 mdname(mddev));
6299 return -EINVAL;
6300 }
6301
6302 if (info->major != MAJOR(dev) || info->minor != MINOR(dev))
6303 return -EOVERFLOW;
6304
6305 if (!mddev->raid_disks) {
6306 int err;
6307 /* expecting a device which has a superblock */
6308 rdev = md_import_device(dev, mddev->major_version, mddev->minor_version);
6309 if (IS_ERR(rdev)) {
6310 pr_warn("md: md_import_device returned %ld\n",
6311 PTR_ERR(rdev));
6312 return PTR_ERR(rdev);
6313 }
6314 if (!list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
6315 struct md_rdev *rdev0
6316 = list_entry(mddev->disks.next,
6317 struct md_rdev, same_set);
6318 err = super_types[mddev->major_version]
6319 .load_super(rdev, rdev0, mddev->minor_version);
6320 if (err < 0) {
6321 pr_warn("md: %s has different UUID to %s\n",
6322 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b),
6323 bdevname(rdev0->bdev,b2));
6324 export_rdev(rdev);
6325 return -EINVAL;
6326 }
6327 }
6328 err = bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev);
6329 if (err)
6330 export_rdev(rdev);
6331 return err;
6332 }
6333
6334 /*
6335 * add_new_disk can be used once the array is assembled
6336 * to add "hot spares". They must already have a superblock
6337 * written
6338 */
6339 if (mddev->pers) {
6340 int err;
6341 if (!mddev->pers->hot_add_disk) {
6342 pr_warn("%s: personality does not support diskops!\n",
6343 mdname(mddev));
6344 return -EINVAL;
6345 }
6346 if (mddev->persistent)
6347 rdev = md_import_device(dev, mddev->major_version,
6348 mddev->minor_version);
6349 else
6350 rdev = md_import_device(dev, -1, -1);
6351 if (IS_ERR(rdev)) {
6352 pr_warn("md: md_import_device returned %ld\n",
6353 PTR_ERR(rdev));
6354 return PTR_ERR(rdev);
6355 }
6356 /* set saved_raid_disk if appropriate */
6357 if (!mddev->persistent) {
6358 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_SYNC) &&
6359 info->raid_disk < mddev->raid_disks) {
6360 rdev->raid_disk = info->raid_disk;
6361 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
6362 clear_bit(Bitmap_sync, &rdev->flags);
6363 } else
6364 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
6365 rdev->saved_raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
6366 } else
6367 super_types[mddev->major_version].
6368 validate_super(mddev, rdev);
6369 if ((info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_SYNC)) &&
6370 rdev->raid_disk != info->raid_disk) {
6371 /* This was a hot-add request, but events doesn't
6372 * match, so reject it.
6373 */
6374 export_rdev(rdev);
6375 return -EINVAL;
6376 }
6377
6378 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags); /* just to be sure */
6379 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_WRITEMOSTLY))
6380 set_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
6381 else
6382 clear_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
6383 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_FAILFAST))
6384 set_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags);
6385 else
6386 clear_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags);
6387
6388 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_JOURNAL)) {
6389 struct md_rdev *rdev2;
6390 bool has_journal = false;
6391
6392 /* make sure no existing journal disk */
6393 rdev_for_each(rdev2, mddev) {
6394 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev2->flags)) {
6395 has_journal = true;
6396 break;
6397 }
6398 }
6399 if (has_journal || mddev->bitmap) {
6400 export_rdev(rdev);
6401 return -EBUSY;
6402 }
6403 set_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags);
6404 }
6405 /*
6406 * check whether the device shows up in other nodes
6407 */
6408 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
6409 if (info->state & (1 << MD_DISK_CANDIDATE))
6410 set_bit(Candidate, &rdev->flags);
6411 else if (info->state & (1 << MD_DISK_CLUSTER_ADD)) {
6412 /* --add initiated by this node */
6413 err = md_cluster_ops->add_new_disk(mddev, rdev);
6414 if (err) {
6415 export_rdev(rdev);
6416 return err;
6417 }
6418 }
6419 }
6420
6421 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
6422 err = bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev);
6423
6424 if (err)
6425 export_rdev(rdev);
6426
6427 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
6428 if (info->state & (1 << MD_DISK_CANDIDATE)) {
6429 if (!err) {
6430 err = md_cluster_ops->new_disk_ack(mddev,
6431 err == 0);
6432 if (err)
6433 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
6434 }
6435 } else {
6436 if (err)
6437 md_cluster_ops->add_new_disk_cancel(mddev);
6438 else
6439 err = add_bound_rdev(rdev);
6440 }
6441
6442 } else if (!err)
6443 err = add_bound_rdev(rdev);
6444
6445 return err;
6446 }
6447
6448 /* otherwise, add_new_disk is only allowed
6449 * for major_version==0 superblocks
6450 */
6451 if (mddev->major_version != 0) {
6452 pr_warn("%s: ADD_NEW_DISK not supported\n", mdname(mddev));
6453 return -EINVAL;
6454 }
6455
6456 if (!(info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_FAULTY))) {
6457 int err;
6458 rdev = md_import_device(dev, -1, 0);
6459 if (IS_ERR(rdev)) {
6460 pr_warn("md: error, md_import_device() returned %ld\n",
6461 PTR_ERR(rdev));
6462 return PTR_ERR(rdev);
6463 }
6464 rdev->desc_nr = info->number;
6465 if (info->raid_disk < mddev->raid_disks)
6466 rdev->raid_disk = info->raid_disk;
6467 else
6468 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
6469
6470 if (rdev->raid_disk < mddev->raid_disks)
6471 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_SYNC))
6472 set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
6473
6474 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_WRITEMOSTLY))
6475 set_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags);
6476 if (info->state & (1<<MD_DISK_FAILFAST))
6477 set_bit(FailFast, &rdev->flags);
6478
6479 if (!mddev->persistent) {
6480 pr_debug("md: nonpersistent superblock ...\n");
6481 rdev->sb_start = i_size_read(rdev->bdev->bd_inode) / 512;
6482 } else
6483 rdev->sb_start = calc_dev_sboffset(rdev);
6484 rdev->sectors = rdev->sb_start;
6485
6486 err = bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev);
6487 if (err) {
6488 export_rdev(rdev);
6489 return err;
6490 }
6491 }
6492
6493 return 0;
6494}
6495
6496static int hot_remove_disk(struct mddev *mddev, dev_t dev)
6497{
6498 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6499 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6500
6501 rdev = find_rdev(mddev, dev);
6502 if (!rdev)
6503 return -ENXIO;
6504
6505 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
6506 goto kick_rdev;
6507
6508 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
6509 remove_and_add_spares(mddev, rdev);
6510
6511 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
6512 goto busy;
6513
6514kick_rdev:
6515 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
6516 md_cluster_ops->remove_disk(mddev, rdev);
6517
6518 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
6519 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
6520 if (mddev->thread)
6521 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
6522 else
6523 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
6524 md_new_event(mddev);
6525
6526 return 0;
6527busy:
6528 pr_debug("md: cannot remove active disk %s from %s ...\n",
6529 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b), mdname(mddev));
6530 return -EBUSY;
6531}
6532
6533static int hot_add_disk(struct mddev *mddev, dev_t dev)
6534{
6535 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
6536 int err;
6537 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6538
6539 if (!mddev->pers)
6540 return -ENODEV;
6541
6542 if (mddev->major_version != 0) {
6543 pr_warn("%s: HOT_ADD may only be used with version-0 superblocks.\n",
6544 mdname(mddev));
6545 return -EINVAL;
6546 }
6547 if (!mddev->pers->hot_add_disk) {
6548 pr_warn("%s: personality does not support diskops!\n",
6549 mdname(mddev));
6550 return -EINVAL;
6551 }
6552
6553 rdev = md_import_device(dev, -1, 0);
6554 if (IS_ERR(rdev)) {
6555 pr_warn("md: error, md_import_device() returned %ld\n",
6556 PTR_ERR(rdev));
6557 return -EINVAL;
6558 }
6559
6560 if (mddev->persistent)
6561 rdev->sb_start = calc_dev_sboffset(rdev);
6562 else
6563 rdev->sb_start = i_size_read(rdev->bdev->bd_inode) / 512;
6564
6565 rdev->sectors = rdev->sb_start;
6566
6567 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
6568 pr_warn("md: can not hot-add faulty %s disk to %s!\n",
6569 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b), mdname(mddev));
6570 err = -EINVAL;
6571 goto abort_export;
6572 }
6573
6574 clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
6575 rdev->desc_nr = -1;
6576 rdev->saved_raid_disk = -1;
6577 err = bind_rdev_to_array(rdev, mddev);
6578 if (err)
6579 goto abort_export;
6580
6581 /*
6582 * The rest should better be atomic, we can have disk failures
6583 * noticed in interrupt contexts ...
6584 */
6585
6586 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
6587
6588 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
6589 if (!mddev->thread)
6590 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
6591 /*
6592 * Kick recovery, maybe this spare has to be added to the
6593 * array immediately.
6594 */
6595 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
6596 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
6597 md_new_event(mddev);
6598 return 0;
6599
6600abort_export:
6601 export_rdev(rdev);
6602 return err;
6603}
6604
6605static int set_bitmap_file(struct mddev *mddev, int fd)
6606{
6607 int err = 0;
6608
6609 if (mddev->pers) {
6610 if (!mddev->pers->quiesce || !mddev->thread)
6611 return -EBUSY;
6612 if (mddev->recovery || mddev->sync_thread)
6613 return -EBUSY;
6614 /* we should be able to change the bitmap.. */
6615 }
6616
6617 if (fd >= 0) {
6618 struct inode *inode;
6619 struct file *f;
6620
6621 if (mddev->bitmap || mddev->bitmap_info.file)
6622 return -EEXIST; /* cannot add when bitmap is present */
6623 f = fget(fd);
6624
6625 if (f == NULL) {
6626 pr_warn("%s: error: failed to get bitmap file\n",
6627 mdname(mddev));
6628 return -EBADF;
6629 }
6630
6631 inode = f->f_mapping->host;
6632 if (!S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
6633 pr_warn("%s: error: bitmap file must be a regular file\n",
6634 mdname(mddev));
6635 err = -EBADF;
6636 } else if (!(f->f_mode & FMODE_WRITE)) {
6637 pr_warn("%s: error: bitmap file must open for write\n",
6638 mdname(mddev));
6639 err = -EBADF;
6640 } else if (atomic_read(&inode->i_writecount) != 1) {
6641 pr_warn("%s: error: bitmap file is already in use\n",
6642 mdname(mddev));
6643 err = -EBUSY;
6644 }
6645 if (err) {
6646 fput(f);
6647 return err;
6648 }
6649 mddev->bitmap_info.file = f;
6650 mddev->bitmap_info.offset = 0; /* file overrides offset */
6651 } else if (mddev->bitmap == NULL)
6652 return -ENOENT; /* cannot remove what isn't there */
6653 err = 0;
6654 if (mddev->pers) {
6655 if (fd >= 0) {
6656 struct bitmap *bitmap;
6657
6658 bitmap = bitmap_create(mddev, -1);
6659 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6660 if (!IS_ERR(bitmap)) {
6661 mddev->bitmap = bitmap;
6662 err = bitmap_load(mddev);
6663 } else
6664 err = PTR_ERR(bitmap);
6665 if (err) {
6666 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
6667 fd = -1;
6668 }
6669 mddev_resume(mddev);
6670 } else if (fd < 0) {
6671 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6672 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
6673 mddev_resume(mddev);
6674 }
6675 }
6676 if (fd < 0) {
6677 struct file *f = mddev->bitmap_info.file;
6678 if (f) {
6679 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
6680 mddev->bitmap_info.file = NULL;
6681 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
6682 fput(f);
6683 }
6684 }
6685
6686 return err;
6687}
6688
6689/*
6690 * set_array_info is used two different ways
6691 * The original usage is when creating a new array.
6692 * In this usage, raid_disks is > 0 and it together with
6693 * level, size, not_persistent,layout,chunksize determine the
6694 * shape of the array.
6695 * This will always create an array with a type-0.90.0 superblock.
6696 * The newer usage is when assembling an array.
6697 * In this case raid_disks will be 0, and the major_version field is
6698 * use to determine which style super-blocks are to be found on the devices.
6699 * The minor and patch _version numbers are also kept incase the
6700 * super_block handler wishes to interpret them.
6701 */
6702static int set_array_info(struct mddev *mddev, mdu_array_info_t *info)
6703{
6704
6705 if (info->raid_disks == 0) {
6706 /* just setting version number for superblock loading */
6707 if (info->major_version < 0 ||
6708 info->major_version >= ARRAY_SIZE(super_types) ||
6709 super_types[info->major_version].name == NULL) {
6710 /* maybe try to auto-load a module? */
6711 pr_warn("md: superblock version %d not known\n",
6712 info->major_version);
6713 return -EINVAL;
6714 }
6715 mddev->major_version = info->major_version;
6716 mddev->minor_version = info->minor_version;
6717 mddev->patch_version = info->patch_version;
6718 mddev->persistent = !info->not_persistent;
6719 /* ensure mddev_put doesn't delete this now that there
6720 * is some minimal configuration.
6721 */
6722 mddev->ctime = ktime_get_real_seconds();
6723 return 0;
6724 }
6725 mddev->major_version = MD_MAJOR_VERSION;
6726 mddev->minor_version = MD_MINOR_VERSION;
6727 mddev->patch_version = MD_PATCHLEVEL_VERSION;
6728 mddev->ctime = ktime_get_real_seconds();
6729
6730 mddev->level = info->level;
6731 mddev->clevel[0] = 0;
6732 mddev->dev_sectors = 2 * (sector_t)info->size;
6733 mddev->raid_disks = info->raid_disks;
6734 /* don't set md_minor, it is determined by which /dev/md* was
6735 * openned
6736 */
6737 if (info->state & (1<<MD_SB_CLEAN))
6738 mddev->recovery_cp = MaxSector;
6739 else
6740 mddev->recovery_cp = 0;
6741 mddev->persistent = ! info->not_persistent;
6742 mddev->external = 0;
6743
6744 mddev->layout = info->layout;
6745 mddev->chunk_sectors = info->chunk_size >> 9;
6746
6747 if (mddev->persistent) {
6748 mddev->max_disks = MD_SB_DISKS;
6749 mddev->flags = 0;
6750 mddev->sb_flags = 0;
6751 }
6752 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
6753
6754 mddev->bitmap_info.default_offset = MD_SB_BYTES >> 9;
6755 mddev->bitmap_info.default_space = 64*2 - (MD_SB_BYTES >> 9);
6756 mddev->bitmap_info.offset = 0;
6757
6758 mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
6759
6760 /*
6761 * Generate a 128 bit UUID
6762 */
6763 get_random_bytes(mddev->uuid, 16);
6764
6765 mddev->new_level = mddev->level;
6766 mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
6767 mddev->new_layout = mddev->layout;
6768 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
6769 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
6770
6771 return 0;
6772}
6773
6774void md_set_array_sectors(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t array_sectors)
6775{
6776 WARN(!mddev_is_locked(mddev), "%s: unlocked mddev!\n", __func__);
6777
6778 if (mddev->external_size)
6779 return;
6780
6781 mddev->array_sectors = array_sectors;
6782}
6783EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_set_array_sectors);
6784
6785static int update_size(struct mddev *mddev, sector_t num_sectors)
6786{
6787 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6788 int rv;
6789 int fit = (num_sectors == 0);
6790 sector_t old_dev_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
6791
6792 if (mddev->pers->resize == NULL)
6793 return -EINVAL;
6794 /* The "num_sectors" is the number of sectors of each device that
6795 * is used. This can only make sense for arrays with redundancy.
6796 * linear and raid0 always use whatever space is available. We can only
6797 * consider changing this number if no resync or reconstruction is
6798 * happening, and if the new size is acceptable. It must fit before the
6799 * sb_start or, if that is <data_offset, it must fit before the size
6800 * of each device. If num_sectors is zero, we find the largest size
6801 * that fits.
6802 */
6803 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery) ||
6804 mddev->sync_thread)
6805 return -EBUSY;
6806 if (mddev->ro)
6807 return -EROFS;
6808
6809 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
6810 sector_t avail = rdev->sectors;
6811
6812 if (fit && (num_sectors == 0 || num_sectors > avail))
6813 num_sectors = avail;
6814 if (avail < num_sectors)
6815 return -ENOSPC;
6816 }
6817 rv = mddev->pers->resize(mddev, num_sectors);
6818 if (!rv) {
6819 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
6820 md_cluster_ops->update_size(mddev, old_dev_sectors);
6821 else if (mddev->queue) {
6822 set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
6823 revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
6824 }
6825 }
6826 return rv;
6827}
6828
6829static int update_raid_disks(struct mddev *mddev, int raid_disks)
6830{
6831 int rv;
6832 struct md_rdev *rdev;
6833 /* change the number of raid disks */
6834 if (mddev->pers->check_reshape == NULL)
6835 return -EINVAL;
6836 if (mddev->ro)
6837 return -EROFS;
6838 if (raid_disks <= 0 ||
6839 (mddev->max_disks && raid_disks >= mddev->max_disks))
6840 return -EINVAL;
6841 if (mddev->sync_thread ||
6842 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery) ||
6843 mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector)
6844 return -EBUSY;
6845
6846 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
6847 if (mddev->raid_disks < raid_disks &&
6848 rdev->data_offset < rdev->new_data_offset)
6849 return -EINVAL;
6850 if (mddev->raid_disks > raid_disks &&
6851 rdev->data_offset > rdev->new_data_offset)
6852 return -EINVAL;
6853 }
6854
6855 mddev->delta_disks = raid_disks - mddev->raid_disks;
6856 if (mddev->delta_disks < 0)
6857 mddev->reshape_backwards = 1;
6858 else if (mddev->delta_disks > 0)
6859 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
6860
6861 rv = mddev->pers->check_reshape(mddev);
6862 if (rv < 0) {
6863 mddev->delta_disks = 0;
6864 mddev->reshape_backwards = 0;
6865 }
6866 return rv;
6867}
6868
6869/*
6870 * update_array_info is used to change the configuration of an
6871 * on-line array.
6872 * The version, ctime,level,size,raid_disks,not_persistent, layout,chunk_size
6873 * fields in the info are checked against the array.
6874 * Any differences that cannot be handled will cause an error.
6875 * Normally, only one change can be managed at a time.
6876 */
6877static int update_array_info(struct mddev *mddev, mdu_array_info_t *info)
6878{
6879 int rv = 0;
6880 int cnt = 0;
6881 int state = 0;
6882
6883 /* calculate expected state,ignoring low bits */
6884 if (mddev->bitmap && mddev->bitmap_info.offset)
6885 state |= (1 << MD_SB_BITMAP_PRESENT);
6886
6887 if (mddev->major_version != info->major_version ||
6888 mddev->minor_version != info->minor_version ||
6889/* mddev->patch_version != info->patch_version || */
6890 mddev->ctime != info->ctime ||
6891 mddev->level != info->level ||
6892/* mddev->layout != info->layout || */
6893 mddev->persistent != !info->not_persistent ||
6894 mddev->chunk_sectors != info->chunk_size >> 9 ||
6895 /* ignore bottom 8 bits of state, and allow SB_BITMAP_PRESENT to change */
6896 ((state^info->state) & 0xfffffe00)
6897 )
6898 return -EINVAL;
6899 /* Check there is only one change */
6900 if (info->size >= 0 && mddev->dev_sectors / 2 != info->size)
6901 cnt++;
6902 if (mddev->raid_disks != info->raid_disks)
6903 cnt++;
6904 if (mddev->layout != info->layout)
6905 cnt++;
6906 if ((state ^ info->state) & (1<<MD_SB_BITMAP_PRESENT))
6907 cnt++;
6908 if (cnt == 0)
6909 return 0;
6910 if (cnt > 1)
6911 return -EINVAL;
6912
6913 if (mddev->layout != info->layout) {
6914 /* Change layout
6915 * we don't need to do anything at the md level, the
6916 * personality will take care of it all.
6917 */
6918 if (mddev->pers->check_reshape == NULL)
6919 return -EINVAL;
6920 else {
6921 mddev->new_layout = info->layout;
6922 rv = mddev->pers->check_reshape(mddev);
6923 if (rv)
6924 mddev->new_layout = mddev->layout;
6925 return rv;
6926 }
6927 }
6928 if (info->size >= 0 && mddev->dev_sectors / 2 != info->size)
6929 rv = update_size(mddev, (sector_t)info->size * 2);
6930
6931 if (mddev->raid_disks != info->raid_disks)
6932 rv = update_raid_disks(mddev, info->raid_disks);
6933
6934 if ((state ^ info->state) & (1<<MD_SB_BITMAP_PRESENT)) {
6935 if (mddev->pers->quiesce == NULL || mddev->thread == NULL) {
6936 rv = -EINVAL;
6937 goto err;
6938 }
6939 if (mddev->recovery || mddev->sync_thread) {
6940 rv = -EBUSY;
6941 goto err;
6942 }
6943 if (info->state & (1<<MD_SB_BITMAP_PRESENT)) {
6944 struct bitmap *bitmap;
6945 /* add the bitmap */
6946 if (mddev->bitmap) {
6947 rv = -EEXIST;
6948 goto err;
6949 }
6950 if (mddev->bitmap_info.default_offset == 0) {
6951 rv = -EINVAL;
6952 goto err;
6953 }
6954 mddev->bitmap_info.offset =
6955 mddev->bitmap_info.default_offset;
6956 mddev->bitmap_info.space =
6957 mddev->bitmap_info.default_space;
6958 bitmap = bitmap_create(mddev, -1);
6959 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6960 if (!IS_ERR(bitmap)) {
6961 mddev->bitmap = bitmap;
6962 rv = bitmap_load(mddev);
6963 } else
6964 rv = PTR_ERR(bitmap);
6965 if (rv)
6966 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
6967 mddev_resume(mddev);
6968 } else {
6969 /* remove the bitmap */
6970 if (!mddev->bitmap) {
6971 rv = -ENOENT;
6972 goto err;
6973 }
6974 if (mddev->bitmap->storage.file) {
6975 rv = -EINVAL;
6976 goto err;
6977 }
6978 if (mddev->bitmap_info.nodes) {
6979 /* hold PW on all the bitmap lock */
6980 if (md_cluster_ops->lock_all_bitmaps(mddev) <= 0) {
6981 pr_warn("md: can't change bitmap to none since the array is in use by more than one node\n");
6982 rv = -EPERM;
6983 md_cluster_ops->unlock_all_bitmaps(mddev);
6984 goto err;
6985 }
6986
6987 mddev->bitmap_info.nodes = 0;
6988 md_cluster_ops->leave(mddev);
6989 }
6990 mddev_suspend(mddev);
6991 bitmap_destroy(mddev);
6992 mddev_resume(mddev);
6993 mddev->bitmap_info.offset = 0;
6994 }
6995 }
6996 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
6997 return rv;
6998err:
6999 return rv;
7000}
7001
7002static int set_disk_faulty(struct mddev *mddev, dev_t dev)
7003{
7004 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7005 int err = 0;
7006
7007 if (mddev->pers == NULL)
7008 return -ENODEV;
7009
7010 rcu_read_lock();
7011 rdev = find_rdev_rcu(mddev, dev);
7012 if (!rdev)
7013 err = -ENODEV;
7014 else {
7015 md_error(mddev, rdev);
7016 if (!test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
7017 err = -EBUSY;
7018 }
7019 rcu_read_unlock();
7020 return err;
7021}
7022
7023/*
7024 * We have a problem here : there is no easy way to give a CHS
7025 * virtual geometry. We currently pretend that we have a 2 heads
7026 * 4 sectors (with a BIG number of cylinders...). This drives
7027 * dosfs just mad... ;-)
7028 */
7029static int md_getgeo(struct block_device *bdev, struct hd_geometry *geo)
7030{
7031 struct mddev *mddev = bdev->bd_disk->private_data;
7032
7033 geo->heads = 2;
7034 geo->sectors = 4;
7035 geo->cylinders = mddev->array_sectors / 8;
7036 return 0;
7037}
7038
7039static inline bool md_ioctl_valid(unsigned int cmd)
7040{
7041 switch (cmd) {
7042 case ADD_NEW_DISK:
7043 case BLKROSET:
7044 case GET_ARRAY_INFO:
7045 case GET_BITMAP_FILE:
7046 case GET_DISK_INFO:
7047 case HOT_ADD_DISK:
7048 case HOT_REMOVE_DISK:
7049 case RAID_AUTORUN:
7050 case RAID_VERSION:
7051 case RESTART_ARRAY_RW:
7052 case RUN_ARRAY:
7053 case SET_ARRAY_INFO:
7054 case SET_BITMAP_FILE:
7055 case SET_DISK_FAULTY:
7056 case STOP_ARRAY:
7057 case STOP_ARRAY_RO:
7058 case CLUSTERED_DISK_NACK:
7059 return true;
7060 default:
7061 return false;
7062 }
7063}
7064
7065static int md_ioctl(struct block_device *bdev, fmode_t mode,
7066 unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
7067{
7068 int err = 0;
7069 void __user *argp = (void __user *)arg;
7070 struct mddev *mddev = NULL;
7071 int ro;
7072 bool did_set_md_closing = false;
7073
7074 if (!md_ioctl_valid(cmd))
7075 return -ENOTTY;
7076
7077 switch (cmd) {
7078 case RAID_VERSION:
7079 case GET_ARRAY_INFO:
7080 case GET_DISK_INFO:
7081 break;
7082 default:
7083 if (!capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
7084 return -EACCES;
7085 }
7086
7087 /*
7088 * Commands dealing with the RAID driver but not any
7089 * particular array:
7090 */
7091 switch (cmd) {
7092 case RAID_VERSION:
7093 err = get_version(argp);
7094 goto out;
7095
7096#ifndef MODULE
7097 case RAID_AUTORUN:
7098 err = 0;
7099 autostart_arrays(arg);
7100 goto out;
7101#endif
7102 default:;
7103 }
7104
7105 /*
7106 * Commands creating/starting a new array:
7107 */
7108
7109 mddev = bdev->bd_disk->private_data;
7110
7111 if (!mddev) {
7112 BUG();
7113 goto out;
7114 }
7115
7116 /* Some actions do not requires the mutex */
7117 switch (cmd) {
7118 case GET_ARRAY_INFO:
7119 if (!mddev->raid_disks && !mddev->external)
7120 err = -ENODEV;
7121 else
7122 err = get_array_info(mddev, argp);
7123 goto out;
7124
7125 case GET_DISK_INFO:
7126 if (!mddev->raid_disks && !mddev->external)
7127 err = -ENODEV;
7128 else
7129 err = get_disk_info(mddev, argp);
7130 goto out;
7131
7132 case SET_DISK_FAULTY:
7133 err = set_disk_faulty(mddev, new_decode_dev(arg));
7134 goto out;
7135
7136 case GET_BITMAP_FILE:
7137 err = get_bitmap_file(mddev, argp);
7138 goto out;
7139
7140 }
7141
7142 if (cmd == ADD_NEW_DISK)
7143 /* need to ensure md_delayed_delete() has completed */
7144 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
7145
7146 if (cmd == HOT_REMOVE_DISK)
7147 /* need to ensure recovery thread has run */
7148 wait_event_interruptible_timeout(mddev->sb_wait,
7149 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED,
7150 &mddev->recovery),
7151 msecs_to_jiffies(5000));
7152 if (cmd == STOP_ARRAY || cmd == STOP_ARRAY_RO) {
7153 /* Need to flush page cache, and ensure no-one else opens
7154 * and writes
7155 */
7156 mutex_lock(&mddev->open_mutex);
7157 if (mddev->pers && atomic_read(&mddev->openers) > 1) {
7158 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
7159 err = -EBUSY;
7160 goto out;
7161 }
7162 WARN_ON_ONCE(test_bit(MD_CLOSING, &mddev->flags));
7163 set_bit(MD_CLOSING, &mddev->flags);
7164 did_set_md_closing = true;
7165 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
7166 sync_blockdev(bdev);
7167 }
7168 err = mddev_lock(mddev);
7169 if (err) {
7170 pr_debug("md: ioctl lock interrupted, reason %d, cmd %d\n",
7171 err, cmd);
7172 goto out;
7173 }
7174
7175 if (cmd == SET_ARRAY_INFO) {
7176 mdu_array_info_t info;
7177 if (!arg)
7178 memset(&info, 0, sizeof(info));
7179 else if (copy_from_user(&info, argp, sizeof(info))) {
7180 err = -EFAULT;
7181 goto unlock;
7182 }
7183 if (mddev->pers) {
7184 err = update_array_info(mddev, &info);
7185 if (err) {
7186 pr_warn("md: couldn't update array info. %d\n", err);
7187 goto unlock;
7188 }
7189 goto unlock;
7190 }
7191 if (!list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
7192 pr_warn("md: array %s already has disks!\n", mdname(mddev));
7193 err = -EBUSY;
7194 goto unlock;
7195 }
7196 if (mddev->raid_disks) {
7197 pr_warn("md: array %s already initialised!\n", mdname(mddev));
7198 err = -EBUSY;
7199 goto unlock;
7200 }
7201 err = set_array_info(mddev, &info);
7202 if (err) {
7203 pr_warn("md: couldn't set array info. %d\n", err);
7204 goto unlock;
7205 }
7206 goto unlock;
7207 }
7208
7209 /*
7210 * Commands querying/configuring an existing array:
7211 */
7212 /* if we are not initialised yet, only ADD_NEW_DISK, STOP_ARRAY,
7213 * RUN_ARRAY, and GET_ and SET_BITMAP_FILE are allowed */
7214 if ((!mddev->raid_disks && !mddev->external)
7215 && cmd != ADD_NEW_DISK && cmd != STOP_ARRAY
7216 && cmd != RUN_ARRAY && cmd != SET_BITMAP_FILE
7217 && cmd != GET_BITMAP_FILE) {
7218 err = -ENODEV;
7219 goto unlock;
7220 }
7221
7222 /*
7223 * Commands even a read-only array can execute:
7224 */
7225 switch (cmd) {
7226 case RESTART_ARRAY_RW:
7227 err = restart_array(mddev);
7228 goto unlock;
7229
7230 case STOP_ARRAY:
7231 err = do_md_stop(mddev, 0, bdev);
7232 goto unlock;
7233
7234 case STOP_ARRAY_RO:
7235 err = md_set_readonly(mddev, bdev);
7236 goto unlock;
7237
7238 case HOT_REMOVE_DISK:
7239 err = hot_remove_disk(mddev, new_decode_dev(arg));
7240 goto unlock;
7241
7242 case ADD_NEW_DISK:
7243 /* We can support ADD_NEW_DISK on read-only arrays
7244 * only if we are re-adding a preexisting device.
7245 * So require mddev->pers and MD_DISK_SYNC.
7246 */
7247 if (mddev->pers) {
7248 mdu_disk_info_t info;
7249 if (copy_from_user(&info, argp, sizeof(info)))
7250 err = -EFAULT;
7251 else if (!(info.state & (1<<MD_DISK_SYNC)))
7252 /* Need to clear read-only for this */
7253 break;
7254 else
7255 err = add_new_disk(mddev, &info);
7256 goto unlock;
7257 }
7258 break;
7259
7260 case BLKROSET:
7261 if (get_user(ro, (int __user *)(arg))) {
7262 err = -EFAULT;
7263 goto unlock;
7264 }
7265 err = -EINVAL;
7266
7267 /* if the bdev is going readonly the value of mddev->ro
7268 * does not matter, no writes are coming
7269 */
7270 if (ro)
7271 goto unlock;
7272
7273 /* are we are already prepared for writes? */
7274 if (mddev->ro != 1)
7275 goto unlock;
7276
7277 /* transitioning to readauto need only happen for
7278 * arrays that call md_write_start
7279 */
7280 if (mddev->pers) {
7281 err = restart_array(mddev);
7282 if (err == 0) {
7283 mddev->ro = 2;
7284 set_disk_ro(mddev->gendisk, 0);
7285 }
7286 }
7287 goto unlock;
7288 }
7289
7290 /*
7291 * The remaining ioctls are changing the state of the
7292 * superblock, so we do not allow them on read-only arrays.
7293 */
7294 if (mddev->ro && mddev->pers) {
7295 if (mddev->ro == 2) {
7296 mddev->ro = 0;
7297 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
7298 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
7299 /* mddev_unlock will wake thread */
7300 /* If a device failed while we were read-only, we
7301 * need to make sure the metadata is updated now.
7302 */
7303 if (test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags)) {
7304 mddev_unlock(mddev);
7305 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
7306 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags) &&
7307 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags));
7308 mddev_lock_nointr(mddev);
7309 }
7310 } else {
7311 err = -EROFS;
7312 goto unlock;
7313 }
7314 }
7315
7316 switch (cmd) {
7317 case ADD_NEW_DISK:
7318 {
7319 mdu_disk_info_t info;
7320 if (copy_from_user(&info, argp, sizeof(info)))
7321 err = -EFAULT;
7322 else
7323 err = add_new_disk(mddev, &info);
7324 goto unlock;
7325 }
7326
7327 case CLUSTERED_DISK_NACK:
7328 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev))
7329 md_cluster_ops->new_disk_ack(mddev, false);
7330 else
7331 err = -EINVAL;
7332 goto unlock;
7333
7334 case HOT_ADD_DISK:
7335 err = hot_add_disk(mddev, new_decode_dev(arg));
7336 goto unlock;
7337
7338 case RUN_ARRAY:
7339 err = do_md_run(mddev);
7340 goto unlock;
7341
7342 case SET_BITMAP_FILE:
7343 err = set_bitmap_file(mddev, (int)arg);
7344 goto unlock;
7345
7346 default:
7347 err = -EINVAL;
7348 goto unlock;
7349 }
7350
7351unlock:
7352 if (mddev->hold_active == UNTIL_IOCTL &&
7353 err != -EINVAL)
7354 mddev->hold_active = 0;
7355 mddev_unlock(mddev);
7356out:
7357 if(did_set_md_closing)
7358 clear_bit(MD_CLOSING, &mddev->flags);
7359 return err;
7360}
7361#ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
7362static int md_compat_ioctl(struct block_device *bdev, fmode_t mode,
7363 unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
7364{
7365 switch (cmd) {
7366 case HOT_REMOVE_DISK:
7367 case HOT_ADD_DISK:
7368 case SET_DISK_FAULTY:
7369 case SET_BITMAP_FILE:
7370 /* These take in integer arg, do not convert */
7371 break;
7372 default:
7373 arg = (unsigned long)compat_ptr(arg);
7374 break;
7375 }
7376
7377 return md_ioctl(bdev, mode, cmd, arg);
7378}
7379#endif /* CONFIG_COMPAT */
7380
7381static int md_open(struct block_device *bdev, fmode_t mode)
7382{
7383 /*
7384 * Succeed if we can lock the mddev, which confirms that
7385 * it isn't being stopped right now.
7386 */
7387 struct mddev *mddev = mddev_find(bdev->bd_dev);
7388 int err;
7389
7390 if (!mddev)
7391 return -ENODEV;
7392
7393 if (mddev->gendisk != bdev->bd_disk) {
7394 /* we are racing with mddev_put which is discarding this
7395 * bd_disk.
7396 */
7397 mddev_put(mddev);
7398 /* Wait until bdev->bd_disk is definitely gone */
7399 flush_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
7400 /* Then retry the open from the top */
7401 return -ERESTARTSYS;
7402 }
7403 BUG_ON(mddev != bdev->bd_disk->private_data);
7404
7405 if ((err = mutex_lock_interruptible(&mddev->open_mutex)))
7406 goto out;
7407
7408 if (test_bit(MD_CLOSING, &mddev->flags)) {
7409 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
7410 err = -ENODEV;
7411 goto out;
7412 }
7413
7414 err = 0;
7415 atomic_inc(&mddev->openers);
7416 mutex_unlock(&mddev->open_mutex);
7417
7418 check_disk_change(bdev);
7419 out:
7420 if (err)
7421 mddev_put(mddev);
7422 return err;
7423}
7424
7425static void md_release(struct gendisk *disk, fmode_t mode)
7426{
7427 struct mddev *mddev = disk->private_data;
7428
7429 BUG_ON(!mddev);
7430 atomic_dec(&mddev->openers);
7431 mddev_put(mddev);
7432}
7433
7434static int md_media_changed(struct gendisk *disk)
7435{
7436 struct mddev *mddev = disk->private_data;
7437
7438 return mddev->changed;
7439}
7440
7441static int md_revalidate(struct gendisk *disk)
7442{
7443 struct mddev *mddev = disk->private_data;
7444
7445 mddev->changed = 0;
7446 return 0;
7447}
7448static const struct block_device_operations md_fops =
7449{
7450 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
7451 .open = md_open,
7452 .release = md_release,
7453 .ioctl = md_ioctl,
7454#ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
7455 .compat_ioctl = md_compat_ioctl,
7456#endif
7457 .getgeo = md_getgeo,
7458 .media_changed = md_media_changed,
7459 .revalidate_disk= md_revalidate,
7460};
7461
7462static int md_thread(void *arg)
7463{
7464 struct md_thread *thread = arg;
7465
7466 /*
7467 * md_thread is a 'system-thread', it's priority should be very
7468 * high. We avoid resource deadlocks individually in each
7469 * raid personality. (RAID5 does preallocation) We also use RR and
7470 * the very same RT priority as kswapd, thus we will never get
7471 * into a priority inversion deadlock.
7472 *
7473 * we definitely have to have equal or higher priority than
7474 * bdflush, otherwise bdflush will deadlock if there are too
7475 * many dirty RAID5 blocks.
7476 */
7477
7478 allow_signal(SIGKILL);
7479 while (!kthread_should_stop()) {
7480
7481 /* We need to wait INTERRUPTIBLE so that
7482 * we don't add to the load-average.
7483 * That means we need to be sure no signals are
7484 * pending
7485 */
7486 if (signal_pending(current))
7487 flush_signals(current);
7488
7489 wait_event_interruptible_timeout
7490 (thread->wqueue,
7491 test_bit(THREAD_WAKEUP, &thread->flags)
7492 || kthread_should_stop() || kthread_should_park(),
7493 thread->timeout);
7494
7495 clear_bit(THREAD_WAKEUP, &thread->flags);
7496 if (kthread_should_park())
7497 kthread_parkme();
7498 if (!kthread_should_stop())
7499 thread->run(thread);
7500 }
7501
7502 return 0;
7503}
7504
7505void md_wakeup_thread(struct md_thread *thread)
7506{
7507 if (thread) {
7508 pr_debug("md: waking up MD thread %s.\n", thread->tsk->comm);
7509 set_bit(THREAD_WAKEUP, &thread->flags);
7510 wake_up(&thread->wqueue);
7511 }
7512}
7513EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_wakeup_thread);
7514
7515struct md_thread *md_register_thread(void (*run) (struct md_thread *),
7516 struct mddev *mddev, const char *name)
7517{
7518 struct md_thread *thread;
7519
7520 thread = kzalloc(sizeof(struct md_thread), GFP_KERNEL);
7521 if (!thread)
7522 return NULL;
7523
7524 init_waitqueue_head(&thread->wqueue);
7525
7526 thread->run = run;
7527 thread->mddev = mddev;
7528 thread->timeout = MAX_SCHEDULE_TIMEOUT;
7529 thread->tsk = kthread_run(md_thread, thread,
7530 "%s_%s",
7531 mdname(thread->mddev),
7532 name);
7533 if (IS_ERR(thread->tsk)) {
7534 kfree(thread);
7535 return NULL;
7536 }
7537 return thread;
7538}
7539EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_register_thread);
7540
7541void md_unregister_thread(struct md_thread **threadp)
7542{
7543 struct md_thread *thread = *threadp;
7544 if (!thread)
7545 return;
7546 pr_debug("interrupting MD-thread pid %d\n", task_pid_nr(thread->tsk));
7547 /* Locking ensures that mddev_unlock does not wake_up a
7548 * non-existent thread
7549 */
7550 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7551 *threadp = NULL;
7552 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7553
7554 kthread_stop(thread->tsk);
7555 kfree(thread);
7556}
7557EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_unregister_thread);
7558
7559void md_error(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
7560{
7561 if (!rdev || test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
7562 return;
7563
7564 if (!mddev->pers || !mddev->pers->error_handler)
7565 return;
7566 mddev->pers->error_handler(mddev,rdev);
7567 if (mddev->degraded)
7568 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
7569 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
7570 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
7571 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
7572 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
7573 if (mddev->event_work.func)
7574 queue_work(md_misc_wq, &mddev->event_work);
7575 md_new_event(mddev);
7576}
7577EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_error);
7578
7579/* seq_file implementation /proc/mdstat */
7580
7581static void status_unused(struct seq_file *seq)
7582{
7583 int i = 0;
7584 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7585
7586 seq_printf(seq, "unused devices: ");
7587
7588 list_for_each_entry(rdev, &pending_raid_disks, same_set) {
7589 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
7590 i++;
7591 seq_printf(seq, "%s ",
7592 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b));
7593 }
7594 if (!i)
7595 seq_printf(seq, "<none>");
7596
7597 seq_printf(seq, "\n");
7598}
7599
7600static int status_resync(struct seq_file *seq, struct mddev *mddev)
7601{
7602 sector_t max_sectors, resync, res;
7603 unsigned long dt, db;
7604 sector_t rt;
7605 int scale;
7606 unsigned int per_milli;
7607
7608 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery) ||
7609 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
7610 max_sectors = mddev->resync_max_sectors;
7611 else
7612 max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
7613
7614 resync = mddev->curr_resync;
7615 if (resync <= 3) {
7616 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery))
7617 /* Still cleaning up */
7618 resync = max_sectors;
7619 } else
7620 resync -= atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active);
7621
7622 if (resync == 0) {
7623 if (mddev->recovery_cp < MaxSector) {
7624 seq_printf(seq, "\tresync=PENDING");
7625 return 1;
7626 }
7627 return 0;
7628 }
7629 if (resync < 3) {
7630 seq_printf(seq, "\tresync=DELAYED");
7631 return 1;
7632 }
7633
7634 WARN_ON(max_sectors == 0);
7635 /* Pick 'scale' such that (resync>>scale)*1000 will fit
7636 * in a sector_t, and (max_sectors>>scale) will fit in a
7637 * u32, as those are the requirements for sector_div.
7638 * Thus 'scale' must be at least 10
7639 */
7640 scale = 10;
7641 if (sizeof(sector_t) > sizeof(unsigned long)) {
7642 while ( max_sectors/2 > (1ULL<<(scale+32)))
7643 scale++;
7644 }
7645 res = (resync>>scale)*1000;
7646 sector_div(res, (u32)((max_sectors>>scale)+1));
7647
7648 per_milli = res;
7649 {
7650 int i, x = per_milli/50, y = 20-x;
7651 seq_printf(seq, "[");
7652 for (i = 0; i < x; i++)
7653 seq_printf(seq, "=");
7654 seq_printf(seq, ">");
7655 for (i = 0; i < y; i++)
7656 seq_printf(seq, ".");
7657 seq_printf(seq, "] ");
7658 }
7659 seq_printf(seq, " %s =%3u.%u%% (%llu/%llu)",
7660 (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery)?
7661 "reshape" :
7662 (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery)?
7663 "check" :
7664 (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery) ?
7665 "resync" : "recovery"))),
7666 per_milli/10, per_milli % 10,
7667 (unsigned long long) resync/2,
7668 (unsigned long long) max_sectors/2);
7669
7670 /*
7671 * dt: time from mark until now
7672 * db: blocks written from mark until now
7673 * rt: remaining time
7674 *
7675 * rt is a sector_t, so could be 32bit or 64bit.
7676 * So we divide before multiply in case it is 32bit and close
7677 * to the limit.
7678 * We scale the divisor (db) by 32 to avoid losing precision
7679 * near the end of resync when the number of remaining sectors
7680 * is close to 'db'.
7681 * We then divide rt by 32 after multiplying by db to compensate.
7682 * The '+1' avoids division by zero if db is very small.
7683 */
7684 dt = ((jiffies - mddev->resync_mark) / HZ);
7685 if (!dt) dt++;
7686 db = (mddev->curr_mark_cnt - atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active))
7687 - mddev->resync_mark_cnt;
7688
7689 rt = max_sectors - resync; /* number of remaining sectors */
7690 sector_div(rt, db/32+1);
7691 rt *= dt;
7692 rt >>= 5;
7693
7694 seq_printf(seq, " finish=%lu.%lumin", (unsigned long)rt / 60,
7695 ((unsigned long)rt % 60)/6);
7696
7697 seq_printf(seq, " speed=%ldK/sec", db/2/dt);
7698 return 1;
7699}
7700
7701static void *md_seq_start(struct seq_file *seq, loff_t *pos)
7702{
7703 struct list_head *tmp;
7704 loff_t l = *pos;
7705 struct mddev *mddev;
7706
7707 if (l >= 0x10000)
7708 return NULL;
7709 if (!l--)
7710 /* header */
7711 return (void*)1;
7712
7713 spin_lock(&all_mddevs_lock);
7714 list_for_each(tmp,&all_mddevs)
7715 if (!l--) {
7716 mddev = list_entry(tmp, struct mddev, all_mddevs);
7717 mddev_get(mddev);
7718 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
7719 return mddev;
7720 }
7721 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
7722 if (!l--)
7723 return (void*)2;/* tail */
7724 return NULL;
7725}
7726
7727static void *md_seq_next(struct seq_file *seq, void *v, loff_t *pos)
7728{
7729 struct list_head *tmp;
7730 struct mddev *next_mddev, *mddev = v;
7731
7732 ++*pos;
7733 if (v == (void*)2)
7734 return NULL;
7735
7736 spin_lock(&all_mddevs_lock);
7737 if (v == (void*)1)
7738 tmp = all_mddevs.next;
7739 else
7740 tmp = mddev->all_mddevs.next;
7741 if (tmp != &all_mddevs)
7742 next_mddev = mddev_get(list_entry(tmp,struct mddev,all_mddevs));
7743 else {
7744 next_mddev = (void*)2;
7745 *pos = 0x10000;
7746 }
7747 spin_unlock(&all_mddevs_lock);
7748
7749 if (v != (void*)1)
7750 mddev_put(mddev);
7751 return next_mddev;
7752
7753}
7754
7755static void md_seq_stop(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
7756{
7757 struct mddev *mddev = v;
7758
7759 if (mddev && v != (void*)1 && v != (void*)2)
7760 mddev_put(mddev);
7761}
7762
7763static int md_seq_show(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
7764{
7765 struct mddev *mddev = v;
7766 sector_t sectors;
7767 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7768
7769 if (v == (void*)1) {
7770 struct md_personality *pers;
7771 seq_printf(seq, "Personalities : ");
7772 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7773 list_for_each_entry(pers, &pers_list, list)
7774 seq_printf(seq, "[%s] ", pers->name);
7775
7776 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7777 seq_printf(seq, "\n");
7778 seq->poll_event = atomic_read(&md_event_count);
7779 return 0;
7780 }
7781 if (v == (void*)2) {
7782 status_unused(seq);
7783 return 0;
7784 }
7785
7786 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
7787 if (mddev->pers || mddev->raid_disks || !list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
7788 seq_printf(seq, "%s : %sactive", mdname(mddev),
7789 mddev->pers ? "" : "in");
7790 if (mddev->pers) {
7791 if (mddev->ro==1)
7792 seq_printf(seq, " (read-only)");
7793 if (mddev->ro==2)
7794 seq_printf(seq, " (auto-read-only)");
7795 seq_printf(seq, " %s", mddev->pers->name);
7796 }
7797
7798 sectors = 0;
7799 rcu_read_lock();
7800 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev) {
7801 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
7802 seq_printf(seq, " %s[%d]",
7803 bdevname(rdev->bdev,b), rdev->desc_nr);
7804 if (test_bit(WriteMostly, &rdev->flags))
7805 seq_printf(seq, "(W)");
7806 if (test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
7807 seq_printf(seq, "(J)");
7808 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
7809 seq_printf(seq, "(F)");
7810 continue;
7811 }
7812 if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
7813 seq_printf(seq, "(S)"); /* spare */
7814 if (test_bit(Replacement, &rdev->flags))
7815 seq_printf(seq, "(R)");
7816 sectors += rdev->sectors;
7817 }
7818 rcu_read_unlock();
7819
7820 if (!list_empty(&mddev->disks)) {
7821 if (mddev->pers)
7822 seq_printf(seq, "\n %llu blocks",
7823 (unsigned long long)
7824 mddev->array_sectors / 2);
7825 else
7826 seq_printf(seq, "\n %llu blocks",
7827 (unsigned long long)sectors / 2);
7828 }
7829 if (mddev->persistent) {
7830 if (mddev->major_version != 0 ||
7831 mddev->minor_version != 90) {
7832 seq_printf(seq," super %d.%d",
7833 mddev->major_version,
7834 mddev->minor_version);
7835 }
7836 } else if (mddev->external)
7837 seq_printf(seq, " super external:%s",
7838 mddev->metadata_type);
7839 else
7840 seq_printf(seq, " super non-persistent");
7841
7842 if (mddev->pers) {
7843 mddev->pers->status(seq, mddev);
7844 seq_printf(seq, "\n ");
7845 if (mddev->pers->sync_request) {
7846 if (status_resync(seq, mddev))
7847 seq_printf(seq, "\n ");
7848 }
7849 } else
7850 seq_printf(seq, "\n ");
7851
7852 bitmap_status(seq, mddev->bitmap);
7853
7854 seq_printf(seq, "\n");
7855 }
7856 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
7857
7858 return 0;
7859}
7860
7861static const struct seq_operations md_seq_ops = {
7862 .start = md_seq_start,
7863 .next = md_seq_next,
7864 .stop = md_seq_stop,
7865 .show = md_seq_show,
7866};
7867
7868static int md_seq_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
7869{
7870 struct seq_file *seq;
7871 int error;
7872
7873 error = seq_open(file, &md_seq_ops);
7874 if (error)
7875 return error;
7876
7877 seq = file->private_data;
7878 seq->poll_event = atomic_read(&md_event_count);
7879 return error;
7880}
7881
7882static int md_unloading;
7883static unsigned int mdstat_poll(struct file *filp, poll_table *wait)
7884{
7885 struct seq_file *seq = filp->private_data;
7886 int mask;
7887
7888 if (md_unloading)
7889 return POLLIN|POLLRDNORM|POLLERR|POLLPRI;
7890 poll_wait(filp, &md_event_waiters, wait);
7891
7892 /* always allow read */
7893 mask = POLLIN | POLLRDNORM;
7894
7895 if (seq->poll_event != atomic_read(&md_event_count))
7896 mask |= POLLERR | POLLPRI;
7897 return mask;
7898}
7899
7900static const struct file_operations md_seq_fops = {
7901 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
7902 .open = md_seq_open,
7903 .read = seq_read,
7904 .llseek = seq_lseek,
7905 .release = seq_release,
7906 .poll = mdstat_poll,
7907};
7908
7909int register_md_personality(struct md_personality *p)
7910{
7911 pr_debug("md: %s personality registered for level %d\n",
7912 p->name, p->level);
7913 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7914 list_add_tail(&p->list, &pers_list);
7915 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7916 return 0;
7917}
7918EXPORT_SYMBOL(register_md_personality);
7919
7920int unregister_md_personality(struct md_personality *p)
7921{
7922 pr_debug("md: %s personality unregistered\n", p->name);
7923 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7924 list_del_init(&p->list);
7925 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7926 return 0;
7927}
7928EXPORT_SYMBOL(unregister_md_personality);
7929
7930int register_md_cluster_operations(struct md_cluster_operations *ops,
7931 struct module *module)
7932{
7933 int ret = 0;
7934 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7935 if (md_cluster_ops != NULL)
7936 ret = -EALREADY;
7937 else {
7938 md_cluster_ops = ops;
7939 md_cluster_mod = module;
7940 }
7941 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7942 return ret;
7943}
7944EXPORT_SYMBOL(register_md_cluster_operations);
7945
7946int unregister_md_cluster_operations(void)
7947{
7948 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7949 md_cluster_ops = NULL;
7950 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7951 return 0;
7952}
7953EXPORT_SYMBOL(unregister_md_cluster_operations);
7954
7955int md_setup_cluster(struct mddev *mddev, int nodes)
7956{
7957 if (!md_cluster_ops)
7958 request_module("md-cluster");
7959 spin_lock(&pers_lock);
7960 /* ensure module won't be unloaded */
7961 if (!md_cluster_ops || !try_module_get(md_cluster_mod)) {
7962 pr_warn("can't find md-cluster module or get it's reference.\n");
7963 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7964 return -ENOENT;
7965 }
7966 spin_unlock(&pers_lock);
7967
7968 return md_cluster_ops->join(mddev, nodes);
7969}
7970
7971void md_cluster_stop(struct mddev *mddev)
7972{
7973 if (!md_cluster_ops)
7974 return;
7975 md_cluster_ops->leave(mddev);
7976 module_put(md_cluster_mod);
7977}
7978
7979static int is_mddev_idle(struct mddev *mddev, int init)
7980{
7981 struct md_rdev *rdev;
7982 int idle;
7983 int curr_events;
7984
7985 idle = 1;
7986 rcu_read_lock();
7987 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev) {
7988 struct gendisk *disk = rdev->bdev->bd_contains->bd_disk;
7989 curr_events = (int)part_stat_read(&disk->part0, sectors[0]) +
7990 (int)part_stat_read(&disk->part0, sectors[1]) -
7991 atomic_read(&disk->sync_io);
7992 /* sync IO will cause sync_io to increase before the disk_stats
7993 * as sync_io is counted when a request starts, and
7994 * disk_stats is counted when it completes.
7995 * So resync activity will cause curr_events to be smaller than
7996 * when there was no such activity.
7997 * non-sync IO will cause disk_stat to increase without
7998 * increasing sync_io so curr_events will (eventually)
7999 * be larger than it was before. Once it becomes
8000 * substantially larger, the test below will cause
8001 * the array to appear non-idle, and resync will slow
8002 * down.
8003 * If there is a lot of outstanding resync activity when
8004 * we set last_event to curr_events, then all that activity
8005 * completing might cause the array to appear non-idle
8006 * and resync will be slowed down even though there might
8007 * not have been non-resync activity. This will only
8008 * happen once though. 'last_events' will soon reflect
8009 * the state where there is little or no outstanding
8010 * resync requests, and further resync activity will
8011 * always make curr_events less than last_events.
8012 *
8013 */
8014 if (init || curr_events - rdev->last_events > 64) {
8015 rdev->last_events = curr_events;
8016 idle = 0;
8017 }
8018 }
8019 rcu_read_unlock();
8020 return idle;
8021}
8022
8023void md_done_sync(struct mddev *mddev, int blocks, int ok)
8024{
8025 /* another "blocks" (512byte) blocks have been synced */
8026 atomic_sub(blocks, &mddev->recovery_active);
8027 wake_up(&mddev->recovery_wait);
8028 if (!ok) {
8029 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
8030 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_ERROR, &mddev->recovery);
8031 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8032 // stop recovery, signal do_sync ....
8033 }
8034}
8035EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_done_sync);
8036
8037/* md_write_start(mddev, bi)
8038 * If we need to update some array metadata (e.g. 'active' flag
8039 * in superblock) before writing, schedule a superblock update
8040 * and wait for it to complete.
8041 * A return value of 'false' means that the write wasn't recorded
8042 * and cannot proceed as the array is being suspend.
8043 */
8044bool md_write_start(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *bi)
8045{
8046 int did_change = 0;
8047
8048 if (bio_data_dir(bi) != WRITE)
8049 return true;
8050
8051 BUG_ON(mddev->ro == 1);
8052 if (mddev->ro == 2) {
8053 /* need to switch to read/write */
8054 mddev->ro = 0;
8055 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
8056 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8057 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
8058 did_change = 1;
8059 }
8060 rcu_read_lock();
8061 percpu_ref_get(&mddev->writes_pending);
8062 smp_mb(); /* Match smp_mb in set_in_sync() */
8063 if (mddev->safemode == 1)
8064 mddev->safemode = 0;
8065 /* sync_checkers is always 0 when writes_pending is in per-cpu mode */
8066 if (mddev->in_sync || mddev->sync_checkers) {
8067 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
8068 if (mddev->in_sync) {
8069 mddev->in_sync = 0;
8070 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_CLEAN, &mddev->sb_flags);
8071 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags);
8072 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8073 did_change = 1;
8074 }
8075 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8076 }
8077 rcu_read_unlock();
8078 if (did_change)
8079 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
8080 if (!mddev->has_superblocks)
8081 return true;
8082 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
8083 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags) ||
8084 mddev->suspended);
8085 if (test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags)) {
8086 percpu_ref_put(&mddev->writes_pending);
8087 return false;
8088 }
8089 return true;
8090}
8091EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_write_start);
8092
8093/* md_write_inc can only be called when md_write_start() has
8094 * already been called at least once of the current request.
8095 * It increments the counter and is useful when a single request
8096 * is split into several parts. Each part causes an increment and
8097 * so needs a matching md_write_end().
8098 * Unlike md_write_start(), it is safe to call md_write_inc() inside
8099 * a spinlocked region.
8100 */
8101void md_write_inc(struct mddev *mddev, struct bio *bi)
8102{
8103 if (bio_data_dir(bi) != WRITE)
8104 return;
8105 WARN_ON_ONCE(mddev->in_sync || mddev->ro);
8106 percpu_ref_get(&mddev->writes_pending);
8107}
8108EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_write_inc);
8109
8110void md_write_end(struct mddev *mddev)
8111{
8112 percpu_ref_put(&mddev->writes_pending);
8113
8114 if (mddev->safemode == 2)
8115 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8116 else if (mddev->safemode_delay)
8117 /* The roundup() ensures this only performs locking once
8118 * every ->safemode_delay jiffies
8119 */
8120 mod_timer(&mddev->safemode_timer,
8121 roundup(jiffies, mddev->safemode_delay) +
8122 mddev->safemode_delay);
8123}
8124
8125EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_write_end);
8126
8127/* md_allow_write(mddev)
8128 * Calling this ensures that the array is marked 'active' so that writes
8129 * may proceed without blocking. It is important to call this before
8130 * attempting a GFP_KERNEL allocation while holding the mddev lock.
8131 * Must be called with mddev_lock held.
8132 */
8133void md_allow_write(struct mddev *mddev)
8134{
8135 if (!mddev->pers)
8136 return;
8137 if (mddev->ro)
8138 return;
8139 if (!mddev->pers->sync_request)
8140 return;
8141
8142 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
8143 if (mddev->in_sync) {
8144 mddev->in_sync = 0;
8145 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_CLEAN, &mddev->sb_flags);
8146 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags);
8147 if (mddev->safemode_delay &&
8148 mddev->safemode == 0)
8149 mddev->safemode = 1;
8150 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8151 md_update_sb(mddev, 0);
8152 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_state);
8153 /* wait for the dirty state to be recorded in the metadata */
8154 wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
8155 !test_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags));
8156 } else
8157 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8158}
8159EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_allow_write);
8160
8161#define SYNC_MARKS 10
8162#define SYNC_MARK_STEP (3*HZ)
8163#define UPDATE_FREQUENCY (5*60*HZ)
8164void md_do_sync(struct md_thread *thread)
8165{
8166 struct mddev *mddev = thread->mddev;
8167 struct mddev *mddev2;
8168 unsigned int currspeed = 0,
8169 window;
8170 sector_t max_sectors,j, io_sectors, recovery_done;
8171 unsigned long mark[SYNC_MARKS];
8172 unsigned long update_time;
8173 sector_t mark_cnt[SYNC_MARKS];
8174 int last_mark,m;
8175 struct list_head *tmp;
8176 sector_t last_check;
8177 int skipped = 0;
8178 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8179 char *desc, *action = NULL;
8180 struct blk_plug plug;
8181 int ret;
8182
8183 /* just incase thread restarts... */
8184 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery))
8185 return;
8186 if (mddev->ro) {/* never try to sync a read-only array */
8187 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
8188 return;
8189 }
8190
8191 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
8192 ret = md_cluster_ops->resync_start(mddev);
8193 if (ret)
8194 goto skip;
8195
8196 set_bit(MD_CLUSTER_RESYNC_LOCKED, &mddev->flags);
8197 if (!(test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery) ||
8198 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery) ||
8199 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery))
8200 && ((unsigned long long)mddev->curr_resync_completed
8201 < (unsigned long long)mddev->resync_max_sectors))
8202 goto skip;
8203 }
8204
8205 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery)) {
8206 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery)) {
8207 desc = "data-check";
8208 action = "check";
8209 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery)) {
8210 desc = "requested-resync";
8211 action = "repair";
8212 } else
8213 desc = "resync";
8214 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
8215 desc = "reshape";
8216 else
8217 desc = "recovery";
8218
8219 mddev->last_sync_action = action ?: desc;
8220
8221 /* we overload curr_resync somewhat here.
8222 * 0 == not engaged in resync at all
8223 * 2 == checking that there is no conflict with another sync
8224 * 1 == like 2, but have yielded to allow conflicting resync to
8225 * commense
