8226 * other == active in resync - this many blocks
8227 *
8228 * Before starting a resync we must have set curr_resync to
8229 * 2, and then checked that every "conflicting" array has curr_resync
8230 * less than ours. When we find one that is the same or higher
8231 * we wait on resync_wait. To avoid deadlock, we reduce curr_resync
8232 * to 1 if we choose to yield (based arbitrarily on address of mddev structure).
8233 * This will mean we have to start checking from the beginning again.
8234 *
8235 */
8236
8237 do {
8238 int mddev2_minor = -1;
8239 mddev->curr_resync = 2;
8240
8241 try_again:
8242 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
8243 goto skip;
8244 for_each_mddev(mddev2, tmp) {
8245 if (mddev2 == mddev)
8246 continue;
8247 if (!mddev->parallel_resync
8248 && mddev2->curr_resync
8249 && match_mddev_units(mddev, mddev2)) {
8250 DEFINE_WAIT(wq);
8251 if (mddev < mddev2 && mddev->curr_resync == 2) {
8252 /* arbitrarily yield */
8253 mddev->curr_resync = 1;
8254 wake_up(&resync_wait);
8255 }
8256 if (mddev > mddev2 && mddev->curr_resync == 1)
8257 /* no need to wait here, we can wait the next
8258 * time 'round when curr_resync == 2
8259 */
8260 continue;
8261 /* We need to wait 'interruptible' so as not to
8262 * contribute to the load average, and not to
8263 * be caught by 'softlockup'
8264 */
8265 prepare_to_wait(&resync_wait, &wq, TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
8266 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery) &&
8267 mddev2->curr_resync >= mddev->curr_resync) {
8268 if (mddev2_minor != mddev2->md_minor) {
8269 mddev2_minor = mddev2->md_minor;
8270 pr_info("md: delaying %s of %s until %s has finished (they share one or more physical units)\n",
8271 desc, mdname(mddev),
8272 mdname(mddev2));
8273 }
8274 mddev_put(mddev2);
8275 if (signal_pending(current))
8276 flush_signals(current);
8277 schedule();
8278 finish_wait(&resync_wait, &wq);
8279 goto try_again;
8280 }
8281 finish_wait(&resync_wait, &wq);
8282 }
8283 }
8284 } while (mddev->curr_resync < 2);
8285
8286 j = 0;
8287 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery)) {
8288 /* resync follows the size requested by the personality,
8289 * which defaults to physical size, but can be virtual size
8290 */
8291 max_sectors = mddev->resync_max_sectors;
8292 atomic64_set(&mddev->resync_mismatches, 0);
8293 /* we don't use the checkpoint if there's a bitmap */
8294 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery))
8295 j = mddev->resync_min;
8296 else if (!mddev->bitmap)
8297 j = mddev->recovery_cp;
8298
8299 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
8300 max_sectors = mddev->resync_max_sectors;
8301 else {
8302 /* recovery follows the physical size of devices */
8303 max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
8304 j = MaxSector;
8305 rcu_read_lock();
8306 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev)
8307 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
8308 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) &&
8309 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
8310 !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
8311 rdev->recovery_offset < j)
8312 j = rdev->recovery_offset;
8313 rcu_read_unlock();
8314
8315 /* If there is a bitmap, we need to make sure all
8316 * writes that started before we added a spare
8317 * complete before we start doing a recovery.
8318 * Otherwise the write might complete and (via
8319 * bitmap_endwrite) set a bit in the bitmap after the
8320 * recovery has checked that bit and skipped that
8321 * region.
8322 */
8323 if (mddev->bitmap) {
8324 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 1);
8325 mddev->pers->quiesce(mddev, 0);
8326 }
8327 }
8328
8329 pr_info("md: %s of RAID array %s\n", desc, mdname(mddev));
8330 pr_debug("md: minimum _guaranteed_ speed: %d KB/sec/disk.\n", speed_min(mddev));
8331 pr_debug("md: using maximum available idle IO bandwidth (but not more than %d KB/sec) for %s.\n",
8332 speed_max(mddev), desc);
8333
8334 is_mddev_idle(mddev, 1); /* this initializes IO event counters */
8335
8336 io_sectors = 0;
8337 for (m = 0; m < SYNC_MARKS; m++) {
8338 mark[m] = jiffies;
8339 mark_cnt[m] = io_sectors;
8340 }
8341 last_mark = 0;
8342 mddev->resync_mark = mark[last_mark];
8343 mddev->resync_mark_cnt = mark_cnt[last_mark];
8344
8345 /*
8346 * Tune reconstruction:
8347 */
8348 window = 32*(PAGE_SIZE/512);
8349 pr_debug("md: using %dk window, over a total of %lluk.\n",
8350 window/2, (unsigned long long)max_sectors/2);
8351
8352 atomic_set(&mddev->recovery_active, 0);
8353 last_check = 0;
8354
8355 if (j>2) {
8356 pr_debug("md: resuming %s of %s from checkpoint.\n",
8357 desc, mdname(mddev));
8358 mddev->curr_resync = j;
8359 } else
8360 mddev->curr_resync = 3; /* no longer delayed */
8361 mddev->curr_resync_completed = j;
8362 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
8363 md_new_event(mddev);
8364 update_time = jiffies;
8365
8366 blk_start_plug(&plug);
8367 while (j < max_sectors) {
8368 sector_t sectors;
8369
8370 skipped = 0;
8371
8372 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery) &&
8373 ((mddev->curr_resync > mddev->curr_resync_completed &&
8374 (mddev->curr_resync - mddev->curr_resync_completed)
8375 > (max_sectors >> 4)) ||
8376 time_after_eq(jiffies, update_time + UPDATE_FREQUENCY) ||
8377 (j - mddev->curr_resync_completed)*2
8378 >= mddev->resync_max - mddev->curr_resync_completed ||
8379 mddev->curr_resync_completed > mddev->resync_max
8380 )) {
8381 /* time to update curr_resync_completed */
8382 wait_event(mddev->recovery_wait,
8383 atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active) == 0);
8384 mddev->curr_resync_completed = j;
8385 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery) &&
8386 j > mddev->recovery_cp)
8387 mddev->recovery_cp = j;
8388 update_time = jiffies;
8389 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_CLEAN, &mddev->sb_flags);
8390 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
8391 }
8392
8393 while (j >= mddev->resync_max &&
8394 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)) {
8395 /* As this condition is controlled by user-space,
8396 * we can block indefinitely, so use '_interruptible'
8397 * to avoid triggering warnings.
8398 */
8399 flush_signals(current); /* just in case */
8400 wait_event_interruptible(mddev->recovery_wait,
8401 mddev->resync_max > j
8402 || test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR,
8403 &mddev->recovery));
8404 }
8405
8406 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
8407 break;
8408
8409 sectors = mddev->pers->sync_request(mddev, j, &skipped);
8410 if (sectors == 0) {
8411 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
8412 break;
8413 }
8414
8415 if (!skipped) { /* actual IO requested */
8416 io_sectors += sectors;
8417 atomic_add(sectors, &mddev->recovery_active);
8418 }
8419
8420 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
8421 break;
8422
8423 j += sectors;
8424 if (j > max_sectors)
8425 /* when skipping, extra large numbers can be returned. */
8426 j = max_sectors;
8427 if (j > 2)
8428 mddev->curr_resync = j;
8429 mddev->curr_mark_cnt = io_sectors;
8430 if (last_check == 0)
8431 /* this is the earliest that rebuild will be
8432 * visible in /proc/mdstat
8433 */
8434 md_new_event(mddev);
8435
8436 if (last_check + window > io_sectors || j == max_sectors)
8437 continue;
8438
8439 last_check = io_sectors;
8440 repeat:
8441 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, mark[last_mark] + SYNC_MARK_STEP )) {
8442 /* step marks */
8443 int next = (last_mark+1) % SYNC_MARKS;
8444
8445 mddev->resync_mark = mark[next];
8446 mddev->resync_mark_cnt = mark_cnt[next];
8447 mark[next] = jiffies;
8448 mark_cnt[next] = io_sectors - atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active);
8449 last_mark = next;
8450 }
8451
8452 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
8453 break;
8454
8455 /*
8456 * this loop exits only if either when we are slower than
8457 * the 'hard' speed limit, or the system was IO-idle for
8458 * a jiffy.
8459 * the system might be non-idle CPU-wise, but we only care
8460 * about not overloading the IO subsystem. (things like an
8461 * e2fsck being done on the RAID array should execute fast)
8462 */
8463 cond_resched();
8464
8465 recovery_done = io_sectors - atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active);
8466 currspeed = ((unsigned long)(recovery_done - mddev->resync_mark_cnt))/2
8467 /((jiffies-mddev->resync_mark)/HZ +1) +1;
8468
8469 if (currspeed > speed_min(mddev)) {
8470 if (currspeed > speed_max(mddev)) {
8471 msleep(500);
8472 goto repeat;
8473 }
8474 if (!is_mddev_idle(mddev, 0)) {
8475 /*
8476 * Give other IO more of a chance.
8477 * The faster the devices, the less we wait.
8478 */
8479 wait_event(mddev->recovery_wait,
8480 !atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active));
8481 }
8482 }
8483 }
8484 pr_info("md: %s: %s %s.\n",mdname(mddev), desc,
8485 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)
8486 ? "interrupted" : "done");
8487 /*
8488 * this also signals 'finished resyncing' to md_stop
8489 */
8490 blk_finish_plug(&plug);
8491 wait_event(mddev->recovery_wait, !atomic_read(&mddev->recovery_active));
8492
8493 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery) &&
8494 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery) &&
8495 mddev->curr_resync > 3) {
8496 mddev->curr_resync_completed = mddev->curr_resync;
8497 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
8498 }
8499 mddev->pers->sync_request(mddev, max_sectors, &skipped);
8500
8501 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery) &&
8502 mddev->curr_resync > 3) {
8503 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery)) {
8504 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)) {
8505 if (mddev->curr_resync >= mddev->recovery_cp) {
8506 pr_debug("md: checkpointing %s of %s.\n",
8507 desc, mdname(mddev));
8508 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_ERROR,
8509 &mddev->recovery))
8510 mddev->recovery_cp =
8511 mddev->curr_resync_completed;
8512 else
8513 mddev->recovery_cp =
8514 mddev->curr_resync;
8515 }
8516 } else
8517 mddev->recovery_cp = MaxSector;
8518 } else {
8519 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery))
8520 mddev->curr_resync = MaxSector;
8521 rcu_read_lock();
8522 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev)
8523 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
8524 mddev->delta_disks >= 0 &&
8525 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) &&
8526 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
8527 !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
8528 rdev->recovery_offset < mddev->curr_resync)
8529 rdev->recovery_offset = mddev->curr_resync;
8530 rcu_read_unlock();
8531 }
8532 }
8533 skip:
8534 /* set CHANGE_PENDING here since maybe another update is needed,
8535 * so other nodes are informed. It should be harmless for normal
8536 * raid */
8537 set_mask_bits(&mddev->sb_flags, 0,
8538 BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING) | BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS));
8539
8540 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery) &&
8541 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery) &&
8542 mddev->delta_disks > 0 &&
8543 mddev->pers->finish_reshape &&
8544 mddev->pers->size &&
8545 mddev->queue) {
8546 mddev_lock_nointr(mddev);
8547 md_set_array_sectors(mddev, mddev->pers->size(mddev, 0, 0));
8548 mddev_unlock(mddev);
8549 set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
8550 revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
8551 }
8552
8553 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
8554 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)) {
8555 /* We completed so min/max setting can be forgotten if used. */
8556 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery))
8557 mddev->resync_min = 0;
8558 mddev->resync_max = MaxSector;
8559 } else if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery))
8560 mddev->resync_min = mddev->curr_resync_completed;
8561 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery);
8562 mddev->curr_resync = 0;
8563 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8564
8565 wake_up(&resync_wait);
8566 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
8567 return;
8568}
8569EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_do_sync);
8570
8571static int remove_and_add_spares(struct mddev *mddev,
8572 struct md_rdev *this)
8573{
8574 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8575 int spares = 0;
8576 int removed = 0;
8577 bool remove_some = false;
8578
8579 if (this && test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
8580 /* Mustn't remove devices when resync thread is running */
8581 return 0;
8582
8583 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
8584 if ((this == NULL || rdev == this) &&
8585 rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
8586 !test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags) &&
8587 test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
8588 atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)==0) {
8589 /* Faulty non-Blocked devices with nr_pending == 0
8590 * never get nr_pending incremented,
8591 * never get Faulty cleared, and never get Blocked set.
8592 * So we can synchronize_rcu now rather than once per device
8593 */
8594 remove_some = true;
8595 set_bit(RemoveSynchronized, &rdev->flags);
8596 }
8597 }
8598
8599 if (remove_some)
8600 synchronize_rcu();
8601 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
8602 if ((this == NULL || rdev == this) &&
8603 rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
8604 !test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags) &&
8605 ((test_bit(RemoveSynchronized, &rdev->flags) ||
8606 (!test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
8607 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))) &&
8608 atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)==0)) {
8609 if (mddev->pers->hot_remove_disk(
8610 mddev, rdev) == 0) {
8611 sysfs_unlink_rdev(mddev, rdev);
8612 rdev->saved_raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
8613 rdev->raid_disk = -1;
8614 removed++;
8615 }
8616 }
8617 if (remove_some && test_bit(RemoveSynchronized, &rdev->flags))
8618 clear_bit(RemoveSynchronized, &rdev->flags);
8619 }
8620
8621 if (removed && mddev->kobj.sd)
8622 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "degraded");
8623
8624 if (this && removed)
8625 goto no_add;
8626
8627 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
8628 if (this && this != rdev)
8629 continue;
8630 if (test_bit(Candidate, &rdev->flags))
8631 continue;
8632 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0 &&
8633 !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
8634 !test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags) &&
8635 !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
8636 spares++;
8637 if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
8638 continue;
8639 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
8640 continue;
8641 if (!test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags)) {
8642 if (mddev->ro &&
8643 ! (rdev->saved_raid_disk >= 0 &&
8644 !test_bit(Bitmap_sync, &rdev->flags)))
8645 continue;
8646
8647 rdev->recovery_offset = 0;
8648 }
8649 if (mddev->pers->
8650 hot_add_disk(mddev, rdev) == 0) {
8651 if (sysfs_link_rdev(mddev, rdev))
8652 /* failure here is OK */;
8653 if (!test_bit(Journal, &rdev->flags))
8654 spares++;
8655 md_new_event(mddev);
8656 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
8657 }
8658 }
8659no_add:
8660 if (removed)
8661 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
8662 return spares;
8663}
8664
8665static void md_start_sync(struct work_struct *ws)
8666{
8667 struct mddev *mddev = container_of(ws, struct mddev, del_work);
8668
8669 mddev->sync_thread = md_register_thread(md_do_sync,
8670 mddev,
8671 "resync");
8672 if (!mddev->sync_thread) {
8673 pr_warn("%s: could not start resync thread...\n",
8674 mdname(mddev));
8675 /* leave the spares where they are, it shouldn't hurt */
8676 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
8677 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
8678 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery);
8679 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
8680 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
8681 wake_up(&resync_wait);
8682 if (test_and_clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER,
8683 &mddev->recovery))
8684 if (mddev->sysfs_action)
8685 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
8686 } else
8687 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
8688 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
8689 md_new_event(mddev);
8690}
8691
8692/*
8693 * This routine is regularly called by all per-raid-array threads to
8694 * deal with generic issues like resync and super-block update.
8695 * Raid personalities that don't have a thread (linear/raid0) do not
8696 * need this as they never do any recovery or update the superblock.
8697 *
8698 * It does not do any resync itself, but rather "forks" off other threads
8699 * to do that as needed.
8700 * When it is determined that resync is needed, we set MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING in
8701 * "->recovery" and create a thread at ->sync_thread.
8702 * When the thread finishes it sets MD_RECOVERY_DONE
8703 * and wakeups up this thread which will reap the thread and finish up.
8704 * This thread also removes any faulty devices (with nr_pending == 0).
8705 *
8706 * The overall approach is:
8707 * 1/ if the superblock needs updating, update it.
8708 * 2/ If a recovery thread is running, don't do anything else.
8709 * 3/ If recovery has finished, clean up, possibly marking spares active.
8710 * 4/ If there are any faulty devices, remove them.
8711 * 5/ If array is degraded, try to add spares devices
8712 * 6/ If array has spares or is not in-sync, start a resync thread.
8713 */
8714void md_check_recovery(struct mddev *mddev)
8715{
8716 if (mddev->suspended)
8717 return;
8718
8719 if (mddev->bitmap)
8720 bitmap_daemon_work(mddev);
8721
8722 if (signal_pending(current)) {
8723 if (mddev->pers->sync_request && !mddev->external) {
8724 pr_debug("md: %s in immediate safe mode\n",
8725 mdname(mddev));
8726 mddev->safemode = 2;
8727 }
8728 flush_signals(current);
8729 }
8730
8731 if (mddev->ro && !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery))
8732 return;
8733 if ( ! (
8734 (mddev->sb_flags & ~ (1<<MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING)) ||
8735 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery) ||
8736 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery) ||
8737 (mddev->external == 0 && mddev->safemode == 1) ||
8738 (mddev->safemode == 2
8739 && !mddev->in_sync && mddev->recovery_cp == MaxSector)
8740 ))
8741 return;
8742
8743 if (mddev_trylock(mddev)) {
8744 int spares = 0;
8745
8746 if (!mddev->external && mddev->safemode == 1)
8747 mddev->safemode = 0;
8748
8749 if (mddev->ro) {
8750 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8751 if (!mddev->external && mddev->in_sync)
8752 /* 'Blocked' flag not needed as failed devices
8753 * will be recorded if array switched to read/write.
8754 * Leaving it set will prevent the device
8755 * from being removed.
8756 */
8757 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
8758 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags);
8759 /* On a read-only array we can:
8760 * - remove failed devices
8761 * - add already-in_sync devices if the array itself
8762 * is in-sync.
8763 * As we only add devices that are already in-sync,
8764 * we can activate the spares immediately.
8765 */
8766 remove_and_add_spares(mddev, NULL);
8767 /* There is no thread, but we need to call
8768 * ->spare_active and clear saved_raid_disk
8769 */
8770 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
8771 md_reap_sync_thread(mddev);
8772 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
8773 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
8774 clear_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING, &mddev->sb_flags);
8775 goto unlock;
8776 }
8777
8778 if (mddev_is_clustered(mddev)) {
8779 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8780 /* kick the device if another node issued a
8781 * remove disk.
8782 */
8783 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
8784 if (test_and_clear_bit(ClusterRemove, &rdev->flags) &&
8785 rdev->raid_disk < 0)
8786 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev);
8787 }
8788 }
8789
8790 if (!mddev->external && !mddev->in_sync) {
8791 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
8792 set_in_sync(mddev);
8793 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8794 }
8795
8796 if (mddev->sb_flags)
8797 md_update_sb(mddev, 0);
8798
8799 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery) &&
8800 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery)) {
8801 /* resync/recovery still happening */
8802 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
8803 goto unlock;
8804 }
8805 if (mddev->sync_thread) {
8806 md_reap_sync_thread(mddev);
8807 goto unlock;
8808 }
8809 /* Set RUNNING before clearing NEEDED to avoid
8810 * any transients in the value of "sync_action".
8811 */
8812 mddev->curr_resync_completed = 0;
8813 spin_lock(&mddev->lock);
8814 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
8815 spin_unlock(&mddev->lock);
8816 /* Clear some bits that don't mean anything, but
8817 * might be left set
8818 */
8819 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
8820 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery);
8821
8822 if (!test_and_clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery) ||
8823 test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_FROZEN, &mddev->recovery))
8824 goto not_running;
8825 /* no recovery is running.
8826 * remove any failed drives, then
8827 * add spares if possible.
8828 * Spares are also removed and re-added, to allow
8829 * the personality to fail the re-add.
8830 */
8831
8832 if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector) {
8833 if (mddev->pers->check_reshape == NULL ||
8834 mddev->pers->check_reshape(mddev) != 0)
8835 /* Cannot proceed */
8836 goto not_running;
8837 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
8838 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
8839 } else if ((spares = remove_and_add_spares(mddev, NULL))) {
8840 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
8841 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
8842 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery);
8843 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
8844 } else if (mddev->recovery_cp < MaxSector) {
8845 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
8846 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER, &mddev->recovery);
8847 } else if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery))
8848 /* nothing to be done ... */
8849 goto not_running;
8850
8851 if (mddev->pers->sync_request) {
8852 if (spares) {
8853 /* We are adding a device or devices to an array
8854 * which has the bitmap stored on all devices.
8855 * So make sure all bitmap pages get written
8856 */
8857 bitmap_write_all(mddev->bitmap);
8858 }
8859 INIT_WORK(&mddev->del_work, md_start_sync);
8860 queue_work(md_misc_wq, &mddev->del_work);
8861 goto unlock;
8862 }
8863 not_running:
8864 if (!mddev->sync_thread) {
8865 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
8866 wake_up(&resync_wait);
8867 if (test_and_clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RECOVER,
8868 &mddev->recovery))
8869 if (mddev->sysfs_action)
8870 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
8871 }
8872 unlock:
8873 wake_up(&mddev->sb_wait);
8874 mddev_unlock(mddev);
8875 } else if (test_bit(MD_ALLOW_SB_UPDATE, &mddev->flags) && mddev->sb_flags) {
8876 /* Write superblock - thread that called mddev_suspend()
8877 * holds reconfig_mutex for us.
8878 */
8879 set_bit(MD_UPDATING_SB, &mddev->flags);
8880 smp_mb__after_atomic();
8881 if (test_bit(MD_ALLOW_SB_UPDATE, &mddev->flags))
8882 md_update_sb(mddev, 0);
8883 clear_bit_unlock(MD_UPDATING_SB, &mddev->flags);
8884 wake_up(&mddev->sb_wait);
8885 }
8886}
8887EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_check_recovery);
8888
8889void md_reap_sync_thread(struct mddev *mddev)
8890{
8891 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8892
8893 /* resync has finished, collect result */
8894 md_unregister_thread(&mddev->sync_thread);
8895 if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery) &&
8896 !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery)) {
8897 /* success...*/
8898 /* activate any spares */
8899 if (mddev->pers->spare_active(mddev)) {
8900 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL,
8901 "degraded");
8902 set_bit(MD_SB_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->sb_flags);
8903 }
8904 }
8905 if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery) &&
8906 mddev->pers->finish_reshape)
8907 mddev->pers->finish_reshape(mddev);
8908
8909 /* If array is no-longer degraded, then any saved_raid_disk
8910 * information must be scrapped.
8911 */
8912 if (!mddev->degraded)
8913 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev)
8914 rdev->saved_raid_disk = -1;
8915
8916 md_update_sb(mddev, 1);
8917 /* MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING should be cleared by md_update_sb, so we can
8918 * call resync_finish here if MD_CLUSTER_RESYNC_LOCKED is set by
8919 * clustered raid */
8920 if (test_and_clear_bit(MD_CLUSTER_RESYNC_LOCKED, &mddev->flags))
8921 md_cluster_ops->resync_finish(mddev);
8922 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
8923 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_DONE, &mddev->recovery);
8924 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
8925 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
8926 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery);
8927 clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
8928 wake_up(&resync_wait);
8929 /* flag recovery needed just to double check */
8930 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
8931 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(mddev->sysfs_action);
8932 md_new_event(mddev);
8933 if (mddev->event_work.func)
8934 queue_work(md_misc_wq, &mddev->event_work);
8935}
8936EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_reap_sync_thread);
8937
8938void md_wait_for_blocked_rdev(struct md_rdev *rdev, struct mddev *mddev)
8939{
8940 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
8941 wait_event_timeout(rdev->blocked_wait,
8942 !test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags) &&
8943 !test_bit(BlockedBadBlocks, &rdev->flags),
8944 msecs_to_jiffies(5000));
8945 rdev_dec_pending(rdev, mddev);
8946}
8947EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_wait_for_blocked_rdev);
8948
8949void md_finish_reshape(struct mddev *mddev)
8950{
8951 /* called be personality module when reshape completes. */
8952 struct md_rdev *rdev;
8953
8954 rdev_for_each(rdev, mddev) {
8955 if (rdev->data_offset > rdev->new_data_offset)
8956 rdev->sectors += rdev->data_offset - rdev->new_data_offset;
8957 else
8958 rdev->sectors -= rdev->new_data_offset - rdev->data_offset;
8959 rdev->data_offset = rdev->new_data_offset;
8960 }
8961}
8962EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_finish_reshape);
8963
8964/* Bad block management */
8965
8966/* Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure */
8967int rdev_set_badblocks(struct md_rdev *rdev, sector_t s, int sectors,
8968 int is_new)
8969{
8970 struct mddev *mddev = rdev->mddev;
8971 int rv;
8972 if (is_new)
8973 s += rdev->new_data_offset;
8974 else
8975 s += rdev->data_offset;
8976 rv = badblocks_set(&rdev->badblocks, s, sectors, 0);
8977 if (rv == 0) {
8978 /* Make sure they get written out promptly */
8979 if (test_bit(ExternalBbl, &rdev->flags))
8980 sysfs_notify(&rdev->kobj, NULL,
8981 "unacknowledged_bad_blocks");
8982 sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(rdev->sysfs_state);
8983 set_mask_bits(&mddev->sb_flags, 0,
8984 BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_CLEAN) | BIT(MD_SB_CHANGE_PENDING));
8985 md_wakeup_thread(rdev->mddev->thread);
8986 return 1;
8987 } else
8988 return 0;
8989}
8990EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(rdev_set_badblocks);
8991
8992int rdev_clear_badblocks(struct md_rdev *rdev, sector_t s, int sectors,
8993 int is_new)
8994{
8995 int rv;
8996 if (is_new)
8997 s += rdev->new_data_offset;
8998 else
8999 s += rdev->data_offset;
9000 rv = badblocks_clear(&rdev->badblocks, s, sectors);
9001 if ((rv == 0) && test_bit(ExternalBbl, &rdev->flags))
9002 sysfs_notify(&rdev->kobj, NULL, "bad_blocks");
9003 return rv;
9004}
9005EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(rdev_clear_badblocks);
9006
9007static int md_notify_reboot(struct notifier_block *this,
9008 unsigned long code, void *x)
9009{
9010 struct list_head *tmp;
9011 struct mddev *mddev;
9012 int need_delay = 0;
9013
9014 for_each_mddev(mddev, tmp) {
9015 if (mddev_trylock(mddev)) {
9016 if (mddev->pers)
9017 __md_stop_writes(mddev);
9018 if (mddev->persistent)
9019 mddev->safemode = 2;
9020 mddev_unlock(mddev);
9021 }
9022 need_delay = 1;
9023 }
9024 /*
9025 * certain more exotic SCSI devices are known to be
9026 * volatile wrt too early system reboots. While the
9027 * right place to handle this issue is the given
9028 * driver, we do want to have a safe RAID driver ...
9029 */
9030 if (need_delay)
9031 mdelay(1000*1);
9032
9033 return NOTIFY_DONE;
9034}
9035
9036static struct notifier_block md_notifier = {
9037 .notifier_call = md_notify_reboot,
9038 .next = NULL,
9039 .priority = INT_MAX, /* before any real devices */
9040};
9041
9042static void md_geninit(void)
9043{
9044 pr_debug("md: sizeof(mdp_super_t) = %d\n", (int)sizeof(mdp_super_t));
9045
9046 proc_create("mdstat", S_IRUGO, NULL, &md_seq_fops);
9047}
9048
9049static int __init md_init(void)
9050{
9051 int ret = -ENOMEM;
9052
9053 md_wq = alloc_workqueue("md", WQ_MEM_RECLAIM, 0);
9054 if (!md_wq)
9055 goto err_wq;
9056
9057 md_misc_wq = alloc_workqueue("md_misc", 0, 0);
9058 if (!md_misc_wq)
9059 goto err_misc_wq;
9060
9061 if ((ret = register_blkdev(MD_MAJOR, "md")) < 0)
9062 goto err_md;
9063
9064 if ((ret = register_blkdev(0, "mdp")) < 0)
9065 goto err_mdp;
9066 mdp_major = ret;
9067
9068 blk_register_region(MKDEV(MD_MAJOR, 0), 512, THIS_MODULE,
9069 md_probe, NULL, NULL);
9070 blk_register_region(MKDEV(mdp_major, 0), 1UL<<MINORBITS, THIS_MODULE,
9071 md_probe, NULL, NULL);
9072
9073 register_reboot_notifier(&md_notifier);
9074 raid_table_header = register_sysctl_table(raid_root_table);
9075
9076 md_geninit();
9077 return 0;
9078
9079err_mdp:
9080 unregister_blkdev(MD_MAJOR, "md");
9081err_md:
9082 destroy_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
9083err_misc_wq:
9084 destroy_workqueue(md_wq);
9085err_wq:
9086 return ret;
9087}
9088
9089static void check_sb_changes(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
9090{
9091 struct mdp_superblock_1 *sb = page_address(rdev->sb_page);
9092 struct md_rdev *rdev2;
9093 int role, ret;
9094 char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
9095
9096 /*
9097 * If size is changed in another node then we need to
9098 * do resize as well.
9099 */
9100 if (mddev->dev_sectors != le64_to_cpu(sb->size)) {
9101 ret = mddev->pers->resize(mddev, le64_to_cpu(sb->size));
9102 if (ret)
9103 pr_info("md-cluster: resize failed\n");
9104 else
9105 bitmap_update_sb(mddev->bitmap);
9106 }
9107
9108 /* Check for change of roles in the active devices */
9109 rdev_for_each(rdev2, mddev) {
9110 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev2->flags))
9111 continue;
9112
9113 /* Check if the roles changed */
9114 role = le16_to_cpu(sb->dev_roles[rdev2->desc_nr]);
9115
9116 if (test_bit(Candidate, &rdev2->flags)) {
9117 if (role == 0xfffe) {
9118 pr_info("md: Removing Candidate device %s because add failed\n", bdevname(rdev2->bdev,b));
9119 md_kick_rdev_from_array(rdev2);
9120 continue;
9121 }
9122 else
9123 clear_bit(Candidate, &rdev2->flags);
9124 }
9125
9126 if (role != rdev2->raid_disk) {
9127 /* got activated */
9128 if (rdev2->raid_disk == -1 && role != 0xffff) {
9129 rdev2->saved_raid_disk = role;
9130 ret = remove_and_add_spares(mddev, rdev2);
9131 pr_info("Activated spare: %s\n",
9132 bdevname(rdev2->bdev,b));
9133 /* wakeup mddev->thread here, so array could
9134 * perform resync with the new activated disk */
9135 set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
9136 md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
9137
9138 }
9139 /* device faulty
9140 * We just want to do the minimum to mark the disk
9141 * as faulty. The recovery is performed by the
9142 * one who initiated the error.
9143 */
9144 if ((role == 0xfffe) || (role == 0xfffd)) {
9145 md_error(mddev, rdev2);
9146 clear_bit(Blocked, &rdev2->flags);
9147 }
9148 }
9149 }
9150
9151 if (mddev->raid_disks != le32_to_cpu(sb->raid_disks))
9152 update_raid_disks(mddev, le32_to_cpu(sb->raid_disks));
9153
9154 /* Finally set the event to be up to date */
9155 mddev->events = le64_to_cpu(sb->events);
9156}
9157
9158static int read_rdev(struct mddev *mddev, struct md_rdev *rdev)
9159{
9160 int err;
9161 struct page *swapout = rdev->sb_page;
9162 struct mdp_superblock_1 *sb;
9163
9164 /* Store the sb page of the rdev in the swapout temporary
9165 * variable in case we err in the future
9166 */
9167 rdev->sb_page = NULL;
9168 err = alloc_disk_sb(rdev);
9169 if (err == 0) {
9170 ClearPageUptodate(rdev->sb_page);
9171 rdev->sb_loaded = 0;
9172 err = super_types[mddev->major_version].
9173 load_super(rdev, NULL, mddev->minor_version);
9174 }
9175 if (err < 0) {
9176 pr_warn("%s: %d Could not reload rdev(%d) err: %d. Restoring old values\n",
9177 __func__, __LINE__, rdev->desc_nr, err);
9178 if (rdev->sb_page)
9179 put_page(rdev->sb_page);
9180 rdev->sb_page = swapout;
9181 rdev->sb_loaded = 1;
9182 return err;
9183 }
9184
9185 sb = page_address(rdev->sb_page);
9186 /* Read the offset unconditionally, even if MD_FEATURE_RECOVERY_OFFSET
9187 * is not set
9188 */
9189
9190 if ((le32_to_cpu(sb->feature_map) & MD_FEATURE_RECOVERY_OFFSET))
9191 rdev->recovery_offset = le64_to_cpu(sb->recovery_offset);
9192
9193 /* The other node finished recovery, call spare_active to set
9194 * device In_sync and mddev->degraded
9195 */
9196 if (rdev->recovery_offset == MaxSector &&
9197 !test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) &&
9198 mddev->pers->spare_active(mddev))
9199 sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "degraded");
9200
9201 put_page(swapout);
9202 return 0;
9203}
9204
9205void md_reload_sb(struct mddev *mddev, int nr)
9206{
9207 struct md_rdev *rdev;
9208 int err;
9209
9210 /* Find the rdev */
9211 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev) {
9212 if (rdev->desc_nr == nr)
9213 break;
9214 }
9215
9216 if (!rdev || rdev->desc_nr != nr) {
9217 pr_warn("%s: %d Could not find rdev with nr %d\n", __func__, __LINE__, nr);
9218 return;
9219 }
9220
9221 err = read_rdev(mddev, rdev);
9222 if (err < 0)
9223 return;
9224
9225 check_sb_changes(mddev, rdev);
9226
9227 /* Read all rdev's to update recovery_offset */
9228 rdev_for_each_rcu(rdev, mddev)
9229 read_rdev(mddev, rdev);
9230}
9231EXPORT_SYMBOL(md_reload_sb);
9232
9233#ifndef MODULE
9234
9235/*
9236 * Searches all registered partitions for autorun RAID arrays
9237 * at boot time.
9238 */
9239
9240static DEFINE_MUTEX(detected_devices_mutex);
9241static LIST_HEAD(all_detected_devices);
9242struct detected_devices_node {
9243 struct list_head list;
9244 dev_t dev;
9245};
9246
9247void md_autodetect_dev(dev_t dev)
9248{
9249 struct detected_devices_node *node_detected_dev;
9250
9251 node_detected_dev = kzalloc(sizeof(*node_detected_dev), GFP_KERNEL);
9252 if (node_detected_dev) {
9253 node_detected_dev->dev = dev;
9254 mutex_lock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9255 list_add_tail(&node_detected_dev->list, &all_detected_devices);
9256 mutex_unlock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9257 }
9258}
9259
9260static void autostart_arrays(int part)
9261{
9262 struct md_rdev *rdev;
9263 struct detected_devices_node *node_detected_dev;
9264 dev_t dev;
9265 int i_scanned, i_passed;
9266
9267 i_scanned = 0;
9268 i_passed = 0;
9269
9270 pr_info("md: Autodetecting RAID arrays.\n");
9271
9272 mutex_lock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9273 while (!list_empty(&all_detected_devices) && i_scanned < INT_MAX) {
9274 i_scanned++;
9275 node_detected_dev = list_entry(all_detected_devices.next,
9276 struct detected_devices_node, list);
9277 list_del(&node_detected_dev->list);
9278 dev = node_detected_dev->dev;
9279 kfree(node_detected_dev);
9280 mutex_unlock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9281 rdev = md_import_device(dev,0, 90);
9282 mutex_lock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9283 if (IS_ERR(rdev))
9284 continue;
9285
9286 if (test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
9287 continue;
9288
9289 set_bit(AutoDetected, &rdev->flags);
9290 list_add(&rdev->same_set, &pending_raid_disks);
9291 i_passed++;
9292 }
9293 mutex_unlock(&detected_devices_mutex);
9294
9295 pr_debug("md: Scanned %d and added %d devices.\n", i_scanned, i_passed);
9296
9297 autorun_devices(part);
9298}
9299
9300#endif /* !MODULE */
9301
9302static __exit void md_exit(void)
9303{
9304 struct mddev *mddev;
9305 struct list_head *tmp;
9306 int delay = 1;
9307
9308 blk_unregister_region(MKDEV(MD_MAJOR,0), 512);
9309 blk_unregister_region(MKDEV(mdp_major,0), 1U << MINORBITS);
9310
9311 unregister_blkdev(MD_MAJOR,"md");
9312 unregister_blkdev(mdp_major, "mdp");
9313 unregister_reboot_notifier(&md_notifier);
9314 unregister_sysctl_table(raid_table_header);
9315
9316 /* We cannot unload the modules while some process is
9317 * waiting for us in select() or poll() - wake them up
9318 */
9319 md_unloading = 1;
9320 while (waitqueue_active(&md_event_waiters)) {
9321 /* not safe to leave yet */
9322 wake_up(&md_event_waiters);
9323 msleep(delay);
9324 delay += delay;
9325 }
9326 remove_proc_entry("mdstat", NULL);
9327
9328 for_each_mddev(mddev, tmp) {
9329 export_array(mddev);
9330 mddev->ctime = 0;
9331 mddev->hold_active = 0;
9332 /*
9333 * for_each_mddev() will call mddev_put() at the end of each
9334 * iteration. As the mddev is now fully clear, this will
9335 * schedule the mddev for destruction by a workqueue, and the
9336 * destroy_workqueue() below will wait for that to complete.
9337 */
9338 }
9339 destroy_workqueue(md_misc_wq);
9340 destroy_workqueue(md_wq);
9341}
9342
9343subsys_initcall(md_init);
9344module_exit(md_exit)
9345
9346static int get_ro(char *buffer, struct kernel_param *kp)
9347{
9348 return sprintf(buffer, "%d", start_readonly);
9349}
9350static int set_ro(const char *val, struct kernel_param *kp)
9351{
9352 return kstrtouint(val, 10, (unsigned int *)&start_readonly);
9353}
9354
9355module_param_call(start_ro, set_ro, get_ro, NULL, S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR);
9356module_param(start_dirty_degraded, int, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR);
9357module_param_call(new_array, add_named_array, NULL, NULL, S_IWUSR);
9358module_param(create_on_open, bool, S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR);
9359
9360MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
9361MODULE_DESCRIPTION("MD RAID framework");
9362MODULE_ALIAS("md");
9363MODULE_ALIAS_BLOCKDEV_MAJOR(MD_MAJOR);
9364
